SourceText: Great! So good to hear you are in a positive space.
text: Hongera! ni vizuri sana kusikia uko katika nafasi nzuri

SourceText: Things are not always easy. But that is how we can grow and learn every day!
text: Mambo si rahisi kila wakati. Lakini hivyo ndivyo tunavyoweza kukua na kujifunza kila siku!

SourceText: Life can be hard. Whatever you are feeling, you can be proud of yourself for being here!
text: Maisha yanaweza kuwa magumu. Vyovyote unavyohisi, unaweza kujivunia kuwa hapa!

SourceText: You matter! Take a moment to check in with yourself.
text: Wewe ni wa muhimu! Chukua muda kujiangalia wewe mwenyewe.

SourceText: Great to hear that you are doing well. You are a wonderful parent!
text: Inafurahisha sana kusikia kuwa unaendelea vizuri. Wewe ni mzazi mzuri sana!

SourceText: Sorry that you are not having the best day. Well done for trying to figure everything out. Nobody has all the answers but you really do your best!
text: Pole kwa sababu leo siyo siku nzuri sana kwako. Hongera kwa kujaribu kuelewa kila kitu. Hakuna ajuaye kila kitu, lakini kwa kweli unajitahidi kwa kadri uwezavyo!

SourceText: Sorry to hear that you are not having a good day. Well done for getting up every morning and trying again, even when you are tired. That is real courage and dedication!
text: Tunasikitika kusikia kwamba leo siyo siku nzuri kwako. Hongera kwa kuamka kila asubuhi na kujaribu tena, hata unapokuwa umechoka. Huo ni ujasiri wa kweli na kujitoa kwa dhati!

SourceText: Recognising how you feel helps you care for yourself well. You deserve it.
text: Kutambua jinsi unavyohisi husaidia kujijali vizuri. Unastahili.

SourceText: Wonderful, I am so happy! Keep up the good work.
text: Vizuri, nimefurahi sana! Endeleza kazi hiyo nzuri.

SourceText: Sorry that things are difficult. All families struggle. @global.app_name is here to help!
text: Pole kwa mambo kuwa magumu. Familia zote zinapambana. @global.app_name iko hapa kukusaidia!
note: The string @global.app_name should not be translated.

SourceText: Whatever went ‘wrong’ today, let it go and try again tomorrow. It is okay!
text: Jambo lolote lililoenda 'vibaya' leo, hebu lisahau na ujaribu tena kesho. Itakuwa sawa!

SourceText: Looking after yourself matters. And how you feel matters too!
text: Kujitunza ni muhimu. Na jinsi unavyohisi ni muhimu pia!

SourceText: Sometimes things go great. Sometimes they do not. And sometimes we do not quite know what to think... and that is totally okay! Remember that you are not alone.
text: Wakati mwingine mambo huenda vizuri sana. Wakati mwingine hayaendi vizuri sana. Na wakati mwingine hatujui kabisa cha kufanya... na hii ni sawa kabisa! Kumbuka kwamba hauko peke yako.

SourceText: Sorry that things are hard right now. You deserve good things and @global.app_name is here to support you every step of the way.
text: Samahani kwamba mambo ni magumu kwa sasa. Unastahili mambo mazuri, na @global.app_name iko hapa kukusaidia kila hatua unayopiga.
note: The string @global.app_name should not be translated.

SourceText: Caring for yourself is so essential. When you know how you feel, you can see what you need.
text: Kujijali ni muhimu sana. Unapojua jinsi unavyohisi, unaweza kuona kile unachohitaji.

SourceText: Wonderful, I am so happy things are going well. Keep up the good work.
text: Ni jambo la kuvutia sana, ninafurahi sana mambo kuona yanaenda vizuri. Endeleza kazi hii nzuri.

SourceText: We all have better and worse days. The fact that you are here shows courage and commitment!
text: Sisi sote tuna siku nzuri na mbaya zaidi. Ukweli ni kwamba uko hapa unaonyesha ujasiri na kujitolea!

SourceText: Remember that YOU matter! Let’s check in with our emotions first.
text: Kumbuka kwamba wewe ni muhimu! Hebu tuangalie hisia zetu kwanza.

SourceText: Well done for recognising a positive feeling. I am happy to hear you are feeling well today!
text: Hongera kwa kutambua hisia chanya. Nimefurahi kusikia kwamba unajisikia vizuri leo!

SourceText: Well done for recognising that you are not feeling great. Be kind to yourself, you deserve it.
text: Umefanya vizuri kwa kutambua kuwa hujisikii vizuri. Unastahili kuwa mwema kwako mwenyewe.

SourceText: Well done for recognising a difficult feeling. It is okay not to be okay sometimes. Remember @global.app_name is here to support you.
text: Umefanya vizuri kutambua hisia ngumu. Ni sawa kutokuwa sawa wakati mwingine. Kumbuka @global.app_name iko hapa kukusaidia.
note: The string @global.app_name should not be translated.

SourceText: Recognising how you feel is key to handling life well. Be real and kind to yourself.
text: Kutambua jinsi unavyohisi ni muhimu ili kushughulikia maisha vizuri. Kuwa halisi na mkarimu kwako mwenyewe.

SourceText: You are a star. And you are making a real difference. You can be proud of yourself.
text: Wewe ni shujaa. Na unaleta mabadiliko ya kweli. Unaweza kujivunia mwenyewe.

SourceText: Everyone has good and bad days. Well done for using this app. It shows you are a committed parent. Remember to praise yourself for it!
text: Kila mtu ana siku nzuri na mbaya. Umefanya vizuri kutumia programu hii. Inaonyesha wewe ni mzazi unayejituma. Kumbuka kujipongeza kwa hilo!

SourceText: Sorry that things are not easy today. All parents have these days. You are trying and moving forward!
text: Pole kama mambo si rahisi leo. Wazazi wote wana siku kama hizi. Unajaribu na kusonga mbele!

SourceText: Taking a moment for YOU makes a big difference for everyone!
text: Kuchukua muda kwa ajili yako mwenyewe huleta mabadiliko makubwa kwa kila mtu!

SourceText: Great that today is going well! What is one thing that has gone well today? Remember to praise yourself for it.
text: Ni jambo zuri sana kwamba leo inaenda vizuri! Je, ni jambo gani moja ambalo limeenda vizuri leo? Kumbuka kujisifia kwa hilo.

SourceText: Every day has its good and hard parts. Praise yourself for everything you have done so far – you are amazing.
text: Kila siku ina nyakati zake nzuri na ngumu. Jisifu kwa kila kitu ambacho umefanya hadi sasa – wewe unastaajabisha.

SourceText: Sorry to hear you are feeling difficult feelings today. Well done for recognising those emotions and trying to be calm and kind to yourself. You are setting a great example for your family.
text: Tunasikitika kusikia kuwa leo unajisikia vibaya. Hongera kwa kutambua hisia hizo, na kujaribu kuwa mtulivu na kuwa mwema kwako mwenyewe. Unaweka mfano mzuri kwa familia yako.

SourceText: Looking after yourself well starts with noticing how you feel.
text: Kujithamini huanza kwa kutambua namna unavyojisikia.

SourceText: Fantastic! And well done for investing in yourself and your family – you have accomplished a lot.
text: Hongera! umefanya vizuri kuwekeza kwako na familia yako – umefanikisha mengi.

SourceText: Sorry that you are not having the best day. Well done for trying to figure everything out. @global.app_name is here to help.
text: Pole kwa kutokuwa na siku nzuri zaidi. Umefanya vizuri kwa kujaribu kubaini kila kitu. @global.app_name iko hapa kukusaidia.
note: The string @global.app_name should not be translated.

SourceText: Being a parent can be challenging. Take a deep breath and recognise all you have done for your family – you deserve praise!
text: Kuwa mzazi kunaweza kuwa changamoto. Vuta pumzi na tambua yote uliyoifanyia familia yako – unastahili kusifiwa!

SourceText: Take a moment to notice how you are doing.
text: Chukua muda kuona jinsi unavyojisikia.

SourceText: Great! So good to hear that you are in a good space today. What a wonderful feeling!
text: Safi sana! Tunafurahi sana kusikia kwamba hali yako ni nzuri leo. Furaha iliyoje!

SourceText: There is no right or wrong way to feel. However you are feeling, it is okay.
text: Hakuna njia sahihi au mbaya ya kuhisi. Kwa namna yeyote unayojisikia, ni sawa.

SourceText: Well done for recognising how you feel. Good to hear that you are feeling well today!
text: Hongera kwa kutambua unavyojisikia. Nimefurahi kusikia kwamba unajisikia vizuri leo!

SourceText: We all have good and hard days. Remember, you are the best parent for your teen and you deserve praise!
text: Sisi sote tuna siku nzuri na siku ngumu. Kumbuka, wewe ni mzazi bora kwa kijana wako na unastahili pongezi!

SourceText: It can be hard to cope with everything happening in our lives. Remember, you are stronger than you may think!
text: Inaweza kuwa vigumu kukabiliana na kila kitu kinachotokea katika maisha yetu. Kumbuka, una nguvu kuliko unavyoweza kufikiria!

SourceText: Let’s take a moment for YOU. Looking after yourself well starts with noticing how you feel.
text: Hebu tuchukue muda kwa ajili YAKO. Kujitunza vizuri huanza na kugundua jinsi unavyohisi.

SourceText: Amazing, life is the best when you're feeling good.
text: Ni vyema, maisha ni bora wakati unajisikia vizuri.

SourceText: Everyone has times when they are not feeling good. This is completely normal. Hopefully you feel better soon.
text: Kila mtu ana wakati ambapo hajisikii vizuri. Hii ni kawaida kabisa. Natumaini kwamba utajisikia vizuri punde.

SourceText: It is part of life to have bad days. Always remember, tough times never last and tomorrow is another day!
text: Ni sehemu ya maisha kuwa na siku mbaya. Kumbuka kila wakati, nyakati ngumu kamwe hazidumu na kesho ni siku nyingine!

text: Soma

text: Cheza

text: ONGEA

SourceText: Words are powerful. What you say to your child and how you say it makes a difference.
text: Maneno yana nguvu!. Unachosema kwa mtoto wako na jinsi unavyosema inaleta tofauti.

SourceText: Well done for finishing the TALK module!
text: Umefanya vizuri kumalizia moduli ya ZUNGUMZA!

SourceText: Help your child build skills to deal with challenges.
text: Msaidie mtoto wako kujenga juzi za kushughulikia changamoto.

SourceText: Well done for finishing the BUILD module!
text: Umefanya vizuri kumaliza mada ya KUJENGA!

SourceText: Support your child to explore and learn from the world around them.
text: Msaidie mtoto wako kuchunguza na kujifunza kutoka dunia inayowazunguka.

SourceText: Well done for finishing the EXPLORE module!
text: Umefanya vizuri kumaliza mada ya CHUNGUZA!

SourceText: CARE

SourceText: Caring for yourself and caring for others go hand-in-hand.
text: Kujijali wewe mwenyewe na kujali wengine vinaenda pamoja.

SourceText: Well done for finishing the CARE module!
text: Umefanya vizuri kumaliza mada ya KUJALI!

SourceText: Partners
text: Washirika

SourceText: Donors
text: Wafadhili

SourceText: The Things That Make Me Happy
text: Mambo yanayofanya niwe na furaha

SourceText: Think about something that brought you joy this week. Look for objects around your house that represent what made you happy and share it with your family.
text: Fikiria kuhusu kitu fulani ambacho kilikuleltea furaha wiki hii. Tafuta vitu kwenye maeneo ya nyumba yako ambacho kinawakililisha kitu kilichofanya uwe na furaha na shirikisha familia yako.

SourceText: Box; basket; container; bucket; bag; other available objects
text: Boksi, kikapu, chombo, ndoo, begi, vitu vingine vinavyopatikana

SourceText:
1. Ask each person to think about something that made them happy this week – it can be an activity they enjoyed, a person they interacted with, something they learned. 
2. Place a box or container in the middle of the room, and invite each person to find objects around the house that can represent what made them happy. For example – a spoon could represent something they enjoyed eating. A ball could represent a fun activity they enjoyed. A pencil or book could represent something they learned. 
3. Ask them to place their objects in the box. Once everyone has added their objects, give each person a turn to show their object to the group, share why they chose it and why this represents something that made them happy.
text:
1. Mwambie kila mtu afikirie kuhusu kitu fulani ambacho kiliwafanya wawe na furaha wiki hii – inaweza kuwa shughuli waliyoifurahia, mtu waliyechangamana naye, kitu fulani walichojifunza.
2. Weka boksi au chombo katikati ya chumba, na karibisha kila mtu atafute kitu kwenye mazingira ya nyumba ambacho kinaweza kuwakilisha kile kilichowafanya wawe na furaha, Kwa mfano – kijiko kinaweza kuwakilisha kitu walichofurahia kula. Mpira unaweza kuwakilisha shughuli waliyoifurahia. Penseli au kitabu vinaweza kuwakilisha kitu fulani walichojifunza.
3. Waambie waweke vitu vyao kwenye boksi. Mara kila mmoja atapokuwa ameweka vitu vyao, mpe kila mtu zamu kuonesha kundi vitu vyao, washirikishe kwanini walichagua hiyo na kwanini inawakilisha kitu fulani kilichowafurahisha.

SourceText:
* If someone can’t find a suitable object, they can draw something on a piece of paper and place it in the box.  
* For younger children, you might need to discuss some examples and ideas for objects before starting the game in a group context.
text: * Kama mmoja hawezi kupata kitu kinachofaa, wanaweza kuchora kitu fulani kwenye kipande cha karatasi na kuweka ndani ya boksi.

SourceText: Gardening
text: Shughuli za bustani

SourceText: Gardening together is a fun way to spend quality time with your child and involve all their senses. It is also useful for them to learn how to grow food.
text: Kutengeneza bustani kwa pamoja ni njia ya kufuruhisha ya kutumia muda vizuri pamoja na mtoto wako na kuhusisha milango yao yote ya fahamu. Pia ni muhimu kwao kujifunza jinsi ya kulima chakula.

SourceText:
1. **Choose some plants:** Ask your child to help you choose some plants to grow in the garden. This will make them feel involved. You could choose plants you can eat, like vegetables or herbs, which you can grow and then cook together.
2. **Get creative with containers:** You do not need lots of space to plant a garden. You can use old broken buckets, tin cans, or even plastic bottles as pots to plant in.
3. **Plant the seeds:** Make planting a fun activity. Take turns making the holes, planting the seeds in the soil, and watering them. 
4. **Water and care for the plants:** Create a time table for watering and caring for the plants, and support your child to stay involved. 
5. **Watch the plants grow:** Discuss with your child the changes you see every week to see how much the plants have grown.
text:
1.**Chagua baadhi ya mimea: Mwambie mtoto wako akusaidie kuchagua baadhi ya mimea ya kupanda kwenye bustani. Hii itawafanya wajiskie kushirikishwa, unaweza kuchagua mimea ambayo unaweza kula kama mboga au dawa. ambayo unaweza kupanda na kisha kupika pamoja.
2.**Kuwa mbunifu wa kutumia vyombo: Huhitaji kuwa na nafasi kubwa ya kupanda bustani, unaweza kutumia hata ndoo zilizopasuka, makopo ya bati na hata chupa za plastic kama vyungu vya kupandia.
3.**Panda Mbegu: Ifanye shughuli ya kupanda iwe ya kufurahisha. Fanyeni zamu kuchimba mashimo, kupanda mbegu kwenye udongo na kumwagilia.
4.** Kumwagilia na kutunza mimea: Tengeneza ratiba ya kumwagilia na kutunza mimea na msaidie mtoto wako ili aendelee kushiriki.
5.**Angalia ukuaji wa mimea: Jadili na mtoto wako mabadiliko unayoyaona kila wiki kuona ni kwa kiasi gani mmea umekua.

SourceText:
* Let your child make some of the decisions, like where to dig the holes or which container to plant in.
* Make gardening social by inviting friends or family to join the fun.
text:
* Ruhusu mtoto wako afanye baadhi ya maamuzi, kama vile sehemu ya kuchimba mashimo, kontena gani apandie
* Fanya bustani iwe ya kijamii kwa kuwaalika marafiki au wanafamilia kujiunga na burudani.

SourceText: Something Special
text: Kitu maalumu

SourceText: Small acts of kindness can have a big impact. This activity helps children to think about others and what they can do to bring joy to someone’s day.
text: Matendo madogo ya ukarimu yanaweza kuwa na matokeo makubwa. Shughuli hii inawasaidia watoto kufikiria kuhusu wengine na kile wanachoweza kufanya ili kuleta furaha kwenye siku kwa wengine.

SourceText:
Together with your child, think of something special you could do for someone at home or in your community to put a smile on their face.
1. **Choose a person.** Discuss with your child who you think might appreciate an act of kindness. 
2. **Discuss the options together.** For example: *“Mama has been feeling so tired taking care of baby sister and never gets time to make herself tea. What do you think we could do for her?” or “I see that xx next door struggles to care for her garden. What do you think we can do to help?”*
3. **Support your child to contribute.** Help your child to choose what they can do. It doesn’t have to be big – all that matters is that they are part of the activity in some way.
4. **Praise your child** for helping to bring joy to someone’s day. This will encourage them to do it again in future.
text:
Pamoja na mtoto wako, fikiria kitu maalum ambacho unaweza kufanya kwa ajili ya mtu flani nyumbani au katika jamii yako kuweka tabasamu kwenye nyuso zao.. 
1.**Chagua mtu. Jadili na mtoto wako unadhani ni nani anaweza kuthamini matendo ya ukarimu 
2.**Jadili chaguzi pamoja: Kwa mfano: “Mama amekuwa akijiskia kuchoka kumhudumia mtoto na hajapata hata muda kujitengenezea chai. Unafikiri tunaweza kufanya nini kwa ajili yake?” au “ Naona yule xx karibu na mlango anahangaika kuhudumia bustani yake. Unafikiri tunaweza kufanya nini kusaidia?”
3.**Msaidie mtoto wako kuchangia. Msaidie mtoto wako kuchagua wanachoweza kufanya. Sio mpaka kiwe kikubwa - kinachotakiwa ni wao wawe ni sehemu ya shughuli kwa jinsi flani
4.**Msifie mtoto wako kwaajili ya kusaidia kuleta furaha kwenye siku ya mtu flani. Hii itawasaidia kufanya tena siku za baadae.

SourceText:
* Your child’s involvement will vary with age, but even a three year old can add a scribble or drawing to a card, hand over a flower, or join in a song.  
* Try not to force your child or punish them if they feel shy or don’t want to participate. Rather try again another time.
text:
*Ushiriki wa mtoto wako utategemena na umri, lakini hata mwenye umri wa miaka mitatu anaweza kuandika au kuchora kwenye kadi, kutoa ua, au kujiunga kwenye wimbo. 
*Jaribu kutolazimisha mtoto wako au kuwaadhibu ikiwa wanajisikia aibu au hawataki kushiriki. Badala yake jaribu tena wakati mwingine.

SourceText: What Makes Us Special
text: Nini kinatufanya tuwe Maalum

SourceText: All children have strengths that make them special and unique. Telling your child what you appreciate about them helps them feel valued and confident. This shows them to recognise strengths in others too.
text: Kila mtoto ana uwezo unaofanya wawe maalum na wa kipekee. Kumwambia mtoto wako unachokikubali kuhusu wao inawasaidia kujiskia wamethaminiwa na kujiamini. Hii inawawezesha kutambua uwezo wa wengine pia.

SourceText:
Talk to your child about the things you appreciate about them or that makes them special. You could talk about their strengths, or about areas where your child makes an effort. Here are some examples:
1. **Their name:** Talk about the meaning of your child’s name and why you chose it for them. 
2. **Their physical abilities:** Does your child enjoy running? Climbing? Are they good at carrying things? Sitting still when they need to? 
3. **Social skills:** Do they try to share even when it’s hard? Do they help out around the house or think of fun games to play with their friends? 
4. **Time together:** Tell your child about a particular activity that you enjoy doing with them and why it brings you joy.
text:
Zungumza na mtoto wako kuhusu mambo unayoyakubali kuhusu wao au yale yanayofanya wawe maalum. Unaweza kuzungumza kuhusu uwezo wao, au kuhusu maeneo ambayo mtoto wako anayafanyia jitihada. Hii ni baadhi ya mifano:
1.**Jina lao.** Zungumza kuhusu maana ya jina la mtoto wako na kwanini ulimchagulia jina hilo. 
2** Uwezo wao kimwili: Je, mtoto wako anafurahia kukimbia? kupanda? Wako vizuri katika kubeba vitu? Wanakaa kwa utulivu inapohitajika? 
3.** Stadi za kijamii. **Wanajaribu kushirikisha hata ikiwa ni vigumu? Wanasaidia kazi za nyumbani au kufikiria michezo ya kufurahasha kucheza na rafiki zao? 
4.**Muda wa pamoja.** Mwambie mtoto wako kuhusu shughuli maalum ambayo unafurahia kufanya nao na kwanini inakuletea furaha.

SourceText:
* Ask your child to add to the discussion. What do they like about themselves? What do they feel they do really well?
* You could also ask them to draw themselves on a piece of paper or in the sand and point out their strengths in different areas (tells great stories; sees when others need help; likes building things with their hands; good at dancing etc.)
* This activity can help when your child is having a difficult day, or as a way to connect after you have been feeling angry or frustrated with them.
text:
*Muombe mtoto wako kuongeza kwenye mjadala. Nini wanapenda kuhusu wao wenyewe? Wananajiskia wanaweza kufanya nini vizuri sana?
*Ungeweza pia kuomba wajichore kwenye kipande cha karatasi au kwenye mchanga na kuonesha uwezo wao katika maeneo mbalimbali ( wasimulie hadithi nzuri, waone pale wengine wanaohitaji msaada: kama kupenda kujenga vitu kwa mikono yao; wazuri kwenye kucheza n. k)
*Shughuli hii inawezasaidia wakati mtoto wako anapokuwa na siku ngumu, au ni jinsi ya kujiunga baada ya kujiskia hasira au kuchanganyikiwa.

SourceText: Pattern Play
text: Mchezo wa kuunganisha

SourceText: Create patterns with everyday objects around the house. This is a great way to develop your child’s learning skills while having fun together.
text: Tengeneza viunganishi kwa vitu vilivyopo maeneo ya nyumbani. Hii ni njia nzuri ya kuanzisha stadi za kujifunza za mtoto wako huku mkifurahi pamoja.

SourceText: 1. Collect different objects that have different colours, shapes, textures or purposes. These can include bottle caps, leaves, rocks, beads, sticks, utensils. Make sure you have enough of each type so that you can create a pattern.
text: 1. Kusanya vitu tofauti ambavyo vina rangi tofauti, maumbo, miundo au malengo. Hizi zinaweza jumuisha vifuniko vya chupa, majani, miamba, shanga, fimbo, vyombo. Hakikisha una kila aina ya kutosha ili uweze kutengeneza muundo.

SourceText: 2. Help your child to sort through all the objects to create categories, based on colour, shape, texture (soft or hard), or weight (light or heavy).
text: 2. Msaidie ntoto wako kuchambua vitu vyote kutengeneza makundi, kulingana na rangi, umbo, muundo kama (laini au ngumu), au kuipima (nyepesi au nzito).

SourceText: 3. Or, you could create a pattern for your child (2 sticks, 1 rock, 3 leaves, 2 sticks, 1 rock, 2 leaves), and ask them to recreate the same pattern.
text: 3. Au, unaweza kutengeneza muundo kwaajili ya mtoto wako ( fimbo 2, jiwe, majani 3, majani 2), na waambie watengeneze muundo huo huo.

SourceText:
* You can invite your child to go outside and collect their own objects according to different patterns (such as leaves of different colours and sizes, or sticks of different lengths). You can also use these objects to create drawings. 
* You can also create patterns with movement. For example, start with a pattern like “clap, click, turn around, repeat” and have your child do the same.
text:
* Unaweza kumwambia mtoto wako aende nje na akusanye vitu vyao kulingana na miunganiko tofauti (kama majani ya rangi tofauti na ukubwa, au fimbo ya urefu tofauti). Unaweza pia kutumia vitu hivi kutengeneza michoro.
* Unaweza pia kutengeneza miunganiko unaotembea. Kwa mfano, anza na muunganiko kama “piga makofi, geuka, rudia” na mfanye mtoto wako afanye hivyo hivyo.

SourceText: Cooking Together
text: Kupika Pamoja

SourceText: Cooking together is a wonderful opportunity to talk and connect, while also teaching your child how to plan, use their hands and work together.
text: Kupika pamoja ni fursa nzuri ya kuzungumza na kuungana, wakati huo pia ukimfundisha mtoto wako jinsi ya kupanga, kutumia mikono yao na kufanya kazi pamoja.

SourceText:
1. Think of some options for dishes that your child can help you make, or cooking activities your child can participate in.
2. Tell them in advance about what you have planned and ask them how they might want to participate. 
3. Together with your child, gather the ingredients and utensils that you will need. Discuss with them what this will be used for. 
4. Give them a job to do, like fetching water, washing vegetables, measuring ingredients or stirring.
5. Talk to your child about what you are making and why you are doing what you are doing (for example, *“boiling the vegetables in water will make them soft”*, or *“we are adding some salt to add more flavour”*)
6. Enjoy the meal as a family and praise your child for their contribution.
text:
1. Fikiria baadhi ya chaguzi za vyombo ambazo mtoto wako anaweza 
 kukusaidia kuandaa, au shughuli za mapishi mtoto wako anaweza
 kushiriki.
2. Anza kuwaambia kuwaandaa kuhusu ulichopanga na waulize 
 wangependa kushiriki kwa namna gani.
3. Pamoja na mtoto wako, weka pamoja viungo na vyombo vile 
 utakavyovihitaji. Jadiliana nao vitatumika kwaajili ya nini.
4. Wape kazi ya kufanya, kama kuchota maji, kuosha mboga za majani, 
 kupima viungo au kuchochea kuni
5. Zungumza na mtoto wako kuhusu nini unatengeneza na kwanini unafanya hicho unachofanya( kwa mfano, “kuchemsha mboga za majani kwenye maji itafanya ziwe laini”, au “tunaongeza chumvi kuongeza ladha zaidi”) 
6. Furahia chakula kama familia na msifie mtoto wako kwaajili ya michango 
 yao.

SourceText:
* Involve your child in the planning process. Let them choose the recipe, ingredients or what they help with.
* Ask your child questions about the colours, shapes, textures and smells of the different ingredients. 
* Praise their efforts, even if the food does not turn out perfectly.
text:
*Mshirikishe mtoto wako katika mchakato wa kupanga. Waache wachague mapishi, viungo au watasaidia nini..
*Muulize mtoto wako maswali kuhusu rangi. maumbo, muundo, na harufu za viungo mbalimbali 
 * Sifia jitihada zao, hata kama chakula hakijawa kizuri/sahihi.

SourceText: Household Helpers
text: Wasaidizi wa nyumbani

SourceText: Including your child in household chores provides an opportunity for bonding and teamwork – especially when you think of ways to make it fun.
text: Kumjumuisha mtoto wako kwenye kazi za nyumbani huleta fursa ya kuleta umoja na ufanyaji kazi kwa kushirikiana - hasa pale unapofikiria jinsi ya kuifanya iwe ya kufurahisha.

SourceText:
1. Identify a specific area in your home that needs cleaning and organising, such as a room, cupboard, or area on the floor.
2. Talk to your child about what needs to be done to clean the space (Like sorting items into groups, or dusting a surface).
3. Give specific tasks to each person and work together to complete them.
4. As you clean and organise, take the opportunity to talk and connect with your child. Ask them about their interests and share stories from your own life.
5. When you are finished, take a moment to appreciate the team effort and praise your child for their involvement.
text:
1. Tambua eneo maalum nyumbani kwako lile linalohitaji kusafishwa na 
 kupangwa, kama vile chumba, kabati, au eneo la sakafu.
2. Zungumza na mtoto wako kuhusu nini kinatakiwa kufanyika kusafisha 
 sehemu (kama kupanga vitu kwenye makundi, au kufuta vumbi).
3. Mpe kila mtu kazi/ jukumu maalum na mfanye kazi pamoja kuzikamilisha
4. Kadili unavyosafisha na kupanga, chukua fursa kuzungumza na 
 kuunganika na mtoto wako. Waulize kuhusu wanavyovipendelea na 
 shirikisha hadithi kutoka kwenye maisha yako
5. Mtakapomaliza, chukua muda kushukuru jitihada zao na msifie mtoto wako
 kwaajili ya kujumuika kwake.

SourceText:
* Let your child come up with an idea for what they think should be cleaned
* Take breaks and take your time. Remember to keep things fun.
* If your child loses interest, think about how you can bring their attention back to the activity and make it fun. Is there a song you can sing together? Or can they show you how many shapes or colours they can find around you?
text:
*Muache mtoto wako aje na wazo la ni nini wanafikiri ni nini kisafishwe na kipangwe.
* Pumzika na pata muda wa kutosha. Kumbuka kufanya mambo yawe ya furaha.
* Kama mtoto wako amepoteza hamasa, fikiri kuhusu jinsi ya kuweza kurudisha umakini wao kwenye shughuli na ifanye iwe ya kufurahia. Kuna wimbo mnaweza kuimba pamoja? Au wanaweza kukuonesha miundo mingapi au rangi wanazoweza kuzipata katika mazingira yako?

SourceText: Music and Dancing
text: Muziki na Kucheza

SourceText: Dancing and music activities are a fun way to connect with your child and a great way to get exercise.
text: Kucheza na muziki ni njia ya kufurahisha ya kujiunga na mtoto wako na njia nzuri ya kufanya mazoezi.

SourceText:
1. Put on some music. 
2. Start dancing and invite your child to join in.
3. Show each other your favourite moves, imitate your child’s moves or learn new ones together.
4. You can also play “dance and freeze”: At a random moment, stop the music and ask your child to freeze. You can add to the challenge by asking them to freeze in the shape of an animal or other object.
text:
1. Weka muziki flani.
2. Anza kucheza na muombe mtoto wako ajiunge 
3. Kila mmoja aoneshe muondoko anaoupenda, iga miondoko ya mtoto wako au mjifunze mipya 
 pamoja.
4. Unaweza pia kucheza mchezo wa “Kucheza na kuganda ” bila mpangilio, simamisha muziki na muombe mtoto wako kuganda/agande. Unaweza kuongeza kwenye shindano kwa kuwaomba kuganda katika umbo la mnyama au kitu kingine.

SourceText:
* Don't take it too seriously, be silly and have fun together.
* If your child has a favourite song, let them choose the song they want to dance to. 
* Invite the rest of the family to join in the fun.
* Create your own instruments with household items to sing a song you know, or make up a new song.
text:
* Usichukulie kwa uzito sana, kuwa mpole na mfurahie pamoja.
* kama mtoto wako ana wimbo anaopenda, wacha wachague wimbo wanaotaka kucheza.
* Waalike wanafamilia wengine wajiunge katika kufurahi. 
* Tengeneza vifaa vyako kwa vitu vya nyumbani kuimba wimbo unaoujua, au tengeneza wimbo mpya.

SourceText: Walking Together
text: Kutembea Pamoja

SourceText: Walking around your community is an easy and fun way to spend quality time together.
text: Kutembea kwenye maeneo ya jamii yako ni njia rahisi na ya kufurahisha na kutumia muda pamoja.

SourceText:
1. **Plan:** Make time to take a walk together with your child. It could be in a nearby park, market, or any interesting area. Talk to your child about when and where you are planning to go. 
2. **Observe and explore:** Point out interesting things that you see as you walk. This could be about people, nature or buildings. Encourage your child to point out what they see, and ask them questions about it. 
3. **Learn together:** Tell your child things you know about the area, or ask them to tell you what they know.
text:
1.**Mpango.** Tenga muda kutembea pamoja na mtoto wako. Inaweza kuwa
 karibu na hifadhi, soko, au eneo lolote la kuvutia. Zungumza na mtoto 
 wako kuhusu lini na wapi unapanga kwenda
 2.** Angalia na chunguza.**Chagua vitu vya kuvutia unavyoviona kadili 
 mnavyokuwa mnatembea. Hii inaweza kuwa kuhusu watu, asili au 
 majengo. Mhimize mtoto wako aoneshe anachokiona, na muulize 
 maswali kuhusu hicho.
 3.** Kujifunza pamoja.**Mwambie mtoto wako mambo unayoyajua kuhusu
 eneo, au waombe wakwambie nini wanajua.

SourceText:
* Make it fun: sing songs as you walk, take turns leading the way, see who can spot something interesting and make up a story about what you see.
* Make it regular: Schedule regular walks and explore new locations to keep the activity fresh and fun.
* Use technology: Bring along your smartphone to take pictures of interesting things you see on the walk. Ask your child to point out things that they would like you to photograph. When you are back home, you and your child can look at the photos together and discuss them.
text:
*Ifanye iwe ya furaha: Imba nyimbo kadili mnavyotembea, mpokezane
 kuongoza njia, ona nani anaweza kuona/kugundua kitu cha kuvutia na 
 tengeneza hadithi kuhusu unachoona.
* Ifanye iwe ya mara kwa mara: Weka ratiba ya kutembea mara kwa mara na chunguza sehemu mpya kufanya shughuli iwe mpya na ya furaha
*Tumia teknolojia: Chukua simu yako janja kupiga picha za mambo ya kuvutia mnayoyaona wakati wa matembezi. Muombe mtoto wako aoneshe mambo ambayo wangependa upige picha. Mnapokuwa mmerudi nyumbani, wewe na mtoto wako mnaweza kuangalia picha pamoja na kuzijadili.

SourceText: Make Up a Story Together
text: Kutunga hadithi Pamoja

SourceText: Creating a story together with your child is a great way to develop their listening skills, practice turn-taking and encourage their imagination.
text: Kutengeneza hadithi pamoja ni njia nzuri ya kukuza ujuzi wao wa kusikiliza, mpeane zamu kuwahimiza kupata picha ya mawazo waliyo nayo.

SourceText:
Tell your child that you would like to create a story together. Explain that you will be taking turns to add to the story:
1. Start the story with *“Once upon a time there was a…”*
2. Let your child make up the next sentence.
3. Then you make up a sentence.
4. Take turns until you have a wonderful new story.
5. Make sure to end the story on a positive note.
6. Ask your child what their favourite part of the story was!
text:
Mwambie mtoto wako ungependa kutengeneza hadithi pamoja. Elezea kwamba mtakuwa mkipeana zamu kuongeza kwenye hadithi.
1. Anza hadithi na *" Hapo zamani za kale kulikuwa na….”*
2. Mwache mtoto wako atengeneze sentesi inayofuata.
3. Kisha unakamilisha sentensi.
4. Fanyeni zamu mpaka mhakikishe mna hadithi nzuri. 
5. Hakikisha unamaliza hadithi kwa maneno yenye tija. 
6. Muulize mtoto wako ni sehemu gani ya hadithi iliyowavutia!

SourceText:
* Choose a time when your child will be able to pay attention. This can also be a useful activity when you might want to distract your child (e.g., while getting dressed or having a bath).
* Show your child that you are listening by making eye contact, nodding, smiling or responding to what they say with praise or encouragement.
text:
* Chagua muda ambao mtoto wako ataweza kuwa makini. Hii inaweza pia kuwa ni shughuli muhimu wakati ungetaka kumvuruga mtoto wako (mfano., wakati anavaa nguo au anaoga).
* Muoneshe mtoto wako kuwa unamsikiliza kwa kumuangalia usoni, kuitikia kwa kutingisha kichwa, kutabasamu na kuwajibu kile wanachoongea kwa kuwasifia au kuwatia moyo.

SourceText: Simon Says
text: Simon Anasema

SourceText: This fun game helps your child to learn how to listen and follow instructions.
text: Mchezo huu wa kufurahisha unamsaidia mtoto wako kujifunza jinsi ya kusikiliza na kufata maelekezo.

SourceText:
1. Explain that you are going to give directions for the group to make a specific movement or sound. Everyone should only do as you say when you start your instruction with *“Simon says”*.
2. If you say: *“Simon says touch your nose”* then all players must touch their nose. 
3. If you say *“Jump”* without saying *“Simon says”* first, then the players must not jump. If they jumped, then they must sit down and wait until the next round of the game. 
4. Keep giving instructions until there is only one person standing. That person can be Simon in the next round. 
5. The person playing Simon can give any kind of instructions – stretch to the sky, bark like a dog, jump three times on one leg, touch your left foot.
text:
1. Elezea kwamba unakwenda kuwapa maelekezo kwaajili ya kikundi 
 kufanya hatua maalumu au mlio. Kila mmoja anatakiwa kufanya kile 
 unachosema pale unapoanza kutoa maelekezo ya *“Simon anasema”*
2. Kama unasema: “Simon anasema gusa pua yako” kisha wachezaji wote lazima waguse pua zao.
3. Kama unasema “Ruka” bila kusema “Simon anasema” kwanza, basi wachezaji hawataruka. Kama waliruka, basi ni lazima wakae chini na wasubiri mpaka mzunguko unaofuata wa mchezo.
4. Endelea kutoa maelekezo mpaka atakapokuwa amesimama mtu mmoja tu. Huyo mtu anaweza kuwa Simon mzunguko unaofuata.
5. Mtu anayecheza mchezo wa Simon anaweza kutoa maelekezo - jinyooshe kuelekea angani, bweka kama mbwa, ruka mara tatu kwa mguu mmoja, gusa mguu wako wa kushoto.

SourceText:
* Play a practice round to make sure everyone understands the rules.
* Make sure your instructions are achievable.
* Give all players a turn to be the leader (the person who gives instructions).
* Do not tease or criticise children for making mistakes – it is part of the game!
text:
*Chezeni kwa majaribio wote katika mzunguko kuhakikisha kila mmoja ameelewa kanuni
* Hakikisha maelekezo yako yanaweza kufanyika.
* Wape wachezaji wote zamu kuwa kiongozi (mtu anayetoa maelekezo)
* Usitanie au kukosoa watoto wanapofanya makosa - Ni sehemu ya mchezo!

SourceText: When I Grow Up
text: Nitakapokuwa mkubwa

SourceText: A fun way to encourage your child to dream about their future, is to ask them what they want to be when they grow up.
text: Njia ya kufurahisha ya kumtia moyo mtoto wako ili kuwa na ndoto kuhusu maisha yao ya baadae, ni kumuuliza anataka awe nani atakapokua.

SourceText:
1. Start with a simple question: *“What would you like to do one day when you are an adult? Or, what is something you hope to achieve when you are older?”*
2. Encourage your child to talk about what they want to be or do one day. Ask them why. Encourage them to tell you more about their dream. 
3. You can add role-play or dress-up activities, or invite your child to draw a picture. For example, if your child wants to own their own shop one day, encourage them to create a pretend shop at home, and encourage family members to visit their shop.
text:
Anza na swali rahisi: *"Ungependa kufanya nini siku moja ukiwa mtu mzima? Au, ni kitu gani unachotarajia kufikia ukiwa mzee?"*
2. Mhimize mtoto wako azungumze juu ya kile anachotaka kuwa au kufanya siku moja. Waulize kwa nini. Watie moyo wakueleze zaidi kuhusu ndoto zao. 
3. Unaweza kuongeza shughuli za kucheza au mavazi, au kualika mtoto wako kuchora picha. Kwa mfano, ikiwa mtoto wako anataka kumiliki duka lao siku moja, wahimize kuunda duka la kuigizia nyumbani, na kuwahimiza wanafamilia kutembelea duka lao.

SourceText:
* Remember that your child’s goals and dreams at this age do not have to be realistic. You can still show interest and encourage them to engage with the topic and idea. 
* Nowadays, boys and girls can be anything they want to be. Encourage your child regardless of what you think is acceptable for boys or girls.
text:
*Kumbuka malengo na ndoto za mtoto wako katika umri huu sio lazima ziwe za ukweli, bado unaweza kuonesha kuvutiwa na kuwahimiza kushiriki kwenye mada na wazo.
*Siku hizi, wavulana na wasichana wanaweza kushika nafasi yoyote wanayotaka. Mhimize mtoto wako bila kujali unachofikiri kuwa kinakubalika kwa wavulana au wasichana.

SourceText: Favourite Play
text: Mchezo Pendwa

SourceText: All adults were children once! Sharing the games or activities you loved as a child with your own child is a great way to connect and have fun together.
text: Watu wazima wote walikuwa watoto hapo zamani! Kushiriki michezo au shughuli ulizokuwa unazipenda wakati wa utoto na mtoto wako ni njia nzuri ya kuungana na kufurahia pamoja.

SourceText:
1. Think back to when you were a child: what was one of your favourite games or ways to play?
2. Create a similar game or activity for you and your child to play together. It doesn’t have to be exactly as you remember it – what is important is that you have fun together. 
3. Welcome your child’s ideas or suggestions to make this a shared activity that is fun for you both. 
4. Invite other family members to share their favourite play activities as well.
text:
1. Fikiria hapo nyuma ulipokuwa mtoto: Ni mchezo gani ulikuwa unaupenda zaidi au mlichezaje?
2. Tengeneza mchezo au shughuli sawa na ule uliokuwa unaupenda ili wewe na mtoto wako mcheze pamoja. Sio lazima iwe sawa kama unavyokumbuka—Kitu muhimu ni kuwa na furaha pamoja.
3. Mkaribishe mtoto wako kwa mawazo au mapendekezo ili kufanya shughuli hii kuwa ya pamoja ile, ambayo inawafurahisha nyote wawili.
4. Karibisha wanafamilia wengine kushiriki shughuli zao wanaozipenda pia.

SourceText:
* It can feel disappointing if your child is not as interested in the activity as you once were. Try to be patient and treat your child with kindness. Do not force your child to participate. 
* Think about ways to make sure that the activity is age appropriate, and that your child can take part without too much difficulty.
text:
*Inaweza kukatisha tamaa ikiwa mtoto wako, hapendi shughuli kama ulivyokuwa zamani. Jaribu kuwa mvumilivu na umtendee mtoto wako vizuri. Usilazimishe mtoto wako kushiriki.
*Fikiria kuhusu njia za kuhakikisha kwamba shughuli hiyo inafaa kwa umri husika na kwamba mtoto wako anaweza kushiriki bila ugumu sana.

SourceText: Act the Story
text: Igiza hadithi

SourceText: Children love playing pretend. Acting out a story together is a great way to help children learn to be creative and work towards a common goal.
text: Watoto wanapenda kujifanya/kuigiza wanacheza. Kuigiza pamoja hadithi ni njia nzuri ya kuwasaidia watoto kujifunza kuwa wabunifu na kufanya kazi kufikia malengo.

SourceText:
1. Choose a story your child knows and decide who will play which character.
2. Discuss together what you will need to recreate the story. Household objects can be things in the story, and different areas can be different places. 
3. Tell the story and act it out together. You can do silly voices and actions for each character, and move around your home and garden or outside space.
text:
1. Chagua hadithi mtoto wako anayoijua na uamue ni nani atacheza uhusika upi.
2. Mjadili pamoja kitu gani mtakachokihitaji kutengeneza hadithi. Vitu vya kwenye kaya vinaweza kuwa vitu vya kwenye hadithi na maeneo tofauti yanaweza kuwa sehemu tofauti.
3. Simulia hadithi na muigize pamoja. unaweza kufanya sauti na matendo ya kipuuzi kwa kila mhusika, na zunguka nyumba na bustanini au kwenye nafasi nje.

SourceText:
* You can also make up new parts of the story, adding new characters or events.
* You can introduce challenges that your characters need to overcome. This helps your child to learn problem-solving.
* If you need inspiration, go to the ParentApp library and let your child choose a book, read it together and then act out the story.
text:
*Unaweza pia kuunda sehemu mpya za hadithi, kuongeza wahusika wapya au matukio.
*Unaweza kutambulisha changamoto ambazo wahusika wanahitajika kuzitatua. Hii inamsaidia mtoto wako kujifunza kutatua -changamoto
*Kama unahitaji msukumo na kujua zaidi nenda kwenye maktaba ya App ya wazazi na muache mtoto wako achague kitabu.

SourceText: Shadow Movie
text: Filamu ya Kivuli

SourceText: Play with the shadows of different objects against a wall to create your own movie or story.
text: Cheza na vivuli vya vitu mbalimbali ukutani kutengeneza filamu yako au hadithi.

SourceText: A toilet roll tube, a torch (one on a mobile phone is fine) and sticky tape for your projector. Everyday items, like paper, fabrics or cardboard, to create characters for your show.
text: Rola (ipo katika muundo wa bomba/ rola hii hutumika kuzungushia karatasi ya kutumia maliwato/toilet pepa) iliyobaki baada ya karatasi/toilet pepa ya maliwato kutumika, tochi (unaweza kutumia tochi ya simu) na gundi ya karatasi kwaajiili ya projeckta/sehemu ya kuonesha filamu yako. Kila kitu, kama karatasi, uzi na ubao, kutengeneza wahusika wa onesho lako.

SourceText: 1. Make the projector by joining the toilet roll to your torch using sticky tape. If you don’t have a toilet roll or a torch, you can use a normal lamp or candle, and place it where it will make a shadow against the wall.
text: 1. Tengeneza projekta kwa kuunganisha karatasi ngumu inayobaki baada ya kutumia karatasi ya chooni kwa kutumia gundi ya mkanda unaonata. ikiwa huna ganda gumu la ndani ya karatasi ya kutumia chooni au tochi, unaweza kutumia taa ya kawaida au mshumaa, na kuiweka mahali ambapo itafanya kivuli dhidi ya ukuta.

SourceText: 2. Work out where you want to see the shadows, like against a wall or on the floor.
text: 2. Fanya kazi unapotaka kuona vivuli, kama vile ukutani au sakafuni.

SourceText: 3. Decide what items you want to use to make the characters for your shadow movie. You can create your own characters out of paper or cardboard, use existing objects or toys, or even use your hands.
text: 3. Amua ni vitu gani ungependa kutumia kutengeneza wahusika wa filamu yako ya kivuli. Unaweza kuunda wahusika wako mwenyewe kutoka kwenye karatasi au kadibodi, tumia vitu vilivyopo au midoli au hata kutumia mikono yako.

SourceText: 4. Turn off the lights or close the curtains, shine the light on your characters and create a shadow story together.
text: 4. Zima taa au funga mapazia, waangazie wahusika wako na uunde hadithi ya kivuli pamoja.

SourceText: Build a Road
text: Jenga barabara

SourceText: Build a road through your house or garden, using everyday objects in creative ways. This fun activity will develop motor, creative and problem-solving skills.
text: Jenga barabara yako kupitia nyumba yako au bustani, tumia vitu vya kila siku katika kutengenza njia. Shughuli hii ya kufurahisha italeta nguvu, ubunifu na ujuzi wa utatuzi wa matatizo.

SourceText:
1. **Plan:** Together with your child, decide on the start and end point for your road. Will your road begin at the bed and continue all the way to the front door? Will your road begin under the table and end in the garden? 
2. **Find:** Work together to find objects to create your road.
3. **Build:** Can you use sticks or rocks to create the sides of the road? Can you make bridges or tunnels? Can you use cloth or pieces of cardboard to create the road?
4. **Drive:** Decide on objects that you will use as vehicles and drive up and down your road, or have a race.
text:
1.**Panga** Pamoja na mtoto wako, muamue mwanzo na mwisho wa barabara. Barabara yenu itaanzia kitandani na kuendelea mpaka kwenye mlango wa mbele?, Barabara yenu itaanzia chini ya meza na kuishia ndani ya bustani.
 2.**Tafuta** Fanyeni kazi pamoja kutafuta vitu vya kutengenezea barabara yenu. 
 3.**Jenga** Mnaweza kutumia fimbo au mawe kutengeneza pande za barabara? Mnaweza kutengeneza madaraja au vichuguu? mnaweza kutumia nguo au vipande vya mbao kutengeneza barabara?
4.**Endesha** Amueni ni vitu gani mtatumia kama magari na kuendesha kwenye 
 barabara yenu kwa mwendo wa kawaida au kwa mbio.

SourceText:
* Let the objects you have guide your imagination! Build a shaded area with a cloth propped up with containers or plastic bottles, or create a house with a roof and add a hill or a roundabout.
* Remember that all children – girls and boys – can enjoy building activities.
text:
*Vitu mlilvyo navyo viwaongoze katika kupata picha! Tengeneza sehemu yenye kivuli na nguo iliyowekwa na vyombo au chupa za plastiki, au tengeneza nyumba na paa na ongeza mlima au mzunguko.
*Kumbuka watoto wote - wasichana na wavulana - wanaweza kufurahia shughuli za kiujenzi.

SourceText: Animal Strengths
text: Nguvu za wanyama

SourceText: Let your imaginations run wild with this fun animal game. Let your child choose what animal they would like to pretend to be and join them in the fun.
text: Acha mawazo yako yawe huru katika mchezo huu wa mnyama wa kufurahisha. Acha mtoto wako achague ni mnyama yupi angependa kuigiza kuwa na ungana nao katika kufurahia.

SourceText:
1. Ask your child: If you could be any type of animal, what would you be? Why would you want to be that animal?
2. Now let your child choose an animal for you.
3. Use your body and voice to play the part of your animals. 
4. Talk about the different characteristics of your animal: What strengths does your animal have? What does your animal like to do? Where does your animal like to sleep? What does your animal like to eat?
text:
1. Muulize mtoto wako: Kama ungeweza kuwa aina yoyote ya mnyama, ungekuwa nani?
2. Sasa acha mtoto wako akuchagulie mnyama.
3. Tumia mwili wako na sauti kucheza sehemu yako ya wanyama
4. Zungumza kuhusu tabia tofauti za mnyama wako: Mnyama wako ana uwezo gani? Ni nini mnyama wako anapenda kufanya? Ni wapi mnyama wako anapenda kulala? Mnyama wako anapenda kula nini?

SourceText:
* You can even try to do an every-day activity, like tidying the house, bathing or getting dressed, while pretending to be that animal.  
* Invite the rest of your family to join in the fun!
text:
* Mnaweza hata kujaribu kufanya shughuli ya kila siku, kama kupanga nyumba, kuoga au kuvaa nguo, huku unaigiza kuwa kama mnyama huyo.
* Alika wanafamilia wengine wajiunge katika kufurahia!

SourceText: Treasure Hunt
text: Kutafuta hazina

SourceText: Set out on an adventure to find different objects or “treasures”. This is a great way to help your child learn as they explore their surroundings.
text: Andaa safari kutafuta vitu tofauti au “hazina”, Hii ni njia nzuri kusaidia mtoto wako kujifunza ambavyo pia watachunguza mazingira yao.

SourceText:
1. **Plan together:** Tell your child that you want to go on a treasure hunt. Decide together where you will search, and what you are searching for. You can decide to look for specific objects based on colour, shape or texture, or even based on the starting sound (for example, objects that start with the letter “S”)
2. **Explore:** Walk around and look around to find the objects you have decided to search for.
3. **Gather:** Place the objects you find all together - examine and discuss them. 
4. **Combine:**Once you have all your objects, you can also see if you can make something interesting with everything combined.
text:
1. **Kupanga pamoja.** Mwambie mtoto wako kwamba unataka kwenda kutafuta hazina. Amueni pamoja ni wapi mtatafuta, na mnatafuta nini. Mnaweza kuamua kutafuta vitu maalum kulingana na rangi, maumbo au muundo, au hata kwa kulingana na kuanzia sauti (kwa mfano, vitu vinayoanza na herufi “S”)
2. **Chunguza.** Tembeeni na angalieni katika eneo hilo kupata vitu mlivyoamua kuvitafuta.
3. **Kusanya.** Wekeni vitu mli vyovipata vyote pamoja - chunguzeni na mvijadili.
4. **Unganisha.** Mara tu mkiwa na vitu vyenu vyote, mnaweza pia kuona ikiwa mnaweza kutengeneza kitu cha kuvutia kwa hivyo vitu vyote vilivyokusanywa.

SourceText:
* These activities work well outside too.
* If your child brings back an object that does not fit with what you were searching for, ask them in a kind way why they brought it, instead of criticising or scolding them.
text:
* Shughuli hizi zinafanyika vizuri pia nje.
* Kama mtoto wako ataleta kitu ambacho hakiko sawa na mlivyokuwa mnatafuta, waulize kwa upole kwanini wameleta hiyo, badala ya kuwakosoa au kuwakemea.

SourceText: Search With Your Senses
text: Tafuta kwa kutumia milango yako ya fahamu

SourceText: Engage all your senses by identifying things around you that you and your child can touch, hear, see, taste and smell.
text: Shirikisha hisia zako kwa kutambua vitu vilivyopo maeneo yenu ambayo wewe na mtoto wako mnaweza kugusa, kuvisikia. kuvionja/kujaribu na kuvinusa.

SourceText:
Take turns to identify what in your surroundings you can touch, hear, see, taste or smell. Together, discuss what you discover. 
1. **What can you smell?** Where do you think it is coming from? What do you think about how it smells?
text:
Chukua zamu ili kutambua ni nini katika mazingira yako ambacho unaweza kugusa, kuona, au kunusa. Kwa pamoja, jadili gundua.
1. **Unaweza kunusa nini?** Unafikiri inatoka wapi? Unamaoni gani kuhusu jinsi inavyonukia?

SourceText: 2. **What can you hear?** What is making that sound? Where is it coming from?
text: 2. **Unaweza kusikia nini?** Ni nini kinachotoa sauti hiyo? Inatoka wapi?

SourceText: 3. **What can you see?** What is near to you? What is far away?
text: 3. **Unaona nini?** Nini kipo karibu? Nini kipo mbali?

SourceText: 4. **What can you touch?** Discuss the different textures and how it feels to touch it.
text: 4. **Unaweza kugusa nini?** Jadili miundo tofauti na unaiskiaje ukiishika.

SourceText: 5. **What can you taste?** Or, what do you see around you that you could taste? How do you think it would taste?
text: 5. **Unaweza kuonja nini?** Au, unaona nini karibu yako ambacho unaweza kukionja? Unafikiri kitakuwa na radha gani?

SourceText: * You can also play an “I Spy” version of the senses game, taking turns to identify something you can touch/smell/taste/hear/see, giving the letter or sound it starts with, and trying to guess what it is.
text: * Unaweza pia kucheza mchezo wa “Napepeleza” toleo la mchezo wa hisia, pokezaneni kutambua kitu flani unachoweza kugusa/kunusa/kuonja/kukisikia/kuona. Toa herufi au sauti inayoanza nacho na jaribuni kubuni ni nini hicho.

SourceText: Count and Compare
text: Hesabu na linganisha

SourceText: There are lots of opportunities around your home or during everyday activities to count and compare objects. This is a great way to build your child’s numeracy skills, which helps them at school.
text: Kuna fursa nyingi za kuhesabu na kulinganisha katika eneo linalozunguka nyumbani kwako au wakati wa shughuli za kila siku. Hii ni njia nzuri ya kujenga ujuzi wa hesabu wa mtoto wako, ambayo itawasaidia shuleni.

SourceText: Objects around the house
text: Vitu vilivyopo katika eneo la nyumba

SourceText:
Ideas for counting and comparing games:
* Label bottles with numbers and have children count and drop small objects inside to match the number on the bottle.
* Count your steps as you climb the stairs, count the number of chickens you see on the road, the number of fruits in a tree, the number of trucks or cars…opportunities for counting and comparing are all around us. 
* Ask your child to categorise objects: which objects are big? Which are small? Soft? Hard? Heavy? Light? Which are used for cooking? Which are used for washing up?  
* Ask your child to make comparisons: Which car is closest to our house? Which tree is the tallest in our garden? Which shoe is the smallest?  
* Preparing snacks or cooking food is a great way to help your child understand adding and subtracting. If we have five mangoes and we use two for dinner, how many do we have left? How many pieces of bread do we need so that each one at the table gets two pieces?
text:
Mawazo kwaajili ya kuhesabu na kulinganisha
*Weka namba kwenye chupa na waambie watoto wahesabu na kuweka vitu vidogo ndani yake kwa idadi kulingana na namba ya chupa.
*Hesabu hatua zako kadili unavyopanda ngazi, hesabu idadi ya kuku unaowaona barabarani, idadi ya matunda kwenye mti, idadi ya gari za mizigo na gari ndogo, fursa ya kuhesabu na kulinganisha zipo nyingi katika mazingira yanayotuzunguka.
*Mwambie mtoto wako aweke vitu kwenye makundi: Ni vitu gani vikubwa, vipi ni vidogo? laini? vigumu? vizito, vyepesi? vipi vinatumika kwa kupika? vipi vinatumika kwa kufulia?
*Muombe mtoto wako afananishe: Ni gari gani lipo karibu na nyumba yetu? Ni mti gani mkubwa katika bustani yetu? Kiatu gani ni kidogo zaidi?
*Kuandaa vitafunwa au kupika chakula ni njia nzuri ya kumsaidia mtoto wako kuelewa kuongeza na kutoa. Kama tuna embe tano na tunatumia mbili kwaajili ya chakula cha usiku, tutabakiwa na ngapi? Tunahitaji vipande vingapi vya mkate ili kila mmoja mezani apate vipande viwili?

SourceText: * Praise and encourage your child if they get it right. Don’t react negatively or with judgement if they make a mistake. If they give the wrong answer, you can simply respond with the correct answer (e.g., if they say there are three bananas, but there are actually 5, you can respond with: *“Hmmm, let’s look carefully – how many do we see? 1, 2, 3, 4, 5. I see five bananas. Can you count them again and see if you also count five?”*). This will encourage them to keep trying and to keep learning with your encouragement.
text: * Msifie na mtie moyo mtoto wako ikiwa wamepatia. Usijibu vibaya au kwa kuhukumu ikiwa watafanya makosa. Kama watatoa jibu si sahihi, unaweza tu kujibu kwa kutoa jibu sahihi (mfano; kama wanasema kuna ndizi tatu, lakini kiuhalisia kuna ndizi 5, unaweza kujibu kwa kuitikia: *"Hmmm, tuangalie kwa umakini - tunaona ngapi? 1, 2, 3, 4, 5. Naona ndizi tano. Unaweza kuhesabu tena na uone kama na wewe pia ukihesabu utapata tano?"*). Hii itawapa moyo wa kuendelea kujaribu na kuendelea kujifunza kutokana na kuwapa moyo.

SourceText: Mystery Box
text: Sanduku la maajabu (lenye mafumbo)

SourceText: Mystery Box is a fun game where you place an object inside a box, and let your child ask questions to figure out what the object is.
text: Sanduku la siri ni mchezo wa kufurahisha ambapo unaweka kitu ndani ya kisanduku na umruhusu mtoto wako aulize maswali ili kufahamu kitu hicho ni nini.

SourceText:
You can use anything as a ‘box’ (a bucket, sack, packet), as long as your child cannot see what is inside.

You also need something to hide inside the mystery box.
text: Unaweza kutumia kitu chochote kama sanduku ( Ndoo, gunia, pakiti) ilimradi tu mtoto wako asione nini kipo ndani.

SourceText:
1. Place any object inside the “Mystery Box”, without showing your child.
2. Your child now asks you questions to try and guess what it is. You can only answer with “Yes” or “No”.
3. Let your child ask as many questions as they need to guess what is in the box. If they are struggling, you can give them some hints or clues to help them. 
4. Swap roles with your child and let them choose an object to hide in the box and you try to guess what it is.
text:
1. Weka kitu chochote ndani ya “ Sanduku la Siri” bila kumuonyesha mtoto wako. 
2. Mtoto wako sasa anauliza maswali ili kujaribu na kukisia ni kitu gani? unaweza ukajibu tu “Ndio”” au “Hapana”
3. Muache mtoto wako akuulize maswali mengi kadri anavyohitaji kukisia ni nini kipo ndani ya Kisanduku. ukiona wanapambana kutafuta jibu, unaweza kuwapa dondoo au vidokezo vya kuwasaidia.. 
4. Badilishaneni majukumu na mtoto wako na umruhusu achague kitu cha kuficha kwenye kisanduku na ujaribu kukisia nini kipo.

SourceText:
* You can use different objects. You can also introduce themes, such as animals or fruits, to make the game more exciting. 
* You can allow your child to choose the objects or themes. This makes them feel more involved and part of the game.
* Your child can close their eyes and touch the mystery item to guess what it is.
text:
* Unaweza kutumia vitu tofauti, Pia unaweza kutambulisha mada kama vile wanyama au matunda. Kufanya mchezo kuwa wa kuvutia zaidi.
*Unaweza kuruhusu mtoto wako kuchagua vitu au mada. Hii inawafanya wajisikie kuhusika zaidi na kuwa sehemu ya mchezo.
* Mtoto wako anaweza kufunga macho yake kugusa kitu ili kukisia ni nini.

SourceText: Everyday activities
text: Shughuli za kila siku

SourceText: Have fun AND learn through everyday activities.
text: Furahia na jifunze kupitia shughuli za kila siku.

SourceText: Learning at home
text: Kujifunza ukiwa nyumbani

SourceText: Help grow your child’s skills for school and life.
text: Saidia kukuza ujuzi wa mtoto wako shuleni na maishani.

SourceText: Pretend play
text: Igiza kucheza

SourceText: Encourage your child’s imagination and creativity.
text: Mtie moyo mtoto wako kwenye vitu anavyofikiri na katika ubunifu.

SourceText: Chat together
text: Kuongea Pamoja

SourceText: Talk with each other to get to know each other better.
text: Zungumzeni ili kujuana vizuri.

SourceText: Move your body
text: Chezesha mwili wako

SourceText: Moving your body to relax and spend time together.
text: Chezesha mwili wako kupumzika na tumia muda pamoja.

SourceText: Ideas for book activities
text: Mawazo ya shughuli za kitabu

SourceText: More ideas for book activities
text: Mawazo zaidi ya shughuli za kitabu

SourceText: Being responsive during book activities
text: Kuwa msikivu wakati wa shughuli za kitabu

SourceText: Using books to build your child's vocabulary
text: Kutumia kitabu kujenga misamiati kwa mtoto wako

SourceText: Creating positive experiences
text: Kutoa majibu chanya

SourceText: Bringing the book’s story to life
text: Kuifanya hadithi za vitabu kuwa hai

SourceText: Using books in playful ways
text: Kutumia vitabu kwa njia ya kucheza

SourceText: Using books to talk about feelings
text: Kutumia vitabu kuzungumza juu ya hisia

SourceText: Prepare
text: Andaa

SourceText: Quick Pause
text: Simamisha kwa haraka

SourceText:
Sit down, close your eyes and listen to your breath as it goes in and out. 

Notice how you feel. 

When you are ready, open your eyes again.

Try this whenever you are feeling stressed and you need a break to reconnect.
text:
Kaa chini, fumba macho yako na sikiliza pumzi yako inapoingia na kutoka,

Chunguza jinsi unavyohisi.

Unapokuwa tayari, fungua macho yako tena.

Jaribu hili wakati wowote unapohisi mfadhaiko na unahitaji mapumziko ili kuwa sawa tena.

SourceText: Power of Three
text: Nguvu ya tatu

SourceText:
Close your eyes.

Let's use the magic power of three to stay present and relax.

Name three sounds you can hear right now.
Name three smells you can smell right now.
Name your three favourite foods.

What are three things you can be grateful for right now? They do not have to be big.

At the end of a tough day, thinking of three things to be grateful for can help us find the courage to try again tomorrow.
text:
Fumba macho yako.

Hebu tutumie maajabu ya namba tatu ili tuendelee kuwepo na kupumzika.

Taja sauti tatu unazoweza kuzisikia sasa hivi.
Taja harufu tatu unazoweza kuzinusa sasa hivi.
Taja vyakula vitatu unavyovipenda.

Je, ni mambo gani matatu unayoshukuru kuwa yapo sasa hivi? Si lazima yawe makubwa.

Mwishoni mwa siku ngumu, kufikiria mambo matatu ya kushukuru kunaweza kutusaidia kupata ujasiri wa kujaribu tena kesho.

SourceText: One Thing Today
text: Jambo moja leo

SourceText:
Close your eyes and think about the day. 

Name one thing that you are grateful for. 
Name one thing that you did well. 
Name one thing that you love. 

Well done on taking time to take care of yourself.
text:
Funga macho yako na ufikirie kuhusu siku.

Taja jambo moja unaloshukuru.
Taja jambo moja ulilofanya vizuri
Taja kitu kimoja unachokipenda

Umefanya vizuri kuchukua muda wa kujijali.

SourceText: In and Out
text: Ndani na nje

SourceText:
Close your eyes.

Listen to your breath as it goes in and out five times.

Notice how you feel.

When you are ready, open your eyes again. You are in control!
text:
Funga macho yako.

Sikiliza pumzi yako inapoingia na kutoka mara tano.

Angalia jinsi unavyohisi.

Unapokuwa tayari, fungua macho yako tena. Unautulivu!

SourceText: Think About Today
text: Fikiria kuhusu leo

SourceText:
Close your eyes. 

Take a minute to think about the day.

Think about one positive or fun thing you did.
Praise yourself for one thing you did well today. 
Think of one thing you can do differently tomorrow.  
Think of one thing that you are grateful for.
text:
Fumba macho yako. 

Tumia dakika moja kufikiria siku ya leo.

Fikiria jambo moja chanya au la kufurahisha ulilolifanya.
Jisifie kwa jambo moja ulilolifanya vizuri leo. 
Fikiria jambo moja unaloweza kulifanya tofauti kesho.  

Fikiria jambo moja unalolishukuru.

SourceText: Pause to Respond
text: Simaamisha ili ujibu

SourceText:
Close your eyes. 

Do your children ever make you feel like screaming? 

Give yourself a 10-second pause. Breathe in and out slowly 5 times. 

Then try responding in a calmer way.

Millions of parents say this helps – A LOT.
text:
Fumba macho yako.

Je, watoto wako huwa wanakufanya utake kufoka?

Jipumzishe kwa sekunde 10. Vuta pumzi ndani na nje taratibu kwa mara 5.

Kisha jaribu kujibu kwa utulivu zaidi.

Mamilioni ya wazazi wanasema hii inasaidia - SANA.

SourceText: Small Things
text: Vitu Vidogo

SourceText:
Close your eyes.  

Take a moment to stop what you are doing and connect with your breath.   

What is one thing you can be grateful for right now?  
What is one thing that brings you happiness?  
What is one thing that you love?  

They do not have to be big. Sometimes the small things in life count the most!
text:
Fumba macho yako.

Acha kwa muda kile unachokifanya ili uhusiane na pumzi yako.

Je, ni jambo gani moja unalolishukuru sasa hivi?
Je, ni jambo gani moja linalokuletea furaha?
Je, ni jambo gani moja unalolipenda?

Si lazima yawe makubwa. Wakati mwingine mambo madogo maishani ndiyo muhimu zaidi!

SourceText: Body Scan
text: Uchunguzi wa mwili

SourceText:
Here is an activity to relax your body: 

Sit comfortably and close your eyes if you can. 
Imagine a golden ring scanning your body from your feet to your head.  
Pay attention as it moves up and down your body. Are there any areas that feel tense? Numb? Painful?  
Focus on those areas for a moment. Breathe into the area and, when you breathe out, try to let go of any tension or pain.  
Do this for a few breaths.  

Open your eyes. How does your body feel now?

You can also try this next time you find yourself lying in bed unable to sleep!
text:
Hapa kuna shughuli ya kupumzisha mwili wako:

Kaa kwa utulivu halafu ufumbe macho yako ukiweza.
Vuta picha kuwa pete ya dhahabu inauchunguza mwili wako kuanzia unyayoni hadi utosini.
Sikiliza kwa makini pindi inapojongea kwenda juu na chini ya mwili wako. Je, kuna maeneo yoyote yaliyokakamaa? Yaliyo na ganzi? Yaliyo na maumivu?
Tulia kwenye maeneo hayo kwa muda. Vutia pumzi kwenye eneo hilo na, unaposhusha pumzi, jaribu kuachilia hali yoyote ya kukakamaa au ya maumivu.
Fanya hivi kwa kuvuta pumzi kadhaa.

Fumbua macho yako. Je, mwili wako unahisije sasa?

Unaweza pia kujaribu hii wakati mwingine unapojikuta umelala kitandani huwezi kupata usingizi!

SourceText: Counting Sounds
text: Sauti za kuhesabu

SourceText:
Sit down and close your eyes.
How many sounds can you hear?  
Listen to the sounds inside and outside the room. Count them on your fingers. 
After ten seconds, how many fingers do you have up? What sounds did you hear? 

Try again for another ten seconds.  
Did you hear any new sounds? Did you hear any sounds inside your own body? 
Notice how you feel now.
text:
Kaa chini na ufumbe macho yako.
Je, unaweza kusikia sauti ngapi?
Sikiliza sauti za ndani na nje ya chumba. Zihesabu kwa vidole vyako.
Baada ya sekunde kumi, umefikisha vidole vingapi? Ulisikia sauti zipi?

Jaribu tena kwa sekunde kumi.
Je, umesikia sauti zozote mpya? Je, umesikia sauti zozote ndani ya mwili wako mwenyewe?
Chunguza jinsi unavyohisi sasa.

SourceText: Feel your Feelings
text: Sikia hisia zako

SourceText:
Close your eyes.

Do you ever feel something so strongly that you want to run away from it?

Instead of moving away from the feeling, let’s move towards it for a moment.
It is ok. Close your eyes if you feel comfortable. Take a deep breath.

Become curious. Where are you feeling it in your body? Is it hot or cold? Hard or soft? Tight or loose?
Ask yourself some questions. What is it telling me? What does it need? How can I be kind to myself right now?
text:
Fumba macho yako.

Je, huwa unahisi kitu kwa nguvu sana kiasi kwamba huwa unataka kukikimbia?

Badala ya kuikimbia hisia hiyo, hebu tuikimbilie kwa muda.
Si vibaya. Fumba macho yako kama unajisikia vizuri. Vuta pumzi ndefu.

Kuwa mdadisi. Je, unaisikia wapi kwenye mwili wako? Je, ni ya moto au baridi? Je, ni ngumu au laini? Je, imekakamaa au imelegea?
Jiulize maswali kadhaa. Je, inaniambia nini? Je, inahitaji nini? Je, ninawezaje kujitendea wema sasa hivi?

SourceText: Your Song
text: Wimbo wako

SourceText:
Here is something fun to help you let go of stress:   

Choose a song that reflects what you need in this moment. Do you need a gentle song to soothe your tired soul or an upbeat song to help you shake some stress out?   

Make a space and move your body to the music. Remember to breathe while you move. Let your breath and the movement go together. 

Even a few minutes of movement can be enough to release stress and lift your mood!
text:
Hapa kuna kitu cha kufurahisha cha kukusaidia kuondokana na msongo wa mawazo:

Chagua wimbo unaoendana na kile unachohitaji kwa sasa. Je, unahitaji wimbo wa taratibu ili kuibembeleza nafsi yako iliyochoka au unahitaji wimbo wa kuchangamsha ili kukusaidia kuondoa msongo wa mawazo kwa kiasi fulani?

Weka nafasi na uchezeshe mwili wako kulingana na muziki. Kumbuka kuvuta pumzi unapocheza. Fanya pumzi yako iendane na miondoko yako.

Hata dakika chache za kucheza  zinaweza kutosha kuondoa msongo wa mawazo na kuinua hali yako!

SourceText: Ground & Gratitude
text: Ardhi na Shukrani

SourceText:
Close your eyes.

Take a moment to feel the ground under your feet.
Think of something you feel grateful for.
Focus on your breath.
Breathe in and out.

In and out.
text:
Fumba macho yako.

Tumia muda kuhisi ardhi iliyopo chini ya miguu yako.
Fikiria kuhusu jambo unalolishukuru.
Makinikia upumuaji wako.
Vuta pumzi na kuzishusha.

Vuta na kushusha pumzi.

SourceText: Notice How You Feel
text: Tambua unavyojisikia

SourceText:
Hello! How are you feeling right now? Happy, sad, angry, excited, worried?

Notice where you feel it in your body. Notice what thoughts are connected to that feeling. Take a deep breath.

Thank yourself for taking the time to check in with your feelings and thoughts!
text:
Habari! Unajisikiaje sasa hivi? Furaha, huzuni, hasira, taharuki, wasiwasi?

Chunguza mahali unapohisi hali hiyo kwenye mwili wako. Chunguza ni mawazo yapi yanayohusiana na hisia hiyo. Vuta pumzi ndefu.

Jishukuru kwa kuchukua muda wa kuangalia hisia na mawazo yako!

SourceText: Pause Power
text: Nguvu ya kupumzika

SourceText:
Let’s practice a calming trick that we call ‘Pause Power’.

Plant your feet on the ground and breathe in and out three times as slowly as you can. Imagine you are smelling a flower or blowing out a candle.

How do you feel now?

This is a great trick to use when you are feeling frustrated because it will help to calm you down.
text:
Na tufanye mazoezi ya mbinu ya kujituliza tunayoiita 'Nguvu ya kupumzika'.

Wek miguu yako chini kwenye ardhi/sakafu na uvute pumzi ndani na uitoe nje mara tatu polepole kadili unavyoweza. Pata picha unaskia harufu ya ua au unazima mshumaa.

Unajiskiaje sasa?

Hii ni mbinu nzuri ya kutumia pale unapojiskia kuchanganyikiwa kwasababu itakusaidia kukutuliza.

SourceText: Taking Care of Yourself
text: Kujijali wewe mwenyewe

SourceText:
Sit comfortably and close your eyes. 

Recognise what is happening for you in this moment. What are you thinking? Are your thoughts positive or negative. How do you feel? Do you feel pleasant or unpleasant? How does your body feel? Do you feel tense or relaxed?

Connect to your heart in a kind and gentle way. You may want to place one hand on your heart or chest. Say the following words silently to yourself:

May I be peaceful.
May I be safe.
May I be healthy.
May I be happy.
May there be love in my family.
May I feel loved.

Take a moment to reflect on your experience. Notice if you feel any different.
text:
Kaa vizuri halafu ufumbe macho yako.

Tambua kinachokutokea muda huu. Unafikiria nini? Je, mawazo yako ni chanya au hasi? Je, unahisije? Je, unahisi kufurahi au kutofurahi? Je, mwili wako unahisije? Je, unahisi wasiwasi au umetulia?

Husiana na moyo wako kwa wema na upole. Unaweza kuhitaji kuweka mkono mmoja kwenye moyo wako au kifuani. Sema kimoyomoyo maneno yafuatayo:

Ninaomba niwe na amani.
Ninaomba niwe salama.
Ninaomba niwe na afya.
Ninaomba niwe na furaha.
Na upendo uwe kwenye familia yangu.
Ninaomba nihisi kupendwa.

Chukua muda kutafakari uzoefu wako. Angalia ikiwa unahisi tofauti yoyote.

SourceText: Take a Pause
text: Pumzika

SourceText:
Step 1. Close your eyes and take a deep breath. 

Step 2. Ask yourself, "What am I thinking?" Notice if your thoughts are positive or negative.
Notice how you are feeling emotionally. Notice if your emotions are pleasant or unpleasant. Remind yourself that whatever you feel, it is okay.
Notice how your body feels. Notice anything that hurts or is tense.

Step 3. Focus on your breath. Feel your breath as it goes in and out. You can put a hand on your stomach and feel it rise and fall with each breath. Do this for about 10 breaths.

Step 4. Expand your awareness to your whole body. Listen to the sounds in the room. 

Step 5. Take a moment to reflect on whether you feel any different. When you are ready, open your eyes.

Well done for taking a pause. You can do this anytime you are feeling stressed. It gives you a chance to be calmer. Even a few deep breaths or connecting with the ground beneath you can make a difference. You can also take a pause with your children!
text:
Hatua ya Kwanza. Fumba macho yako halafu uvute pumzi ndefu.

Hatua ya Pili. Jiulize, "Je, ninafikiria nini?" Chunguza kama mawazo yako ni chanya au hasi.
Angalia jinsi unavyojihisi. Chunguza kama mihemuko yako ni ya kufurahisha au kutofurahisha. Jikumbushe kwamba chochote unachohisi, si kibaya.
Chunguza jinsi mwili wako unavyohisi. Chunguza kitu chochote kinachoumiza au kinacholeta wasiwasi.

Hatua ya Tatu. Makinikia upumuaji wako. Hisi pumzi yako inapoingia na kutoka. Unaweza kuweka mkono kwenye tumbo lako na kuhisi linavyopanda na kushuka kwa kila pumzi. Fanya hivyo kwa mipumuo kama 10.

Hatua ya Nne. Panua ufahamu wako kuhusu mwili wako wote. Sikiliza sauti zilizomo chumbani.

Hatua ya Tano. Tumia muda kutafakari iwapo unahisi mabadiliko au la. Ukimaliza, fumbua macho yako.

Umefanya vizuri kwa kupumzika. Unaweza kufanya hivyo wakati wowote unapohisi msongo wa mawazo. Inakupa nafasi ya kuwa mtulivu. Hata pumzi chache za kina au kuunganishwa na ardhi chini yako kunaweza kuleta mabadiliko. Unaweza pia kuchukua pumziko na watoto wako!

SourceText: Physical Activity
text: Shughuli ya viungo

SourceText:
Stand up and stretch your arms up to the sky. Push away any clouds and let the sun shine down on you. Stretch to both sides. Stretch to the front and to the back.

Let your hands hang by your side. Squeeze your shoulders tightly up to your ears as you breathe in, scrunch your eyes, and hold your breath. Release your shoulders as you relax your body.

Relax your arms and let them swing sideways while you turn your upper body. Your arms should gently hit your back as you twist from side to side.

Place one foot in front of the other and make small circles from your ankles – remember to turn to both sides. Do each foot with four circles in each direction.

Now shake your whole body as fast as you can. Shake it up high! Shake it down low! Shake it all around!

Close your eyes and raise your arms slowly above your head as you breathe in. Lower your arms slowly to your side as you breathe out.

Take a moment to reflect on your experience.

Well done! You can do this activity at any time whenever you feel like you need to release stress and energise your mind and body.
text:
Simama na unyooshe mikono yako juu angani. Sukuma mawingu yote na uache jua likuangazie. Jinyooshe kwenda kulia na kushoto. Jinyooshe kwenda mbele na nyuma.

Acha mikono yako ining'inie ubavuni mwako. Kaza mabega yako na kuyapandisha hadi kwenye masikio yako huku ukipumua, bana macho yako, na ushikilie pumzi yako. Legeza mabega yako wakati unapolegeza mwili wako.

Legeza mikono yako na uibembeze ubavuni, wakati unabinua upande wa juu wa kiwiliwili chako. Mikono yako inapaswa kupiga polepole mgongo wako unapojigeuza kutoka upande mmoja hadi mwingine.

Weka mguu mmoja mbele ya mwingine na fanya miduara midogo kwa kutumia vifundo vya miguu - kumbuka kugeukia pande zote mbili. Kila mguu ufanye miduara minne kwa kila upande.

Sasa tikisa mwili wako wote haraka kadri uwezavyo. Tikisa upande wa juu kabisa! Tikisa upande wa chini kabisa! Tikisa mwili wote!

Fumba macho yako na uinue mikono yako polepole kuzidi kichwa chako huku ukivuta pumzi. Teremsha mikono yako polepole kuelekea ubavuni mwako huku ukishusha pumzi.

Tumia muda kutafakari hali uliyoipitia.

Umefanya vizuri! Unaweza kufanya shughuli hii wakati wowote unapohisi kama unahitaji kutoa msongo wa mawazo na kutia nguvu akili na mwili wako.

SourceText: Connect
text: Unganisha

SourceText: When you take care of yourself, you take care of your children. We all need to connect. Try to talk to friends, family, and other support networks every day. If it has been a while since you reached out to someone, do it now!
text: Unapojitunza wewe mwenyewe, unawatunza watoto wako. Sisi sote tunahitaji kuhusiana. Kila siku, jaribu kuzungumza na marafiki, familia, na mitandao mingine inayosaidia. Kama umepita muda tangu ulipowasiliana na mtu fulani, fanya hivyo sasa!

SourceText: Prevent Anger
text: Zuia Hasira

SourceText:
Think about what makes you angry. When does it happen? How do you normally react?

Prevent anger from starting in the first place. Get some sleep or rest when you are tired. Try to eat something when you are hungry. Ask someone for support when you are feeling alone.
text:
Jambo linalokukasirisha. Je, linatokea wakati gani? Je, kwa kawaida, mwitikio wako huwa ni upi?

Zuia hasira kabla hata haijapanda. Unapokuwa umechoka, lala usingizi au pumzika. Unapokuwa na njaa, jaribu kula kitu. Unapokuwa mpweke, omba msaada kwa mtu.

SourceText: Angry? Take a Break
text: Je una hasira? Pumzika

SourceText:
Managing anger can be really difficult. Take a break when you feel you are getting angry at your children or someone else.

Go somewhere else for 5 minutes to regain control of your emotions. If you have a safe outdoor space, go outside. You can get through this!
text:
Kudhibiti hasira kunaweza kuwa kugumu. Pumzika unapohisi unawakasirikia watoto wako au mtu mwingine.

Nenda mahali pengine kwa dakika 5 ili uweze kudhibiti tena hisia zako. Kama una mahali salama nje, nenda nje. Una uwezo wa kulimaliza jambo hili!

SourceText: What’s in Your Cup?
text: Nini kipo kwenye kikombe chako?

SourceText:
Close your eyes. Imagine you are holding a cup, filled with tea. Then someone walks by and bumps into you, making you spill your tea everywhere. 
Why did you spill the tea? Because someone bumped into you? Not exactly. 
 You spilled tea, because there was tea in your cup. Had there been coffee in the cup, you would have spilled coffee. 
 What does this mean?
It means that: Whatever is inside your cup, is what will spill out.
In the same way, when life comes along and shakes you, whatever is inside you, is what will spill out. Life provides the cup, you choose what to fill it with.
So take a moment to think about what you want to fill your cup with. 
Let’s work towards filling our cups with gratitude, forgiveness, joy, strength, and kindness.
text:
Fumba macho yako. Fikiria umeshika kikombe, kilichojaa chai. Halafu mtu anatembea n na kukugonga, na kukufanya umwage chai yako kila mahali. Kwanini umemwaga chai? Kwasababu kuna mtu amekugonga. Si hivyo, umemwaga chai kwasababu kulikuwa na chai kwenye kikombe chako. Kulikuwa na kahawa kwenye kikombe, ungemwaga kahawa.
Ina maana kwamba: Chochote kilicho ndani ya kikombe chako ndicho kitakachomwaka nje.
Kwa jinsi hiyo, pale maisha yanapokutingisha, chochote kilicho ndani yako, ndicho kitakachomwagika nje. Maisha yanakupa kikombe, unachagua nini cha kujaza ndani yake. Hivyo pata muda kidogo kufikiri kuhusu unataka kikombe chako kukijaza nini.
Hebu tufanye kazi ya kujaza vikombe vyetu kwa shukrani, furaha, nguvu, na wema.

SourceText: Breathe
text: Vuta pumzi

SourceText: Breathing activities help relax both your mind and body.
text: Shughuli za kupumua zinasaidia kupumzisha vyote akili yako na mwili.

SourceText: Reflect
text: Tafakari

SourceText: Take a moment to reflect and focus your thoughts on what really matters to you.
text: Pata muda kutafakari na zingatia mawazo yako juu ya kile ambacho ni muhimu kabisa kwako.

SourceText: Notice
text: Kutambua

SourceText: Notice and connect with what happens around you and inside you.
text: Fanya utambuzi na unganisha na kile kinachotokea karibu yako na ndani yako.

SourceText: Move
text: Sogeza

SourceText: Move your body to relieve some stress.
text: Chezesha mwili wako ili kuondoa msongo wa mawazo.

SourceText: Learning Through Play
text: Kujifunza kupitia kucheza

SourceText: Woman
text: Mwanamke

SourceText: Man
text: Mwanaume

SourceText: Prefer not to say
text: Ningependa nisiseme

SourceText: Parent or caregiver
text: Mzazi au mlezi

SourceText: Facilitator
text: Mwezeshaji

SourceText: System tester
text: Mjaribu wa mfumo
