SourceText: Akku drew a brick... "This is the STUPID BRICK that I tripped over this morning," said Akku. "You’re right. That IS a VERY STUPID brick!" said Appa.
text: Akku alichora tofari... "Hili ni lile tofali jinga lililonikwaa asubuhi," alisema Akku. "Umegonga ndipo,hilo ni tofari jinga sana!" alisema Appa.

SourceText: And Akku drew a boy... "This is Bikku, a VERY BAD BOY! He laughed when I fell down!" said Akku. "You’re right," said Appa. "He shouldn’t have laughed at you."
text: Akku alichora kijana. "Huyu ni Bikku. Kijana mbaya sana! Alicheka nilipoanguka!" alisema Akku. ", Umesema sawa sawa" alisema Baba. "Hakutakiwa kukucheka,"

SourceText: And Akku drew an idli... "This is my idli," said Akku. "It fell out of my lunch box when I tripped over the STUPID BRICK!"
text: Na Akku alichora idli... "Hii ni idli yangu." Akku alisema "Ilianguka nje ya mkebe wangu wa chakula nilipotegwa na tofali na kuanguka!"

SourceText: And Akku drew a crow... "This is the VERY BAD CROW that flew off with my idli," said Akku. "The crow must have been very hungry," said Appa.
text: Na Akku akachora Kunguru... "Huyu ni kunguru mbaya sana mwenye alienda na idli," Akku alisema. "Huenda kunguru alisikia njaa sana," Appa alisema.

SourceText: And Akku drew her teacher... "This is my teacher, Amala Miss," said Akku. "She helped me up when I fell down. And then she hugged me." "That’s nice of her," said Appa "And then she pinched my cheeks. I DON’T LIKE IT when my cheeks are pinched." "Oho! That must have HURT, no?" "A little bit. But I’m okay now." "That’s good."
text: Na Akku alimchora mwalimu wake... "Huyu ni mwalimu wangu, Bi.Amala," Akku alisema. "Alinisaidia nilipoanguka kisha akanikumbatia." "Hiyo ni zuri sana kwake," alisema Appa. "Kisha alinichuna kwa mashavu yangu. Sipendi kuchunwa mashavu." "Salale! Hio iliumiza sana, hapana?" "Kiasi tu. Ila niko sawa." "Hiyo ni sawa."

SourceText: "See how well you draw, Akku?" said Appa. "You’re a real artist! Will you draw something for Amma too?" "OH-kay!" said Akku, and started drawing some more. "This is a little white mouse... and this is a boat... and this is a coconut tree..."
text: "Angalia namna unavyochora vizuri Akku?" Alisema Appa. "Wewe ni msanii wa kweli! Utachora kitu cha Amma, pia?" "Sawa!" Akku alisema, na akaanza kuchora zingine zaidi. "Hii ni panya ndogo... na hii ni meli... na huu ni mnazi..."

SourceText: "And this is a sun flower... and this is your cycle, Appa... and this is a dog... and this is a frog..." In no time, Akku had forgotten all about the STUPID BRICK that made her trip and fall. And about the BAD BOY who laughed at her. And about the IDLI- STEALING CROW. And Akku even forgot about being ANGRY.
text: ''''Na hii ni alizeti.... na hii ni baiskeli yako Appa.... na huyu ni mbwa.... na huyu ni chura....''''Kwa kipindi kifupi, Akku alikuwa amesahau na lile tofali lililomuangusha. Na kuhusu yule kijana mkorofi aliyemcheka. Na kuhusu IDLI.... Kunguru aliyeiba. Na Akku akasahau alikuwa amekasirika.

SourceText:
10 Things to Do If You Feel ANGRY like Akku:
1. Laugh loudly and jump around with your arms in the air!
2. Slowly – very, very slowly – breathe in, and breathe out!
3. Drink some water! Or buttermilk! 
4. Eat a piece of fruit! Or a vada!
5. Tell a grown-up about how you’re feeling!
6. Write about how you’re feeling!
7. Draw it out! Paint it!
8. Play with a pile of clay!
9. Make up a song about your anger! Sing it aloud!
10. Dance like a monkey!
text:
Vitu kumi vya kufanya ukikasirika kama Akku;
1. Cheka kwa sauti na urukeruke huku mikono yako ikiwa hewani!
2. Polepole tu vuta pumzi ndani tena nje.!
3. Kunywa maji kidogo au maziwa!
4. Kula kipande cha tunda au chakula!
5. Mwambie mkubwa unavyojisikia!
6. Andika unavyojisikia!
7. Chora! paka rangi!
8. Cheza na mchanga!
9. Tunga wimbo kuhusu hasira zako na uuimbe!
10. Cheza kama Ngedere!

SourceText: Beloved Daughter
text: Binti mpendwa

SourceText: Natabo has run away from her home! Do you know why?
text: Natabo amekimbia nyumbani! Unajua ni kwanini?

SourceText:
© African Storybook Initiative, 2016. Some rights reserved. Released
under CC BY 4.0 license.
text: ©African Storybook Initiative, 20016. Haki zingine zimehifadhiwa. Imetolewa chini ya leseni ya CC BY 4.0.

SourceText: This is Natabo. She has six brothers.
text: Huyu ni Natabo. Ana kaka sita.

SourceText: Her parents give her a small pot. She loves it.
text: Wazazi wake walimpa chungu kidogo. Anakipenda.

SourceText: One day her brothers break the pot.
text: Siku moja kaka zake walikivunja.

SourceText: Natabo cannot find her pot. She cries and cries.
text: Natabo haoni chungu chake. Analia na kulia.

SourceText: Natabo runs away. She climbs a tall tree.
text: Natabo anakimbia. Anapanda mti mrefu.

SourceText: Her parents find her. "Please come down," they ask.
text: Wazazi wake wakamkuta. "Tafadhali shuka chini," walimuomba.

SourceText: Her brothers sing, "Please come down."
text: Kaka zake wanaimba, "Tafadhali shuka chini"

SourceText: Natabo makes fun of their song.
text: Natabo anaufanyia mzaha wimbo wao.

SourceText: Then Natabo's friend comes. "Please come down," she sings.
text: Halafu rafiki wa Natabo anakuja. "Tafadhali njoo chini," anaimba.

SourceText: Natabo's friend sings until she comes down from the tree.
text: Rafiki wa Natabo anaimba mpaka anakuja chini kutoka kwenye mti.

SourceText: The friends walk home together.
text: Marafiki walitembea pamoja kwenrda nyumbani.

SourceText: Everyone celebrates that Natabo is home. Natabo gets a new pot!
text: Kila mmoja anasherehekea kuwa Natabo yupo nyumbani. Natabo anapata sufuria mpya!

SourceText: Big Blue Bus
text: Basi kubwa la bluu

SourceText: Ebei and his mother are waiting for the big blue bus. Where is it?
text: Ebei na Mama yake wanasubiri basi kubwa la bluu. Liko wapi?

SourceText: There was only one bus in Ebei's village. It was big and blue. It was very noisy.
text: Kulikuwa na basi moja tu katika kijiji cha Ebei. Lilikuwa basi kubwa lenye rangi ya bluu. Lilinguruma sana.

SourceText: "Tomorrow we will go to town," said Ebei's mother. "We will buy your school uniform."
text: Siku moja mamake Ebei alisema, "Kesho tutaenda mjini kununua sare yako ya shule."

SourceText: Ebei was very excited. They would travel in the big blue bus. He could not sleep that night.
text: Ebei alifurahi sana. Kumbe atasafiri katika lile basi kubwa la bluu! Usiku huo hakuweza kulala vizuri.

SourceText: When his mother came to wake him, Ebei was already dressed.
text: Mamake alipoenda kumuamsha, Ebei alikuwa tayari amevaa.

SourceText: Ebei and his mother walked to the bus stop. They waited for the big blue bus. But the bus did not come.
text: Ebei na mamake walienda kwenye kituo cha basi. Walisubiri lile basi kubwa la bluu. Basi halikufika.

SourceText: Other people arrived at the bus stop. They complained because the bus was late. "Where is the bus?" they asked.
text: Watu wengine walifika kwenye kituo cha basi. Wote walilalamika kuwa basi lilichelewa. Mmoja aliuliza, "Basi limetuacha?"

SourceText: Ebei was worried. "We will not be able to go to town," he thought. "I will not be able to get my uniform."
text: Ebei alikuwa na wasiswasi. "Tusipokwenda mjini, sitapata sare yangu ya shule," aliwaza.

SourceText: Some people gave up and went home. Ebei cried. He did not want to go. "We will wait a bit longer," said his mother.
text: Baadhi yao walikata tamaa wakarudi nyumbani. Lakini Ebei alilia akakataa kurudi. "Tutasubiri zaidi," mamake alimtuliza.

SourceText: Suddenly, they heard a noise. They saw dust in the air. The bus was coming!
text: Ghafla, walisikia mngurumo. Wakaona vumbi hewani. Basi lilikuwa linakuja kwa kasi.

SourceText: But this bus was not blue. It was not big. It was red and small. The people did not want to get in this bus.
text: Basi halikuwa la bluu wala halikuwa kubwa. Basi lile lilikuwa dogo na jekundu. Waliosubiri waliliangalia tu na hawakuingia ndani.

SourceText: "Get in! Get in!" shouted the driver. "We are very late today," he called.
text: Dereva aliwaita, "Ingieni! Ingieni! Tumechelewa sana leo."

SourceText: Ebei and his mother got in first. Soon everyone else got in the small red bus.
text: Ebei na mamake walikuwa wa kwanza kuingia. Mara wote waliingia ndani ya basi lile dogo jekundu.

SourceText: Ebei looked out the window. He saw more people at the bus stop.
text: Ebei alichungulia dirishani. Aliwaona watu wengi zaidi wakiingia ndani ya basi.

SourceText: Even more people were running to catch the bus. But they were too late. The red bus was full. It left for town.
text: Mara basi likaondoka. Ebei aliwaona watu wengine wakikimbia kulifikia basi. Walikuwa tayari wamechelewa.

SourceText: "Where is the big blue bus?" asked Ebei's mother. "It broke down," replied the driver. "We are fixing it. It will come tomorrow."
text: Mamake Ebei alimuuliza dereva, "Liko wapi basi kubwa la bluu?" Dereva alimjibu, "Samahani mama, basi la bluu liliharibika. Linatengeneza Kesho litakuja."

SourceText: Ebei did not care about the colour of the bus. He did not care about the size. This bus was going to town!
text: Ebei hakujali rangi wala ukubwa wa basi. Alifurahi kuwa basi lile lilikuwa linawapeleka mjini. Hatimaye, atanunuliwa sare ya shule.

SourceText: Decision
text: Uamuzi

SourceText: A village takes a decision together to change their lives for the better.
text: Kijiji kilichukua uamuzi wa pamoja kubadilisha maisha yao yawe mazuri.

SourceText: © African Storybook Initiative, 2015. Some rights reserved. Released under CC BY 4.0 license.
text: African Storybook Initiative, 2015. Haki zingine zimehifadhiwa. Imetolewa chini ya leseni ya CC BY 4.0.

SourceText: My village had many problems. We made a long line to fetch water from one tap.
text: Kijiji changu kilikuwa na matatizo mengi. Tulipanga foleni ndefu kuchota maji kutoka kwenye bomba moja.

SourceText: We waited for food donated by others.
text: Tulisubiri chakula cha msaada kilichotolewa na wengine.

SourceText: We locked our houses early because of thieves.
text: Tulifunga nyumba zetu mapema kwasababu ya wezi.

SourceText: Many children dropped out of school.
text: Watoto wengi waliacha shule.

SourceText: Young girls worked as maids in other villages.
text: Wasichana wadogo walifanya kazi kama wasaidizi wa nyumbani kwenye vijiji vingine.

SourceText: Young boys roamed around the village while others worked on people's farms.
text: Mvulana mmoja mdogo alizungukazunguka kijijini wakati wengine walifanya kazi kwenye mashamba ya watu.

SourceText: When the wind blew, waste paper hung on trees and fences.
text: Upepo ulipovuma takataka za karatasi zilining"inia kwenye miti na uzio.

SourceText: People were cut by broken glass that was thrown carelessly.
text: Watu walikatwa na chupa zilizovunjika na kutupwa kwa uzembe.

SourceText: Then one day, the tap dried up and our containers were empty.
text: Halafu siku moja, maji yalikatika bomba na vyombo vyetu havikuwa na maji.

SourceText: My father walked from house to house asking people to attend a village meeting.
text: Baba yangu alitembea nyumba hadi nyumba kuomba watu wahudhurie mkutano wa kijiji.

SourceText: People gathered under a big tree and listened.
text: Watu walikusanyika chini ya mti mkubwa na walisikiliza.

SourceText: My father stood up and said, "We need to work together to solve our problems."
text: Baba yangu alisimama na alisema.,"Tunahitaji kufanya kazi pamoja kutatua matatizo yetu."

SourceText: Eight-year-old Juma, sitting on a tree trunk shouted, "I can help with cleaning up."
text: Juma mwenye umri wa miaka nane amekaa kwenye tawi kubwa la mti alisema kwa sauti, " Naweza kusaidia kufanya usafi."

SourceText: One woman said, "The women can join me to grow food."
text: Mwanamke mmoja alisema, "Wanaweka wanaweza kuungana na mimi kulima chakula."

SourceText: Another man stood up and said, "The men will dig a well."
text: Mwanaume mwingine alisimama na alisema, " Wanaume watachimba kisima."

SourceText: We all shouted with one voice, "We must change our lives." From that day we worked together to solve our problems.
text: Sote tulipiga kelele kwa sauti, "Ni lazima tubadilishe maisha yetu." Toka siku ile tulifanya kazi pamoja kutatua matatizo yetu.

SourceText: Emotions Come and Go
text: Hisia huja na kwenda

SourceText: Look out for the emotions you feel and why!
text: Angalia hisia unazojiskia na kwanini!

SourceText: © African Storybook Initiative, 2019. Some rights reserved. Released under CC BY 4.0 license.
text: © African Storybook Initiative, 2019. Haki zingine zimehifadhiwa. Imetolewa chini ya leseni ya CC BY 4.0.

SourceText: Ada is chuckling because she heard a funny story. She is smiling. What is Ada feeling?
text: Ada anacheka kwa sababu alisikia hadithi ya kuchekesha. Anatabasamu. Ada anahisi nini?

SourceText: Gisa is feeling grumpy. He has a scowl on his face. Why is he irritated?
text: James anahisi hasira. Ana mkunjo kwenye paji la uso. Kwa nini amekasirika?

SourceText: Yuadoo is scared of the dark. Everyone feels fear sometimes. But Yuadoo can ask for help.
text: Adela anaogopa giza. Kila mtu huhisi hofu wakati mwingine. Lakini Adela anaweza kuomba msaada.

SourceText: Chidubem is worried about his school work. He can tell his teacher. He can ask for help.
text: Chidu ana wasiwasi juu ya kazi yake ya shule. Anaweza kumwambia mwalimu wake. Anaweza kuomba msaada.

SourceText: Lushan is playing around! It's okay to be silly sometimes.
text: Nathan anacheza cheza! Ni sawa kufanya mchezo wakati mwingine.

SourceText: Eruro is feeling sad. It's okay to cry. Emotions come and go.
text: Ethan anajisikia mwenye huzuni. Ni sawa kulia. Hisia huja na kuondoka.

SourceText: Ayator is bursting with happiness. He is joyful. Emotions come and go.
text: Zawadi amejawa na furaha. Yeye amefurahi. Hisia huja na kuondoka.

SourceText: Hadiza is bored. She needs to find something to do.
text: Hadija anahisi kuchoka. Anahitaji kupata kitu cha kufanya.

SourceText: Ayo is angry. He is frustrated. Anger is a difficult feeling.
text: Ayo amekasirika. Amechanganyikiwa. Hasira ni hisia ngumu.

SourceText: Labake is excited. What's the cause of her excitement? Mother made her favourite food.
text: Lizi amefurahishwa. Je! Ni nini sababu ya kufurahi kwake? Mama alitayarisha chakula akipendacho.

SourceText: Zege felt sleepy. He was very tired. "But wait, is 'sleepy' an emotion?" asks Efe.
text: Zakayo alihisi usingizi. Alikuwa amechoka sana. "Lakini, 'kuhisi usingizi' ni hisia?" Sefu anauliza.

SourceText: Efe is confused! Can you answer his question?
text: Sefu amechanganyikiwa! Je! Unaweza kujibu swali lake?

SourceText: Tega is feeling surprise and shock. He heard some gossip. Is it true?
text: Tumaini anahisi mshangao na mshtuko. Alisikia uvumi fulani. Ni ukweli?

SourceText: Yebo is sick. She feels miserable. She needs some medicine and rest to feel better.
text: Nelly ni mgonjwa. Anahisi huzuni. Anahitaji dawa na kupumzika ili ajisikie bora.

SourceText: Sekyen is feeling content. She has finished her chores. Now she can play.
text: Selina anahisi kutosheka. Amemaliza kazi zake za nyumbani. Sasa anaweza kucheza.

SourceText: Vandefan does not have chores today. He shows two thumbs up to Sekyen. "Good job, now let's play!" he says.
text: Victor hana kazi leo. Anamwonyesha Selina vidole viwili. "Kazi nzuri, sasa hebu tucheze!" anasema.

SourceText: Jasu Loves Football
text: Jasu na Mpira

SourceText: Jasu loves football. She loves kicking the ball, hard! But she doesn't have her own ball. Jasu comes up with a plan.
text: Jasu ni msichana aliyependa kucheza mpira. Lakini hakukuwa na mpira. Jasu alitafuta mbinu!

SourceText: © Room to Read, 2016. Some rights reserved. Released under CC BY 4.0 license.
text: © Room to Read, 2016. Haki zingine zimehifadhiwa. Imetolewa chini ya leseni ya CC BY 4.0.

SourceText: Jasu liked to play football.
text: Alitamani sana kucheza mpira.

SourceText: But she lost her ball!
text: Lakini alipoteza mpira wake.

SourceText: She looked for old socks, scrap paper, and thread.
text: Jasu alitafuta soksi, karatasi na kamba.

SourceText: She made a ball.
text: Alitengeneza mpira.

SourceText: Jasu kicked her ball everywhere she went.
text: Kila alipokwenda Jasu aliupiga mpira.

SourceText: Jasu went to visit her grandpa. She kicked her ball into his mango tree. Some mangoes dropped.
text: Alipokwenda kwa babu aliupiga mpira juu. Mpira ulidondosha maembe machanga.

SourceText: Grandpa wasn’t happy. He told Jasu to be careful. Jasu apologized.
text: Babu hakufurahia. Alimwambia Jasu awe mwangalifu. Jasu alimwahidi babu kutorudia tena.

SourceText: Jasu went to the market with her mother.
text: Jasu alikwenda sokoni na mama yake.

SourceText: She kicked her ball.
text: Jasu aliupiga mpira.

SourceText: It landed in a basket of tomatoes. Tomatoes fell to the ground!
text: Mpira ukamwaga nyanya.

SourceText: Mama told Jasu not to play around. Jasu apologized again.
text: Mama alimwambia Jasu asicheze sokoni. Jasu aliomba msamaha.

SourceText: Jasu carried her ball all the way home.
text: Jasu alihuzunika akaubeba mpira wake hadi nyumbani.

SourceText: At home, Jasu went to the playground with her friends. They played happily.
text: Alipofika, aliwafuata marafiki zake wakacheze uwanjani.

SourceText: Grandpa was happy that Jasu is playing in a safe place. He bought Jasu a nice new ball. Every evening, the neighborhood kids gathered to play at the playground.
text: Babu alikuwa na furaha kwamba Jasu anacheza sehemu salama. Alimnunulia Jasu mpira mpya mzuri. Kila jioni, watoto wa majirani walikusanyika kucheza pamoja.

SourceText: Jasu likes kicking the new ball with her friends...
text: Jasu anapenda kuchezea mpira mpya na rafiki zake...

SourceText: ...but Jasu still loves her old ball, too.
text: ...lakini Jasu bado anaupenda mpira wake wa zamani pia.

SourceText: Discuss the book’s cover. Ask: What do you see? Where is the millipede shongololo sitting?
text: Jadili ganda kitabu. Uliza: Unaona nini? Jongoo shongololo amekaa wapi?

SourceText: Shongololo's Shoes
text: Viatu vya Shongololos

SourceText: Shongololo has lost his shoes, and the other animals are NOT being very helpful. Will he ever find them?
text: Shogololo amepoteza viatu vyake, na wanyama wengine sio wa msaada sana. Je ataviona?

SourceText: © Book Dash, 2016. Some rights reserved. Released under CC BY 4.0 license.
text: © Book Dash, 2002. Haki zimehifadhiwa. Imetolewa chini ya leseni ya CC BY 4.0.

SourceText: Where are all my shoes? I know I left them here!
text: Viatu vyangu viko wapi? Nafahamu niliviacha hapa!

SourceText: Use descriptive words and explanations to talk about the pictures. The long millipede has many tiny little feet. I think he is looking for his shoes. I see some yellow boots scattered across the floor. Do you think those are his shoes?
text: Tumia maneno ya kujielezea na kudadavua kuzungumza kuhusu picha. Jongoo mrefu ana miguu mingi midogo. Nafikiri anatafuta viatu vyake. Naona buti za njano zimetawanyika kwenye sakafu. Unafikiri hivyo ni viatu vyake?

SourceText: I haven’t seen your shoes. Go ask Snail!
text: Sijaviona viatu vyako. Nenda umuulize konokono!

SourceText: Ask your child questions to help them think about what is happening. Ask: What is he holding in his hand? Who do you think that belongs to?
text: Uliza mtoto wako maswali kuwasaidia wafikiri kuhusu nini kinaendelea. Uliza: Ameshika nini mkononi mwake.? Unafikiri ile ni ya nani?

SourceText: No shoes here. Go ask Giraffe.
text: Hakuna viatu hapa. Nenda umuulize twiga.

SourceText: To help your child understand, explain what is happening. Say: Look, the snail is using one of the millipede’s shoes as a shell for his back. Ask: how do you think the shongololo feels about that?
text: Kumsaidia mtoto wako kuelewa, elezea nini kinatokea. Sema: Tazama, Konokono anatumia moja ya viatu kama gamba kwa mgongo wake. Uliza: unafiri Jongoo anajiskiaje kuhusu hilo?

SourceText: I’m in a hurry – go ask Frog.
text: Mimi nina haraka. Nenda umuulize chura.

SourceText: Ask: What does the giraffe have on her head? What is she doing? Can you count all her spots?
text: Uliza: Twiga ana nini kichwani kwake? Anafanya nini? Unaweza kuhesabu madoa yake?

SourceText: Shoes? How many? Go ask Flamingo.
text: Viatu? Vipo vingapi? Nenda umuulize korongo.

SourceText: Ask: Where is the frog sitting? What colours can you see in this picture?
text: Uliza: Chura amekaa wapi? Unaweza kuona rangi gani kwenye hii picha?

SourceText: Seen your shoes? No, not me.
text: Umeona viatu vyako? Hapana, siyo mimi.

SourceText: Mimic actions from the story. Say: Look, the flamingo is standing on one leg. Can you stand on one leg like flamingo?
text: Igiza vitendo kutoka kwenye hadithi. Sema: Tazama, ndege flamingo amesimama kwa mguu mmoja. Unaweza kusimama kwa mguu mmoja kama ndege flamingo?

SourceText: Will I ever find my shoes?
text: Hivi, nitavipata viatu vyangu?

SourceText: Talk about what the characters might be thinking or feeling. Ask: how does he feel? Why do you think he feels that way?
text: Ongea kuhusu kile ambacho wahusika wanaweza kufikiria au kujiskia. Uliza: Anajiskiaje? Unafikiri kwanini anajiskia hivyo?

SourceText: Shoes, eh? You should ask the Monkeys.
text: Viatu, eeh? Ungewauliza nyani.

SourceText: Ask: What is the fox using the shoe for? What do you think is in the shoe? Would you drink something out of a shoe?
text: Uliza: Mbweha anatumia kiatu kwaajili ya nini? Unafikiri ndani ya kiatu kuna nini? Ungeweza kunywa kitu flani kutoka kwenye kiatu?

SourceText: Hello hello? We’re busy. Go ask Owl, she knows everything!
text: Hallo, hallo? Tuna kazi nyingi. Naenda umuulize bundi, anafahamu kila kitu!

SourceText: Use a lively, playful voice, with different voices for different characters. Pretend to be the monkeys talking to each other in funny voices.
text: Tumia sauti yenye uchangamfu, ya kucheza, yenye sauti tofauti kwa wahusika tofauti, Igiza kuwa kama ngedere wanaoongea wao kwa wao kwa sauti za kufurahisha.

SourceText: Hmm. I have an idea. Why don’t you ask Lion?
text: Hmm, nina wazo. Kwanini usimuulize simba?

SourceText: Connect what is happening in the book with your child’s experiences. Say: Look, the owl is reading a book, just like us. What are some of your favourite books or stories?
text: Unganisha nini kinatokea kwenye kitabu na uzoefu wa mtoto wako. Sema: Tazama, bundi anasoma kitabu, kama sisi. Je ni vitabu gani au hadithi gani unazipenda zaidi?

SourceText: These are yours? I’ll give them all back if you come to my party!
text: Hivi ni vya kwako? Nitavirudisha kama utakuja kwenye sherehe yangu!

SourceText: Ask: what does the lion have in his hair? How many shoes can you see? Which of all the animals has the most shoes?
text: Uliza: Simba ana nini kwenye nywele zake? Unaweza kuona viatu vingapi? Ni mnyama gani kati ya wanyama wote ana viatu vingi zaidi?

SourceText: Use the pictures to help your child practice counting. You can ask your child to count, or count out loud for your child. Say: how many animals are there? And how many flags? Can you count all of Shongololo's yellow shoes?
text: Tumia picha kumsaidia mtoto wako kufanya mazoezi ya kuhesabu. Unaweza kumwambia mtoto wako kuhesabu. au mhesabie mtoto wako kwa sauti. Sema: Wanyama wangapi wako pale? Na bendera ngapi? unaweza kuhesabu viatu vyote vya njano vya Jongoo?

SourceText: Act out events from the book at a later stage. You can hide shoes around the house for your child to try and find. Think of funny or creative places to hide the shoes!
text: Igiza matukio ya hatua za mbele kutoka kwenye kitabu. Unaweza kuficha viatu karibu na nyumba ili mtoto wako ajaribu kuvitafuta. Fikiria sehemu ya kufurahisha au ya ubunifu ya kuficha viatu!

SourceText: What’s next?
text: Nini kinafata?

SourceText: Once the school bell rings, the excitement begins. Grandpa picks Fatima up from school. What adventures will they have?
text: Mara kengele ya shule inapolia, furaha inaanza. Babu anamchukua Fatima kumpeleka shule Watakuwa na matukio gani ya kufurahisha?

SourceText: This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 Licence (http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/).
text: Kazi hii imepewa leseni chini ya Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 Licence (http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/).

SourceText: Fatima is always busy! She loves to run and play.
text: Daima Fatima anakuwa busy (anakuwa na mambo mengi)! Anapenda kukimbia na kucheza.

SourceText: Her favourite part of the day is when Grandpa arrives. "How should we spend our day, Fatima?" asks Grandpa.
text: Kitu anachokipenda zaidi katika siku ni pale Babu anafika. "Fatima, Je tunapaswa kuitumiaje siku yetu?" anauliza Babu.

SourceText: "I know!" says Fatima. "Let’s go to the park."
text: "Najua!" anasema Fatima. "Twende kwenye Bustani."

SourceText: "I can see the whole world from up here," Fatima shouts.
text: "Kutokea hapa juu naweza kuiona sehemu kubwa sana." Fatima aliongea kwa sauti.

SourceText: "I have an idea!" "Let’s play superheroes and pick up the litter," says Fatima.
text: "Nina wazo!" "Tucheze mchezo wa mashujaa na tuokote takataka," alisema Fatima.

SourceText: "Great stuff! Now you can see all the flowers." "What’s next?" asks Grandpa.
text: "Safi! Sasa unaweza kuona maua yote" "Nini kinafata?" anauliza Babu.

SourceText: "Weeeeeeeee!" "What a crazy cool kid you are!" says Grandpa. "What’s next?"
text: "Weeeeeeeee!" "Wewe ni mtoto mzuri sana!" anasema Babu. "Nini kinafata?"

SourceText: "How about something cold and delicious?" says Fatima.
text: "Unaonaje tupate kitu chochote cha baridi na kitamu?" Anasema Fatima

SourceText: "What’s next, kiddo?" asks Grandpa. Fatima yawns. "Let’s go home."
text: "Tufanye nini tena, Mtoto?” anasema Babu. Fatima anapiga miayo.

SourceText: "Hello, Fatima," says Mum. "What did you and Grandpa do today?"
text: "Mambo, Fatima," anasema Mama. "Mlifanya nini pamoja na Babu leo?" "Si sana" wote walisema.

SourceText: "Not much!" they both say.
text: "Si sana" wote walisema.

SourceText: "What should we do tomorrow?" asks Fatima.
text: "Tufanye nini kesho?" Anauliza Fatima.

SourceText: Fatima hurries to bed. She is excited for her next adventure with her best friend, Grandpa.
text: Fatima fanya haraka ukalale. Anafurahia matembezi yake yanayofuata na rafiki yake kipenzi Babu.

SourceText: SHHHHH!
text: SHHHHH!

SourceText: Shh! Baby is asleep! Why is everyone making so much noise?
text: Shh! Mtoto amelala! Kwanini kila mtu anapiga kelele sana?

SourceText: Baby is sleeping. zzzzzzzzzzzz
text: Mtoto amelala. zzzzzzzzzzzz

SourceText: DOOF DOOF! DOOF Shh, Sister! Baby is sleeping!
text: DOOF DOOF! DOOF Shh, dada! Mtoto amelala!

SourceText: CLANG CLANG CLANG! Shh, Brother! Baby is sleeping!
text: CLANG CLANG CLANG! Shh, Kaka! Mtoto amelala!

SourceText: WOOF WOOF WOOF! Shhh, dog! Baby is sleeping!
text: WOOF WOOF WOOF! Shhh, mbwa! Mtoto amelala!

SourceText: Beepity Beep! Beepity Beep! Shhh, phone! Baby is sleeping!
text: Beepity Beep! Beepity Beep! Shhh, simu! Mtoto amelala!

SourceText: TOOT TOOT TEETOOT! Shhhh, radio! Baby is sleeping!
text: TOOT TOOT TEETOOT! Shhh, Redio! Mtoto amelala!

SourceText: Brmmm Brmmm BRMMM! Shhhhh, truck! Baby is sleeping!
text: Brmmm Brmmm BRMMM! Shhhh, Lori! Mtoto amelala!

SourceText: CLICKITY CLACK CLICKITY CLACK! Shhhhh, train! Baby is sleeping!
text: CLICKITY CLACK CLICKITY CLACK! Shhhhh, treni! Mtoto amelala!

SourceText: Ba dubba dubba Dubba dubba! Shhhhhhhhh, helicopter! Baby is sleeping!
text: Ba dubba dubba Dubba dubba! Shhhhhhh, helikopta! Mtoto amelala!

SourceText: Baby is awake!
text: Mtoto ameamka!

SourceText: DOOF CLANG WOOF BEEP TOOT BRMMM CLICKITY BADUBBA
text: DOOF CLANG WOOF BEEP TOOT BRMMM CLICKITY BADUBBA

SourceText: Baby is noisy! CLANG WOOF BEEP BRMM CLICKITY TOOT CLICKITY DOOF BADUBBA! WOOF CLANG DOOF WOOF CLICKITY BAD CLANG DOOF WOOF BRMMM BEEP
text: Mtoto anapiga kelele! CLANG WOOF BEEP BRMM CLICKITY TOOT CLICKITY DOOF BADUBBA! WOOF CLANG DOOF WOOF CLICKITY BAD CLANG DOOF WOOF BRMMM BEEP

SourceText: Lost Toy
text: Toy iliyopotea

SourceText: A child has lost their favorite toy. They are so sad. Will some kind strangers help?
text: Mtoto amepoteza Toy lake analolipenda. Wanahuzuni sana. Kuna wasamaria watakaomsaidia?

SourceText: What’s at the Park?
text: Kuna nini mbugani?

SourceText: Zoey loves finding things in the park. One day, she gets a big surprise.
text: Zoi anapenda kutafuta vitu mbugani. Siku moja, alistukizwa na jambo kubwa la furaha.

SourceText: Down the road from Zoey’s house, there is a big, green park.
text: Barabarani kwa chini kutoka nyumba ya Zoi, kuna bustani kubwa ya ukijani.

SourceText: Zoey is quite shy, but she loves to play in the park. Every day after school, Zoey and Granny go there to play.
text: Zoi ana aibu sana, bakini anapenda kucheza bustanini. Kila siku baada ya kutoka shule, Zoi na Bibi wanaenda pale kucheza.

SourceText: Granny needs glasses to see. But she can hear very well. Zoey is good at finding things. Even better than Granny!
text: Bibi huhitaji miwani kuona. Lakini anaweza kusikia vizuri sana. Zoi ni mzuri katika kupata vitu. Zaid kuliko Bibi!

SourceText: She can find birds and bugs.
text: Anaweza kupata ndege na mende.

SourceText: She can find the prettiest flowers and the tallest trees.
text: Anaweza kupata maua mazuri na miti mirefu zaidi.

SourceText: And she’s very good at finding Granny’s secret sweets.
text: Na ni mzuri sana katika kupata vitu vitamu vya siri vya bibi.

SourceText: “What’s that noise behind the tree?” asks Granny. “Does it sound like a bird?” asks Zoey. “No,” says Granny. “It sounds much bigger than a bird. Can you see what it is?”
text: "Hiyo ni sauti gani nyuma ya mti?" bibi anauliza. "Inaenesha ni kama sauti ya ndege?" anauliza Zoi. "Hapana," anasema bibi. "Ni kama kubwa kuliko ya ndege. Unaweza kuona ni nini hicho

SourceText: “It’s a dog!” says Zoey.
text: " Ni mbwa!" Zoi anasema.

SourceText: “Phew!” says Granny. “This dog is very smelly!”
text: "Fyuuu!" Bibi anasema. "huyu mbwa ananuka sana!"

SourceText: The next day, Zoey comes home from school and packs her bag. “Are you ready to go to the park?” asks Granny. “Yes, please,” says Zoey. “Granny, look who’s outside!” says Zoey.
text: Siku iliyofuata, Zoi alirudi nyumbani kutoka shule na aliandaa begi lake. "Upo tayari kwenda mbugani?" bibi anauliza. "Ndio, tafadhali," anasema Zoi. "Bibi, angalia nani yupo nje!" Zoi anasema.

SourceText: “You found us!” says Zoey. “Now, let’s give you a bath.”
text: "Umetupata!" Zoi anasema. " Sasa, ngoja tukuogeshe."

SourceText: And from that day on, Zoey, Granny and their new friend played in the park every day.
text: Na toka siku ile na kuendelea, Zoi, bibi na rafiki yao mpya walicheza mbugani siku siku.

SourceText: Zibu and Zizo
text: Zibu na Zizo

SourceText: Zibu and Zizo are twin brothers. They are similar, but different. Being different is not bad, it’s great.
text: Zibu na Zizu ni ndugu wa kiume mapacha. Wanafanana, lakini ni tofauti. Kuwa tofauti sio mbaya, ni nzuri.

SourceText: Zibu and Zizo are twin brothers. ‘They look the same,’ people always say.
text: Zibu na Zizo ni ndugu wa kiume mapacha. "Wanafanana," watu wanasema daima.

SourceText: Mama buys them the same clothes. They go to the same school.
text: Mama huwanunulia nguo zilizo sawa. Wanasoma shule moja.

SourceText: Zibu and Zizo both like banana bread.
text: Zibu na Zizo wote wanapenda mkate wa ndizi.

SourceText: Sometimes Zibu and Zizo say ... Hello!! ... at the same time.
text: Wakati mwingine Zibu na Zizo husalimia kwa pamoja.

SourceText: Zibu likes soccer.
text: Zibu hupenda soka.

SourceText: Zizo likes drawing pictures.
text: Zizo hupenda kuchora picha.

SourceText: Zibu likes to talk to people.
text: Zibu hupenda kuongea na watu.

SourceText: Zizo likes to keep to himself.
text: Zizo hupenda kukaa mwenyewe.

SourceText: Zibu likes counting numbers. He wants to be an accountant.
text: Zibu hupenda kuhesabu namba. Anataka kuwa mhasibu.

SourceText: Zizo likes learning new words. He wants to write books.
text: Zizo hupenda kujifunza maneno mapya. Anataka kuandika vitabu.

SourceText: ‘How come Zibu and Zizo look the same, but like different things?’ ask the children at school.
text: Inakuwaje Zibu na Zizo wanafanana, lakini wanapenda vitu tofauti?" watoto wanauliza shuleni.

SourceText: We look the same, but we are different and like different things and that's okay.'
text: Tunaonekana sawa, lakini tuko tofauti na tunapenda vitu tofauti na hiyo ni sawa."

SourceText: Yes you can!
text: Ndio unaweza!

SourceText: Join Teacher Langa’s class as they share what they want to be when they grow up. Let’s see what they say!
text: Jiunge na darasa la mwalimu Langa wanaposhirikisha kile wanachotaka kuwa watakapokua wakubwa. Na tuone wanasema nini!

SourceText: “What do you want to be when you grow up?” asks Teacher Langa.
text: "Unataka kuwa nani utakapokuwa mkubwa? '' anauliza mwalimu Langa.

SourceText: Khutso shouts, “I want to be a cook!”
text: Kuso anapiga kelele,'' Nataka kuwa mpishi!''

SourceText: I love helping my mom bake and cook at home.” Nandi says, “No! That’s a girl’s job. My mom does all the cooking at home.” “Yes he can, Nandi. You can be anything you want to be,” says Teacher Langa. The class chants, “Yes you can!”
text: Napenda kumsaidia mama kuoka na kupika nyumbani.'' Anasema Nandi, ''Hapana! Hiyo ni kazi ya kike. Mama yangu ndiye anapika nyumbani.'' Ndio anaweza, Nandi. Unaweza kuwa chochote kile unataka kuwa,''anasema Mwalimu Langa. darasa linaimba,''Ndio unaweza!''

SourceText: Milani says, “I want to build houses like my dad.”
text: Milani anasema,''Nataka kuwa mjenzi wa nyumba kama baba yangu.''

SourceText: “No you can’t, that’s dangerous!” yells Phathu. “Yes she can, Phathu, as long as she loves it,” replies Teacher Langa. The class chants, “Yes she can!”
text: ''Hapana huwezi, Hito ni hatari!'' anapiga kelele Patu.'' Ndio anaweza, Patu, ilimradi anaipenda,'' anajibu mwalimu Langa. Darasa linaimba, ''Ndio unaweza!''

SourceText: Sthelo says, “I want to be a nurse.”
text: Selo anasema, ''Nataka kuwa muuguzi.''

SourceText: The class bursts out laughing. “What is so funny?” asks Teacher Langa. Nandi replies, “Nurses are girls.” “There are male nurses too,” says Teacher Langa. “So class, can Sthelo be a nurse? The class booms, “Yes he can!”
text: Darasa lilinaangua kawa kicheko.'' Nini kinachekesha? anauliza teacher Langa. Nandi anajibu, ''Wauguzi ni wasichana,'' Kuna wauguzi wanaume pia,''anasema mwalimu Langa.'' kwahiyo darasa, Selo anaweza kuwa Muuguzi? Darasa linapiga kelele, ''

SourceText: “I want to be an artist and draw pretty pictures,’’ says Liyana.
text: ''Nataka kuwa kuwa msanii na kuchora picha nzuri,'' Liyana anasema.

SourceText: “That’s not a real job,” says Khutso and rolls his eyes. “That sounds lovely, Liyana!” replies teacher Langa. “Can Liyana be an artist?” “Yes she can!” shouts the class!
text: '' Hiyo sio kazi rahisi,''Kuso anasema na akiangaza macho.'' Hiyo ni nzuri Liyana!"" mwalimu langa anajibu.''Je Lyana naweza kuwa msanii?''Ndio anaweza!'' Darasa linapiga kelele!

SourceText: “I want to be an alarm clock,” says Phathu.
text: ''Nataka kuwa mpiga kengele,'' Patu anasema.

SourceText: “Huh?” “What do you think, class?” asks Teacher Langa. The class booms, “Yes you can! Yes you can!”
text: ''Huh?'' ''Darasa, mnafikiriaje?'' mwalimu Langa anauliza. Darasa linapiga kelele, ''Ndio unaweza! Ndio unaweza!''

SourceText: Nandi hasn’t shared what she wants to be when she grows up. What do you think she could be?
text: Nandi hajashirikisha kile anachotaka kuwa atakapokuwa mkubwa. Unafikiri anaweza kuwa nani?

SourceText: Yellow Earth, Brown Earth
text: Denia ya njano, Dunia ya kahawia (brown)

SourceText: Avi is an explorer. A cloud-watcher, a seed-sorter and a puddle-splasher. Travel to Avi’s favourite place — the Earth — in this book about noticing and recognising patterns.
text: Avi ni mpelelezi. mtazama mawingu, mpangaji wa mbegu, kinyunyizo cha majii, Safari ya kwenda sehemu anayoipenda Avi - Dunia - katika kitabu hiki inahusu kutambua na kujua mifumo.

SourceText: Avi wakes up early. It is a good day. Avi is visiting Yellow Earth today. Yellow flowers, dried-up flowers, tiny flowers. Yellow flowers—
text: Avi huamka mapema. Ni siku nzuri. Avi anatembelea dunia ya njano leo. Maua ya njano, maua ya njano yaliyokaushwa, maua madogo, maua ya njano-

SourceText: Avi makes bunches.
text: Avi hutengeneza mashada.

SourceText: Avi looks for the perfect stick to poke the earth with. Smooth stick bumpy stick. Smooth stick—
text: Avi hutafuta kijiti kinachofaa zaidi cha kutikisia dunia. Fimbo laini, fimbo yenye matuta, fimbo laini

SourceText: Avi keeps looking for treasures.
text: Avi anaendelea kutafuta hazina.

SourceText: Avi collects seeds. Brown seeds, black seeds, red seeds, green seeds. Brown seeds, black seeds— Yellow Earth is a happy place.
text: Avi hukusanya mbegu. Mbegu za rangi ya kahawia, mbegu nyeusi, mbegu nyekundu, mbegu za kijani, mbegu za kahawia, mbegu nyekundu - Dunia ya njano ni mahali pa furaha.

SourceText: Avi is visiting Grey Earth today.
text: Avi anatembelea Dunia ya rangi ya kijivu leo.

SourceText: Big puddle, small puddle, no puddle. Big puddle, small puddle—
text: Dimbwi kubwa, dimbwi dogo, hakuna dimbwi, dimbwi kubwa, dimbwi dogo ---

SourceText: Drip! Drop! Plish! Drip—
text: Drip,! Drop! Pish! Drip---

SourceText: Grey Earth is a wet place.
text: Dunia ya rangi ya kijivu ni mahali penye ubichi/unyevunyevu.

SourceText: Avi is visiting Brown Earth today. CRUNCH crunch CRUNCH crunch—
text: Avi anatembelea dunia ya kahawia leo. kwachu kwachu kwachu kwachu---

SourceText: Avi stomps on the dry ground.
text: Avi hukanyaga ardhi iliypkauka.

SourceText: Avi smiles at the bright sun. Long cloud, round cloud, thin cloud. Long cloud— Brown Earth is a joyful place.
text: Avi hutabasamu kwawenye jua kali. Wingu refu, wingu la mzunguko, wingu refu--- Dunia ya rangi ya kahawia in mahali pa furaha.

SourceText: Avi watches the Earth change every year. Yellow Earth, Grey Earth, Brown Earth—
text: Avi huangalia mabadiliko ya dunia kila mwaka. Dunia ya njano, dunia ya kijivu, dunia ya kahawia

SourceText: Avi is looking for a stick.
text: Avi anatafuta fimbo.

SourceText: Off to Yellow Earth again!
text: Nenda tena kwa dunia ya njano!

SourceText: Patterns Are All Around Us The day, the week, the month and the year — all have patterns that repeat. The seasons change every year and come back the same way. Every year, winter is followed by summer, which is followed by the monsoon. Look around you and try to spot these patterns. Go back to the beginning of the book and look for patterns you might have missed.
text: Miundo ipo imetuzunguka. Siku, wiki, mwenzi na mwaka-- vyote vina miundo inayojirudia. Ni kwasababu majira hubadilika kila mwaka na inajirudia kwa jinsi hiyo hiyo. Kila mwaka, majira ya baridi yanafuatiwa na majira ya joto, ambayo yanafuatiwa na upepo wa msimu. Angalia pande zote na jaribu kuangalia miundo hii. Nenda nyuma mwanzo wa kitabu na tafuta miundo ambayo pengine uliikosa.

SourceText: Why is Nita Upside Down
text: Kwanini Nita yupo juu chini

SourceText: Nita’s hanging upside down. Can she turn the right way round?
text: Nita ananing'inia juu chini. Anaweza kuzunguka kurudi kwenye mkao wa kawaidi?

SourceText: Nita’s hanging upside down, her long hair tickling at the ground. The trees, the grass, the everything is all the wrong way round.
text: Nita ananing"inia juu chini, nywele zake zinagusa ardhini. Miti, nyasi, kila kitu kimekaa kwa jindi isiyo sahihi.

SourceText: Her feet, they poke into the sky. Little Navi’s walking by. He says ‘I’ve seen you here before. You’re upside down again! What for?’
text: Miguu yake, inapiga angani. Navi mdogo anatembea. Anasema '' Nimeshawahi kukuona hapa hapo nyuma" Upo juu chini tena! Kwaajili ya nini

SourceText: His feet swim lightly in the air. She tries to hide behind her hair. ‘It’s h-h-h-hard to t-t-talk’, she says to him. ‘I’m not the same. I don’t fit in.’
text: Miguu yake inaogelea kidogo hewani. Anajaribu kujificha nyuma ya nywele zake, 'Ni ngu-ngu-ngu-ngumu ku-ku-ku-kuongea,' anamwambia, siko sawa. sitoshi.'

SourceText: Navi takes her by the hand. He wants to help her understand. They climb to Navi’s look-out spot. From up here they can see a lot. They perch and have a quiet stare at children playing here and there.
text: Navi anamshika mkono. Anataka kumsaidia aelewe. Wanapanda hadi eneo kutokea Navi anapotazama. Kutokea pale juu wanaweza kuona vingi. Wanakaa na kuwatazama kwa utulivu watoto wanaocheza hapa na pale.

SourceText: Those kids are not tthe same at all. Abe’s round.
text: Wale watoto hawafanani /sio wale wale kabisa. Mzunguko wa Abe.

SourceText: Chi’s freckled,
text: Wale watoto hawafanani/ sio wale wale kabisa. Mzunguko wa Abe

SourceText: Lala’s extra tall.
text: Wale watoto hawafanani / sio wale wale kabisa. Mzunguko wa Abe.

SourceText: Bambam’s wild and must be free,
text: Mwitu ya Bambam ni lazima iwe huru

SourceText: while Lulu’s reading quietly.
text: huku Lili akisoma kimya kimya.

SourceText: Look at Freya's crazy hair.
text: Angalia nwele za Freya zinachekesha.

SourceText: And Sid wears glasses everywhere.
text: Na Sid huvaa miwani kila mahali.

SourceText: And me, I am just skin and bone. And you are you. You’re not alone. Each human’s sort of strange, you see. That makes you just the same, like me. This world is really one big game. To play, we can’t all be the same.
text: Mimi ni ngozi tu na mifupa. Na wewe ni wewe. Hauko peke yako. Kila aina ya binadamu ni ya ajabu, unaona. Hii inawafanya mfanane, kama mimi. Kweli dunia hii ni mchezo mmoja mkubwa. Katika kucheza hatuwezi kufanana wote.

SourceText: Nita feels the right way round, thanks to the new friend she’s found. Upside down was never fun. Now she plays with everyone.
text: Nita anaihisi njia sahihi pande zote. shukrani kwa fafiki mpya, amepatikana. Juu chini haikuwa furaha kamwe. Sasa hucheza na kila mmoja.

SourceText: When I grow up
text: Nitakapo kuwa mkubwa

SourceText: I don’t know what I want to be when I grow up. Can you help me choose?
text: Sijui nataka kuwa nani nitakapo kuwa mkubwa. Unaweza kunisaidia kuchagua?

SourceText: What do I want to be when I grow up?
text: Ninataka kuwa nani nitakapokuwa mkubwa?

SourceText: When I grow up, I want to be a dancer and dance on a stage.
text: Nitakapokuwa mkubwa. Nataka kuwa msanii wa kucheza na nicheze kwenye jukwaa.

SourceText: When I grow up, I want to be a firefighter and put out big fires.
text: Nitakapokuwa mkubwa. Nataka kufanya kazi katika jeshi la Ukoaji kitengo cha zimamoto na kuzima moto mkubwa.

SourceText: When I grow up, I want to be a nurse and make sick people better.
text: Nitakapokuwa mkubwa. Nataka kuwa muuguzi na kuwafanya wagonjwa wajiskie nafuu.

SourceText: When I grow up, I want to be a musician and play in a band.
text: Nitakapokuwa mkubwa. nataka kuwa mwanamuziki na kucheza kwenye bendi.

SourceText: When I grow up, I want to be a mechanic and fix cars and tractors.
text: Nitakapokuwa mkubwa. nataka kuwa fundi magari na kurekebisha magari na matrekta.

SourceText: When I grow up, I want to be a teacher and teach children to read and write.
text: Nitakapokuwa mkubwa. Nataka kuwa mwalimu na kufundisha watoto kusoma na kuandika.

SourceText: When I grow up, I want to be a soccer player and score the winning goal.
text: Nitakapokuwa mkubwa. Nataka kuwa mchezaji wa mpira na kufunga goli la ushindi.

SourceText: When I grow up, I want to be an astronaut and fly to the moon.
text: Nitakapokuwa mkubwa, Nataka kuwa mwana anga na kuruka hadi mwezini.

SourceText: When I grow up, I want to be a chef and make food for my family and friends.
text: Nitakapokuwa mkubwa, Nataka kuwa mpishi na kuandaa chakula cha familia yangu na marafiki.

SourceText: When I grow up, I can choose whatever I want to be!
text: Nitakapokuwa mkubwa, Naweza kuchagua niwe nani!

SourceText: What do you want to be when you grow up?
text: Unataka kuwa nani utakapokuwa mkubwa?

SourceText: What's In The Pot?
text: Kuna nini kwenye sufuria?

SourceText: Sam can’t wait for supper. What’s in the pot? Wait and see.
text: Sam hawezi kusubiri chakula cha usiku. Kuna nini kwenye sufuria? subiri uone.

SourceText: “What’s for supper?” asked Sam. “It’s a surprise”, said Mama, putting a big pot on the stove.
text: ''Tunakula chakula gani usiku?'' anauliza Sam. '' Ni cha kufurahisha na kushangaza','' alisema Mama. Anatenga sufuria kubwa jikoni.

SourceText: She added a jug of water. Sam was worried. “Are we having water for supper?” he wailed. “It’s a surprise. Wait and see.” replied Mama.
text: Aliongeza jadi la maji. Sam alikuwa na wasiwasi. ''Chakula cha usiku?''alihuzunika. Ni mshangao. Subiri uone. alijibu Mama.

SourceText: “Can I help?” asked Sam. “I could stir.”
text: ''Naweza kusaidia?'' aliuliza Sam. ''Ningeweza kuchochea.''

SourceText: “You are still a bit short,” said Mama. “The pot might fall over. But you can help me by fetching things.”
text: ''Bado ni mfupi,'' Mama anasema ''Chungu kinaweza kudondoka. ila unaweza kunisaidia kwa kubebea vitu','

SourceText: "Can you bring me an onoin, please." "This doesn't smell very nice."
text: '' Tafadhali unaweza kuniletea kitunguu, Hii haina harufu nzuri sana.''

SourceText: "They will taste nice once they are cooked."
text: ''Zitakuwa na ladha nzuri zikiwa zimepikwa,''

SourceText: “Now I need some tomatoes. No, that is an apple. The tomatoes are also round and red, but you will find them in the fridge.”
text: ''Sasa nahitaji nyanya. Hapana, hiyo ni apple/tufaa. Nyanya pia ni za mduara na nyekundu. lakini utazikuta kwenye friji.''

SourceText: “Can you bring me potatoes. They are round and brown.”
text: ''Unaweza kuniletea viazi. Ni vya duara na vina rangi ya kahawia.''

SourceText: “Is supper ready yet?”
text: ''Je chaakula acha usiku kiko tayari?''

SourceText: “If you are hungry you can eat the apple while you wait.” “What about these?” “No, we won’t need biscuits. We can save those for after supper.”
text: "Kama una njaa unaweza kula epo/tofaa wakati ukisubiri." " Vipi kuhusu hizi?" " Hapana, hatuhitaji biskuti. Tunaweza kutunza hizo kwaajili ya chakula cha jioni."

SourceText: “What’s in the pot?”
text: ''Kuna nini kwenye sufuria?''

SourceText: “It’s a surprise. Wait and see.”
text: ''Cha kufurahisha na kushangaza. Subiri uone.''

SourceText: “What about this?” “That is a watermelon. It will be too big for the pot.” “See if you can find some spinach. It is also green.”
text: ''Vipi kuhusu hili?'' ''Hilo ni tikiti maji. litakuwa kubwa sana kwenye sufuria,''Angalia kama unaweza kupata mchicha. Pia ni wa kijani.''

SourceText: “Please get some bread. No, it won’t go into the pot but on the table.”
text: ''Tafadhari chukua mkate. Hapana hauwezi kuingia kwenye sufuria labda juu ya meza,''

SourceText: Mama carried the pot to the table and started to dish up. “What’s in the pot?” asked Sam.
text: Mama alibeba sufuria juu ya meza na akaanza kuonja. Kuna nini kwenye sufuria? aliuliza Sam.

SourceText: “Soup!” My favourite!
text: " Supu!" Ninachopendelea!

SourceText: Tlotlego's Tea Party
text: Tafrija ya chai ya Tito

SourceText: Tlotlego is hosting a tea party! But something strange keeps happening while he is setting the table.
text: Ttio Tito anaandaa tafrija ya chai! Lakini kuna jambo la ajabu linatokea mara kwa mara wakati akiwa anaendelea kuandaa meza.

SourceText: Tlotlego is hosting a tea party for the WHOLE family. “How many people are coming for tea, Koko?” “You, me, Mama, and Papa. And your little sister, Tshiamo.”
text: Tito anaandaa tafrija ya chai kwaajili ya familia nzima. " Ni watu wangapi wanakuja kwaajili ya chai, Koko?" "Wewe, mimi, Mama, na Baba

SourceText: Tlotlego counts the teacups as he takes them from the kitchen. “One, two, three, four, and one for Koko!”
text: Tito anahesabu vikombe vya chai kadili anavyovichukua kutoka jikoni. "Moja, mbili, tatu na moja kwaajili ya Koko"

SourceText: Tlotlego goes to the stoep and places the teacups down on the table. “One, two, three, four, and ... ?” “I only see four cups,” says Koko, “but we are five people.” “When I was in the kitchen before, there were five cups!” Tlotlego exclaims.
text: Tito anaenda kwenye kijito na anaweka vikombe chini mezani. "Moja, mbili tatu, nne na ...?" " Naona vikombe vinne tu." anasema Koko, " lakini tupo watu watano." " Nilipokuwa jikoni pale kabla, vilikuwa vitano!" Tito anashangaa.

SourceText: Tlotlego counts the pretty little plates as he takes them from the cupboard. “One, two, three, four, and five! There’s a plate for each of us.”
text: Tito anahesabu sahani nzuri ndogondogo kadili anavyozichukua toka kabatini, "Moja, mbili, tatu, nne na tano! Sahani zipo za kila mmoja wetu."

SourceText: Tlotlego goes to the stoep and places the plates next to the teacups.“One, two, three, four, and ... ?” “I only see four plates,” says Koko, “but we are five people.”
text: Tito anaenda kwenye mwinuko na anaweka sahani karibu na vikombe vya chai. " Moja, mbili, tatu, nne na ...?" " Naona sahani nne tu," Koko anasema, "lakini tuko watu watano."

SourceText: Tlotlego counts the biscuits as he takes them from the jar. “One, two, three, four, and five!”
text: Tito anahesabu biskuti kadili anavyozitoa kutoka kwenye mtungi. "Moja, mbili, tatu, nne na tano!"

SourceText: Tlotlego goes to the stoep and places the biscuits on the plates.
text: Tito anaenda kwenye sehemu ya mwinuko katika mazingira ya nyumbani kwao na anaweka biskuti kwenye sahani.

SourceText: “One, two, three, four, and ... ?” “I only see four biscuits,” says Koko, “but we are five people.”
text: "Moja, mbili, tatu, nne, na ...?" " Naona biskuti nne tu," anasema Koko, "lakini tupo watu watano."

SourceText: Tlotlego is very confused. He knows he has been counting correctly. Before he had five biscuits, and now there are only four. HOW did the biscuits become less?
text: Tito amechanganyiiwa sana. Anajua alihesabu kwa usahihi. Kabla alikuwa na biskuti tano, na sasa kuna nne tu. Biskuti zimekuwaje pungufu?

SourceText: Tlotlego counts the sugar cubes as he takes them from the jar. “One, two, three, four, and five!”
text: Tito anahesabu pakiti za sukari kadili anavyozichukua kutoka kwenye mtungi. "Moja, mbili, tatu, nne, na tano!"

SourceText: Tlotlego goes to the stoep and places the sugar cubes on the table. This time, he is sure he hears a giggle. “One, two, three, four, and ... ?” “Five!” shouts a voice from under the table.
text: Tito anaenda kwenye sehemu ya mwinuko katika mazingira ya nyumbani kwao na anaweka pakiti za sukari mezani. Safari hii, ana hakika amesikia kicheko. " Moja, mbili, tatu, nne, na ...??" " Tano!: sauti ya juu ilitokea chini ya meza.

SourceText: Tlotlego bends down to look under the table. To his shock, he sees a complete tea set laid out under the table! There are the missing teacup, plate, biscuit, and sugar cube. FIVE!
text: Tito anainama chini kuangalia chini ya meza. kwa mshtuko, anaona seti ya chai iliyokamilika imewekwa chini ya meza! Hizo ni vikombe, sahani, biskuti na sukari zilizokuwa zimekosekana. TANO!

SourceText: When Mama and Papa come home from work, they all have tea on the stoep. One, two, three of them having tea at the table, and two of them having tea below!
text: Baba na mama watakapokuja nyumbani kutoka kazini, wote watapata chai kwenye sehemu ya mwinuko kwenye mazingira ya pale nyumbani kwao. Mmoja, wawili, watatu wao kupata chai mezani, na wawili wao kupata chai chini!

SourceText: The one on the middle
text: Yule wa katikati

SourceText: Khanyiswa is not the first born. She’s not the last born. She’s the one in the MIDDLE!
text: Khanyiswa sio mtoto wa kwanza. Yeye sio mtoto wa mwisho. Yeye ni wa katikati!

SourceText: I am the middle one. Not the first born. Not the last born. The one in the middle!
text: Mimi ni wa katikati. Sio mtoto wa kwanza. Sio mtoto wa mwisho. Ni yule wa katikati!

SourceText: The one in the middle can be easy to forget.
text: Yule wa katikati ni rahisi kusahau.

SourceText: And easy to leave out.
text: Na rahisi kutoka.

SourceText: But that’s okay because I am also the one with IDEAS!
text: Lakini hiyo ni sawa kwasababu mimi pia nina mawazo!

SourceText: Look what I can make from just this cardboard box! A BEAUTIFUL house... with real doors and windows.
text: Angalia ninachoweza kutengeneza kutoka kwenye hili boksi! Nyumba nzuri... yenye milango na madirisha ya uhakika.

SourceText: My house has an extra special bed, and a MAGIC SLIDE.
text: Nyumba yangu ina kitanda cha ziada na bembea ya maajabu.

SourceText: Some days my house is also a shop.
text: Kuna wakati nyumba yangu pia inakuwa duka.

SourceText: And on other days it’s a VERY FANTASTIC show.
text: Na kwa siku zingine inakuwa onyesho zuri la kushangaza.

SourceText: Sometimes my house is just for me!
text: Wakati mwingine nyumba yangu ni kwa ajili yangu!

SourceText: And that’s the best place for me.
text: Na hapo ndipo mahali pazuri zaidi kwangu.

SourceText: And sometimes it’s a house for three! I am the middle one. Not the first born. Not the last born. The one in the middle!
text: Na wakati mwingine ni nyumba yetu watatu! Mimi ni wa katikati. Siyo mtoto wa kwanza. Siyo mtoto wa mwisho. Ni yule wa katikati!

SourceText: The best thing ever
text: Jambo bora ambalo halikuwahi kutokea

SourceText: Muzi loves to build with his toys. But when he leaves them behind to travel to uGogo’s house, he discovers something very special about the world. And he learns something new about himself.
text: Muzi anapenda kujenga na midoli yake. Lakini anawaacha ili kusafiri kwenda nyumbani kwa bibi yake, anagundua kitu cha pekee sana kuhusu Dunia na anajifunza kitu kipya kuhusu yeye mwenyewe.

SourceText: Muzi loves to build things. He dreams of building the best thing ever.
text: Muzi anapenda kujenga vitu. Ana ndoto ya kujenga kitu ambacho hakijawahi kutokea.

SourceText: Once he built a shelter for his toys. But it wasn’t the best thing ever.
text: Aliwahi kujenga makazi ya midoli yake. Lakini hayakuwa bora kuliko.

SourceText: Yesterday he built a bridge for his animals. It was a good thing. But not the best...
text: Jana alijenga daraja kwaajili ya wanyama wake. Ilikuwa kitu kizuri. Lakini si bora...

SourceText: Today Muzi is going to visit uGogo. He is sad. Without his toys, how can he build the best thing ever?
text: Leo Muzi anaenda kumtembelea bibi. Ana huzuni. Bila hii midoli, anawezaje kujenga kitu bora kuliko"?

SourceText: At the bus stop, Muzi is amazed. He sees red things and blue things. Small things and big things. New things and old things.
text: Kwenye kituo cha basi. Muzi anashangaa. Anaona vitu vyekundu na vitu vya bluu. Vitu vidogo na vitu vikubwa. Vitu vipya na vitu vya zamani.

SourceText: Muzi has a new idea for building the best thing ever.
text: Muzi ana wazo jipya la kujenga kitu ambacho hakijawahi kutokea.

SourceText: On the road to uGogo’s, Muzi finds many things. Long things and short things. Round things and square things.
text: Njiani kuelekea kwa Bibi, Muzi alipata vitu vingi. Vitu virefu na vitu vifupi. Vitu vya mviringo na vitu viivyokuwa katika umbo la pembe nne.

SourceText: By the riverside, Muzi finds more things. Soft things and pointy things. Green things and brown things.
text: Pembeni ya mto, Muzi alipata vitu zaidi. Vitu vya kawaida na vitu vya maana. Vitu vya kijani na vitu vya kahawia.

SourceText: Look, Muzi! We are here.
text: Angalia, Muzi! Tupo hapa.

SourceText: While uGogo bakes for the hungry travellers... Muzi builds.
text: Wakati Bibi huoka kwaajili ya wasafiri wenye njaa... Muzi hujenga.

SourceText: Gogo, Gogo! says Muzi. The world is full of toys. Look what I can build.
text: Bibi, Bibi! anasema Muzi. Dunia imejaa midoli. Tazama naweza kujenga nini.

SourceText: Oh, Muzi, laughs Gogo. A new house for me. This is the best thing ever!
text: Oh, Muzi, anamcheka bibi. Nyumba mpya kwaajili yangu. Hili ni jambo bora haijawahitokea!

SourceText: Teju's Shadow
text: Kivuli cha Teju

SourceText: Teju is worried. Something keeps following him! What could it be?
text: Teju ana wasiwasi. Kitu flani kinaendelea kumfuatilia! Kinaweza kuwa nini?

SourceText: © Book Dash, 2019. Some rights reserved. Released under CC BY 4.0 license.
text: © Book Dash, 2002. Haki zimehifadhiwa. Imetolewa chini ya leseni ya CC BY 4.0.

SourceText: “What’s that?”
text: "Ni nini hicho?"

SourceText: Teju hides. “It won’t find me here!”
text: Teju anajificha. "Hakitanipata hapa!"

SourceText: He runs. “Why are you following me?”
text: Anakimbia. "Kwanini unanifuata?"

SourceText: Leave me ALONE!
text: Niache!

SourceText: Go away. Go away.GO AWAY! “Teju! What are you doing?” “It won’t go away!” “Your shadow?”
text:
Nenda huko. Nenda huko. NENDA HUKO! "Teju! unafanya nini?" 
 "Hakiwezi kuondoka!" "Kivuli chako?"

SourceText: “It follows me everywhere! It’s like a super secret spy!”
text: "Kinanifuata kila sehemu! Ni kama jasusi wa siri sana!"

SourceText: “Well, there’s one way to make a shadow disappear...”
text: "Vizuri, kuna njia moja kufanya kivuli kiondoke..."

SourceText: MAMA!
text: MAMA!

SourceText: Later that night in Teju’s bedroom, the light goes off...  ...and then on. And off... ...and on. Teju can’t sleep.
text: Baadae usiku ule chumbani kwa Teju, mwanga ulizimika... ...na ikawaka tena. Na ikazima... ...na ikawaka. Teju anashindwa kulala.

SourceText: <<CLICK>>   <<CLICK>>   <<CLICK>>   <<CLICK>>   <<CLICK>>   <<CLICK>>   <<CLICK>>   <<CLICK>>   <<CLICK>>   <<CLICK>>   <<CLICK>>   <<CLICK>>   <<CLICK>>
text: <<<BOFYA>>>  <<<BOFYA>>>  <<<BOFYA>>>  <<<BOFYA>>>  <<<BOFYA>>>  <<<BOFYA>>>  <<<BOFYA>>>  <<<BOFYA>>>  <<<BOFYA>>>  <<<BOFYA>>>  <<<BOFYA>>>  <<<BOFYA>>>  <<<BOFYA>>>

SourceText: “What’s wrong Teju?” “It only goes away in the dark, but I’m scared of the dark!” Mum gives Teju a big hug. “Do you want to see something amazing?”
text: "Nini shida Teju?" "Kinaondoka kwenye giza tu, lakini naogopa giza!" Mama anamkumbatia Teju. "Unataka kuona kitu kizuri cha kushangaza?"

SourceText: OOOHHHH! AAAAHH!
text: OOOHHHH! AAAAHH!

SourceText: Mum and Teju make shadow puppets until he falls asleep.
text: Mama na Teju wanatengeneza vimdoli vya kivuli hadi analala.

SourceText: “Cool!” After school, Teju waits for Mum. “I’m bored.” Teju stands up, he jumps, he dances.His shadow does the same.
text: "Safi!" Baada ya shule, Teju anamsubiri Mama. " Nimechoka/sijisikii vizuri." Teju anasimama, anarukaruka, anacheza. Kivuli chake kinafanya hivyohivyo.

SourceText: When he goes to bed that night, Teju leaves his night Light on. “Goodnight Shadow!”
text: Alipoenda kulala usiku ule, Teju aliacha taa inawaka. " Usiku mwema kivuli!"

SourceText: Paint Dat, Plant Day
text: Kupaka rangi ya Dat, siku ya kupanda

SourceText: Avi enjoys plant day, music day and paint day, and being busy throughout the week. Join in as Avi potters about the house, in this book about noticing and recognising patterns.
text: Avi aliifurahia siku ya kupanda, siku ya muziki na siku ya kupaka rangi, na kuwa na mambo mengi ya kufanya wiki nzima. Ungana nao kadili ambavyo Avi anafinyanga nyumba, katika kitabu hiki kinachohusu kutambua na kujua miundo.

SourceText: Avi stretches and jumps out of bed. Today is Plant Day.
text: Avi anajinyoosha na kuruka nnje ya kitanda. Leo ni siku ya kupanda.

SourceText: Mama takes out the seeds. Avi places them carefully in the pots. Small pot, tall pot, square pot. Small pot— Avi waters the plants.
text: Mama anatoa mbegu nje. Avi anaziweka kwenye vyungu kwa uangalifu. Chungu kidogo, chungu kirefu, chungu cha pembe nne. Chungu kidogo -- Avi anamwagilia mimea.

SourceText: Avi washes the brushes. Papa mixes the paints. Today is Paint Day. Swish, dip, squash, swirl. Swish, dip— Avi loves mixing the colours.
text: Avi huosha brashi, Baba huchnganya rangi. Leo ni siku ya kupaka rangi. Swish, chovya, boga, zungusha, swish, chovya-- Avi anapenda kuchanganya rangi.

SourceText: Today is Fixing Day. Mama and Avi tighten the screws on the table. Tighten, thamp! Tighten, thamp! Avi checks to see if the table is still wobbly.
text: Leo ni siku ya marekebisho. Mama na Avi wanakaza skrubu kwenye meza. Kaza, thamp! kaza, thamp! Avi anakagua kuona kama meza bado inatikisika.

SourceText: Today is Cleaning Day. Avi helps Mama and Papa dust everything. Dhup, wipe, cough, clean. Dhup, wipe— ACHOO!
text: Leo ni siku ya kufanya usafi. Avi humsaidia Mama na Baba kufuta vumbi vitu vyote. Dhup, futa, kukohoa, safisha, Dhup, futa--- ACHOO!

SourceText: Today is Sheet Day. Avi is changing the sheets on the beds. Pull, tuck, pull, tuck, pat-pat. Pull, tuck—
text: Leo ni siku ya shuka. Avi anabadilisha mashuka kitandani. Vuta, piga, vuta, piga, vuta, funga--

SourceText: Avi lines up all the cushions and pillows on the floor. Cushion, cushion, pillow, bolster. Cushion, cushion— JUMP!
text: Avi anapanga foronya zote na mito sakafuni. Foronya, Foronya, foronya, mito, kuimarisha, foronya, foronya--- RUKA!

SourceText: Music Day is Avi’s favourite. No one stops the loud sounds! Dham-dhoom- japh, dham- dhoom- japh. Avi hits the drums again. Dham—
text: Siku ya muziki ni siku pendwa ya Avi. Hakuna anayezima sauti kubwa! Dham,-dhoom-japh, dham,-dhoom-japh

SourceText: It is Bird Day. Avi watches the birds with Mama and Papa. Brown bird, slow-walker, long legs. Brown bird—
text: Ni siku ya ndege. Avi anawatazama ndege na Mama na Baba. Ndege wa kahawia, mtembea polepole, miguu mirefu, ndege wa kahawia

SourceText: Avi yawns. He is tired but excited about waking up in the morning. Tomorrow is Plant Day again!
text: Avi anapiga mwayo. Amechoka lakini amefurahia kuhusu kutembea asubuhi. Kesho ni siku ya kupanda tena!

SourceText: Patterns Are All Around Us. The days, the weeks, the months, and the years always follow a pattern. Look at the days in your week. Is any day kept for a special activity? Make a calendar for yourself and fill it with the patterns you see.
text: Miunganiko iko kila mahali imetuzunguka. Siku, Wiki, Miezi, na Miaka daima hufuata muunganiko. Angalia Siku katia wiki yako. Je, kuna siku yoyote kwaajili ya shughuli maalum? Tengeneza kalenda yako mwenyewe na ijaze miunganiko unayoona.

SourceText: My little garden
text: Bustani yangu ndogo

SourceText: A little boy and his dad find a plot full of litter. Can they turn it into something wonderful?
text: Kijana mdogo na baba yake waliona shamba lililojaa takataka. Je wanaweza kuligeuza kuwa kitu kizuri?

SourceText: Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 Licence (http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/).
text: Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 Licence (http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/).

SourceText: Mama, What's For Lunch
text: Mama. Tunakula chakula gani mchana

SourceText: Join Thabo and his sister Tumi for magical lunches with Mama!
text: Ungana na John na dada yake Tumi kwenye chakula cha maajabu cha mchana na Mama!

SourceText: “Hurry,Thabo. Mama is making lunch,” calls Tumi.
text: ''Harakisha.John, Mama anapika chakula cha mchana,'' anaita Tumi.

SourceText: “Where are you going, Thabo?”
text: ''Unaenda wapi John?''

SourceText: His friends don’t understand why he chooses lunch over their game, but Thabo has a secret. Mama’s lunches are special.
text: Rafiki zake hawaelewi kwa nini anachagua chakula dhidi ya mchezo wao. Lakini John ana siri. Chakula cha mama cha mchana ni maalumu.

SourceText: On Monday, Mama shapes their food like little bugs that wriggle and crawl, making Tumi shriek in fright. “EEEE!” But they are yummy fruit and vegetables, and not very scary at all.
text: Siku ya Jumatatu, Mama hutengeneza chakula chenye maumbo ya wadudu wadogo wanaotambaa na hivyo kumfanya Tumi alie kwa hofu.''EEE!'' lakini ni matunda matamu na mboga, na sio za kutisha hata kidogo.

SourceText: On Tuesday, she makes a lion that roars so loudly the house shakes. “ROAR!” ut it’s just delicious pasta and cheese.
text: Siku ya Jumanne, anatengeneza Simba anayeunguruma kwa sauti kubwa na kutikisa nyumba,'' Ngurumo!,'' ut ni Tambi tamu zenye jibini.

SourceText: On Wednesday, Mama creates a chicken that wakes up the whole street. “CLUCK CLUCK PAKAA!” But it’s just a plate of juicy fruit.
text: Siku ya Jumatano, mama anaunda kuku ambaye anawaamsha wote mtaani.“CLUCK CLUCK PAKAA!” Lakini ni sahani tu ya matunda ya juisi.

SourceText: On Thursday, she builds a noisy truck. Thabo and Tumi cover their ears. “VROOOM!” But it’s a sweet strawberry jam sandwich.
text: Siku ya alhamisi, alitengeneza lori lenye kelele. John na Tumi waliziba masikio yao. ^VROOOM!^ Lakini ni mkate mtamu wa jamu ya stroberi.

SourceText: On Friday, Mama makes a beautiful garden filled with flowers, birds and ladybugs. “TWEET TWEET!” But it’s healthy pap, beans and a crunchy salad
text: Siku ya ijumaa, Mama hutengeneza bustani nzuri inayojaa maua, ndege na wadudu.^TWEET TWEE!^ Lakini ni ugali wenye afya, maharage na kachumbari

SourceText: “Mama, what’s for lunch?” asks Tumi. “Yes, Mama,” says Thabo. “What are you making today?”
text: ^Mama, tunakula nini mchana? Tumi anauliza. ^Ndio, mama,^ anasema John. ^Unaandaa nini leo?^

SourceText: Thabo and Tumi can’t wait another second. Their tummies are grumbling. Finally, Mama is ready. “What is it Mama?” asks Thabo, licking his lips.
text: John na Tumi hawawezi kusubiri kwa sekunde zaidi. Matumbo yao yanaunguruma. Mwisho, Mama amemaliza kuandaa chakula. ^Ni nini hiyo mama?^ Thabo anauliza, akilamba midomo yake.

SourceText: It’s Thabo, Tumi and Mama! “Mmm, our favourite, your famous stew and rice.” “Thank you, Mama!”
text: Ni John, Tumi na Mama! ^Mmm, ni chakula tunachokipenda, kitoweo chako maarufu na wali.". "Asante mama!"

SourceText: What will Mama make on Sunday?
text: Mama ataandaa nini siku ya Juma pili?

SourceText: Let's go on a litter hunt
text: Wacha tuendelee kuondoa takataka

SourceText: The yard is a mess. How will the children clean up?
text: Uwanja una fujo, Je watoto watausafishaje?

SourceText: Papa says, “This yard is a MESS. The wind blew the rubbish in.” Mama says, “Let’s go on a litter hunt. First look for tins.” Papa says, “Wear these gloves.” Yuck!
text: Baba anasema, '' Huu uwanja una VURUGU. Upepo ulileta takataka." Mama anasema, ''Twendeni tukaondoe takataka. Kwanza angalieni makopo.''Baba anasema,'' Vaa glavu hizi,''Yuck!

SourceText: We’re going on a tin hunt. We look up high and down low. We look under the bushes and against the fence.
text: Tunakwenda kuokota makopo. Tunatazama juu na chini kabisa. Tunaangalia chini ya vichaka na kwenye uzio.

SourceText: We’ve found red tins and green tins, rusty tins and shiny tins, clean tins and dirty tins. Yuck!
text: Tumepata makopo mekundu na ya kijani, makopo yenye kutu na makopo yanayong'aa, makopo masafi na makopo machafu. Yuck!

SourceText: What must we do with all these tins? Find a bin and put them in! Now look for plastic.
text: Tufanye nini na makopo haya? Tafuta pipa na uweke humo! sasa tafuta plastiki.

SourceText: We’re going on a plastic hunt. We look up high and down low. We look behind the chicken coop and in front of the house.
text: Tunakwenda kuondoa takataka za plastiki, Tunaangalia juu na chini kabisa. Tunatazama nyuma ya banda la kuku na mbele ya nyumba.

SourceText: We’ve found milk bottles and bottle tops, shopping bags and sucker sticks, straws and broken buckets. Yuck!
text: Tumepata chupa za maziwa na vifuniko vya chupa, mifuko ya kubebea vitu na mirija ya kunywea vinywaji na ndoo zilizopasuka. Yuck!

SourceText: What must we do with all this plastic? Find a bin and put it in! Now look for paper.
text: Tufanye nini na hizi plastic zote? Tafuta pipa na uweke humo! sasa tafuta karatasi.

SourceText: We’re going on a paper hunt. We look up high and down low. We look near the water barrel and on top of the bench.
text: Tunakwenda kuokota karatasi. Tunaangalia juu na chini kabisa. Tunaangalia karibu na pipa la maji na juu ya benchi.

SourceText: We’ve found wet paper and dry paper, cardboard boxes and newspaper, old paper plates and dirty tissues. Yuck!
text: Tumepata karatasi iliyoloana na karatasi kavu, boksi na gazeti, sahani za karatasi za zamani na tishu chafu Yuck!

SourceText: What must we do with all this paper? Find a bin and put it in! What else can you look for? Hmm ...
text: Tufanye nini na karatasi zote hizi? Tafuta pipa na uweke humo! Nini kingine unaweza kuangalia? Hmm...

SourceText: There’s no more mess! Wow! This place is so clean. Thanks, litter hunters.
text: Hakuna tena vurugu! Wow! Mahali hapa ni pasafi sana. Asante, waokotaji wa takataka.

SourceText: You deserve a treat! And remember ... what must you do with your litter? Find a bin and put it in!
text: Unastahili pongezi! Na kumbuka...... unalazimika kufanya nini na takataka zako? Tafuta pipa na uweke humo!

SourceText: How do you sleep?
text: Unalalaje?

SourceText: Can you sleep with one eye open? Can you sleep in a tree? Pula has a bed, but he wants to know how other creatures sleep.
text: Unaweza kulala jicho moja likiwa wazi? Unaweza kulala kwenye mti? Pula ana kitanda, ila anataka kujua viumbe vingine vinalalaje.

SourceText: How do you sleep, bird? I fly in my sleep
text: Unalalaje ndege? ninaruka usingizini

SourceText: How do you sleep, bat? I sleep upside down.
text: Unalalaje, popo? Ninalala kichwa chini.

SourceText: How do you sleep, bullfrog? I rest on my side
text: Unalala namna gani, Chura? Napumzika kwa upande

SourceText: How do you sleep, octopus? I change colour in my dreams.
text: Unalalaje, Pweza? nabadilisha rangi kwenye ndoto zangu.

SourceText: How do you sleep, duck? We take turns to guard each other.
text: Unalalaje bata? Tunapeana zamu kulindana.

SourceText: How do you sleep, baby owl? I sleep on my face.
text: Unalaje, bundi mtoto? Nalalia uso wangu.

SourceText: How do you sleep, otter? We sleep holding hands.
text: Unalalaje otter? Tunalala huku tumeshikana mikono.

SourceText: How do you sleep, walrus? I sleep on the land and under the water.
text: Unallalaje walrus? Nalala juu ya ardhi na chini ya maji.

SourceText: How do you sleep, giraffe? We sleep on each other.
text: Unalalaje twiga? Tunalala tukiwa tumeegamiana.

SourceText: How do you sleep, meerkat? We sleep in a heap.
text: Unalalaje, meerkat? Tunalala kwenye lundo.

SourceText: How do you sleep, Pula? Good night! Sleep tight!
text: Unalalaje, pula? Usiku mwema! lala vyema!

SourceText: Grandpa Farouk’s garden
text: Bustani ya Babu Faruku

SourceText: Amir loves Grandpa Farouk’s garden. But it’s dying. What can Amir do to help?
text: Amiri anaipenda bustani ya Babu Faruku. Lakini inakufa. Amiri anaweza kufanya nini kusaidia?

SourceText: Deep in the city, surrounded by houses and bricks and tar, you’ll find Grandpa Farouk’s garden.
text: Ndani kabisa ya Jiji, kumezungukwa na nyumba na matofali na lami, utaikuta bustani ya Babu Faruku.

SourceText: Amir visits Grandpa once a week. He loves the leaves and flowers and trees.
text: Amir huwa anamtembelea mara moja kwa wiki. Anapenda majani na maua na miti.

SourceText: Amir helps to water the plants. He helps with the compost, and works with his Grandpa all day.
text: Amiri anasaidia kumwagilia mimea. Anasaidia kuweka mboji, na hufanya kazi na babu yake siku nzima.

SourceText: When they finish, they feast on a harvest of fruit. One day, Grandpa didn’t eat his pear. “What’s wrong?” asked Amir.
text: Wanapomaliza, wanasherehekea mavuno ya matunda. Siku moja, Babu hakula peasi lake. " shida ni nini?" Amiri anauliza.

SourceText: “My garden is dying,” replied Grandpa. “Why?” asked Amir. “Look closely,” said Grandpa. “Some pests are eating the plants.”
text: "Bustani yangu inakufa" Babu alijibu. "Kwanini?" Amiri aliuliza. "Angalia kwa karibu," alisema Babu. "Kuna wadudu wanakula mimea."

SourceText: “We need ladybirds!” said Grandpa. “They are the bugs that eat the pests that kill the plants. Without ladybirds, the garden will die.” “I’ll bring you a bug or two,” said Amir.
text: "Tunahitaji wadudu" alisema Babu. "Ni mende ambao wanakula wadudu wanaoua mimea. Bila wadudu hao, bustani itakufa." " Nitakuletea mdudu mmoja au wawili," amiri alisema.

SourceText: For a whole week, Amir looked and searched and collected. He found one ladybird on the sports field.
text: Kwa wiki nzima, Amiri aliangalia na alitafuta na alikusanya. Alikuta mdudu mmoja kwenye eneo la michezo.

SourceText: Two more at the shop. Three at the park.
text: Wawili zaidi dukani. Watatu mbugani.

SourceText: And four behind the TV. Next week, Amir went to visit Grandpa Farouk, and showed him his jar of ten bugs. “You’ve done well, oh my boy, you’ve done well,” Grandpa said, with a tear in his eye.
text: Na wanne nyuma ya TV. Wiki ijayo, Amiri alienda kumtembelea Babu Faruku, na alimuonesha chupa yenye wadudu kumi. "umefanya vizuri, oh kijana wangu, umefanya vizuri," Babu alisema, akitokwa na machozi machoni mwake.

SourceText: Grandpa was very happy. The ladybirds were very hungry!
text: Babu alifurahi sana. Wadudu walikuwa na njaa sana!

SourceText: The ladybirds ate the pests, and the garden blossomed.
text: Wadudu hao wakula wadudu waharibifu na bustani ikachanua.

SourceText: From that day on, Grandpa Farouk’s garden did what gardens should do. It grew and grew and grew.
text: Kuanzia siku ile na kuendelea, bustani ya Babu Faruku ilifanya kile ambacho busta zinatakiwa kufanya. Ilikua na kukua na kukua.

SourceText: Colours
text: Rangi

SourceText: A white bear likes colours a lot, and he falls in love with new ones all the time. Join him as he explores a world of rainbows.
text: Dubu mweupe hupenda sana rangi, na huwa anapenda nyingine mpya kila wakati. Ungana nae anapochunguza dunia ya upinde wa mvua.

SourceText: © Room to Read, 2015. Some rights reserved. Released under CC BY 4.0 license.
text: Haki zote zimehifadhiwa © Room to Read, 2015. Imetolewa chini ya CC BY 4.0 license.

SourceText: Bear likes colours.
text: Dubu hupenda rangi.

SourceText: Now, her ears are yellow.
text: Sasa, maskio yake ni ya njano.

SourceText: Now, her tummy is brown.
text: Sasa, Tumbo lake ni la kahawia.

SourceText: Now, her mouth is red.
text: Sasa, Mdomo wake ni mwekundu.

SourceText: Now, her hands are blue.
text: Sasa, mikono yake ni ya blue.

SourceText: Now, her back is green.
text: Sasa, Mgongo wake ni wa kijani.

SourceText: Now, her legs are pink.
text: Sasa, Miguu yake ni ya pinki.

SourceText: Now, Bear is colourful!
text: Sasa, Dubu ana rangi!

SourceText: Oh no! Where did all her the_colours go?
text: Hapana! Rangi zake zote zimeenda wapi?

SourceText: Circles in the park
text: Mduara kwenye mbugani

SourceText: Golu and Tama go to the park to play. What do they see all around them? This wordless book introduces circles, semi-circles and quarter-circles.
text: Golu na Tama wanaenda mbugani kucheza. Wanaona vilivyowazunguka? Hiki kitabu kisicho na maneno kinatambulisha miduara, nusu miduara na robo miduara.

SourceText: © Pratham Books, 2021. Some rights reserved. Released under CC BY 4.0 license.
text: © Vitabu vya Pratham, 2021. Haki zingine zimehifadhiwa. Imetolewa chini ya leseni ya CC BY 4.0.

SourceText: Circle Semi-circle Quarter-cricle How many semi-circles make a circle? How many quarter-circles make a semi-circle?
text: Nusu duara-Robo-duara Je ni nusu duara ngapi hufanya duara? Ni robo duara ngapi hufanya nusu duara-duara?

SourceText: Discuss the book’s cover.  Ask: What do you see? What do you think this story is about?
text: Jadilli jalada la kitabu. Uliza: Unaona nini? Unafikiri hadithi hii inahusu nini?

SourceText: Lefa's Bath
text: Bafu ya Lefa

SourceText: Lefa wants her bath, but where does all the water go?
text: Lefa anataka akuoga, lakini maji yake yote yameenda wapi?

SourceText: This work is licensed under a [Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 Licence](https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/).
text: Kazi hii ina leseni chini ya [Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 Licence](https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/).

SourceText: Ask your child: what is the girl doing? Why do you think she is doing that? What animals are those? How many are there?
text: Muulize mtoto wako: Msichana anafanya nini? Unafikiri ni kwanini anafanya hivyo? hao ni wanyama gani? Wako wangapi?

SourceText: Mimic sounds and actions from the story, like the cows drinking the water.
text: Igiza sauti na vitendo kutoka kwenye hadithi, kama vile n’gombe wanakunywa maji.

SourceText: Say: oh no! Where has all the water gone? How do you think the girl is feeling?
text: Sema: Oh hapana! maji yameenda wapi? Unafikiri msichana anajiskiaje?

SourceText: Use descriptive words to talk about the pictures. Say: she is pouring water from her yellow bucket into the large orange bath.
text: Tumia maneno ya maelezo kuzungumzia picha. Sema: Msichana anamimina maji kutoka kwenye ndoo yake ya njano na kumiminia katika beseni kubwa la kuogea la rangi ya machungwa.

SourceText: Say: look! The ducks are splashing in the water! What do you think will happen next?
text: Sema: Tazama bata wanarusha maji! Je unadhani nini kitatokea baada ya hapo?

SourceText: Say: oh no! The bath has been emptied again! How did that happen? How is the girl feeling now?
text: Sema: Oh hapana! Benseni la kuogea halina maji tena! Nini kimetokea? Je msichana atajiskiaje sasa?

SourceText: Ask: What is the girl doing now? What animal can we see coming closer?
text: Uliza: Msichana anafanya nini sasa hivi? Ni mnyama gani tunamuona anakuja kwa karibu?

SourceText: Ask your child: What is the pig doing? What is happening to the water? Can the girl see what is happening?
text: Muulize mtoto wako: Je nguruwe anafanya nini? Nini kinatokea kwenye maji? Je msichana anaweza kuona nini kinatokea?

SourceText: Say: oh no! What happened to the bath now? How is the girl feeling?
text: Sema: Oh hapana! Nini kinatokea kwenye beseni la kuogea sasa? Je msichana anajiskiaje?

SourceText: Use your voice and face to demonstrate emotions from the pictures. Say: look, she is crying? Why do you think she is feeling sad? How do you think the animals are feeling?
text: Tumia sauti na uso wako kuonyesha hisia kutoka kwenye picha. Sema: Tazama, analia? unafikiri ni kwanini anajiskia huzuni? Unafikiri wanyama wanajiskiaje?

SourceText: Ask: what are the animals doing? Why are they doing that? Say: Can you count the buckets of water? Are they all the same colour? What colours can you see?
text: Uliza: Wanyama wanafanya nini? Kwanini wanafanya hivyo? Sema: Unaweza kuhesabu ndoo za maji? Je wote wana rangi moja? Je unaweza kuona rangi gani?

SourceText: Ask: How do you think the girl is feeling now? Why?
text: Uliza: Unafikiri msichana anajiskiaje sasa? Kwanini?

SourceText: Reflect on the story with your child. Ask: What did you think about the story? How would you feel if you were in the story? What would you have done?
text: Tafakari juu ya hadithi na mtoto wako. Uliza: Ulifikiri nini kuhusu hadithi? Ungejiskiaje kama ungekuwa kwenye hadithi? Ungefanya nini?

SourceText: Feel the Ground
text: Kuhisi ardhi

SourceText:
Close your eyes.

Notice your connection with the ground beneath you. 
What parts of your body touch the ground? What parts of your body do not?  
Notice where it feels warm and where it feels cool. 
Feel the ground underneath you supporting you. Let your body sink into the support of the ground.

Try this next time you feel alone or are doing a mundane activity like washing up. It can really help!
text:
Fumba macho yako.

Chunguza uhusiano wako na ardhi iliyo chini yako.
Je, ni sehemu gani za mwili wako zinagusa ardhi? Je, ni sehemu gani za mwili wako hazigusi ardhi?
Chunguza mahali palipo na joto na mahali palipo na baridi.
Gusa ardhi iliyo chini yako inayokubeba. Acha mwili wako uzame na kubebwa na ardhi.

Fanya hivi wakati mwingine unapojisikia mpweke au unafanya shughuli ya kawaida kama kunawa. Inaweza kusaidia kweli!
