SourceText: Take a moment to check in with yourself.
text: Chukua muda kujiangalia wewe mwenyewe.

SourceText: Wonderful, I am so happy things are going well.
text: Ni jambo la kuvutia sana, ninafurahi sana mambo yanaenda vizuri.

SourceText: Some days will have their challenges. That is okay. You are on the right path!
text: Baadhi ya siku zingine zitakuwa na changamoto zake. Hiyo ni sawa. Uko kwenye njia sahihi!

SourceText: Sorry that things are difficult now. It is completely normal to struggle sometimes. Remember that you are not alone!
text: Tunasikitika kuona kuwa mambo ni magumu sasa. Wakati mwingine ni jambo la kawaida kabisa kupata misukosuko. Kumbuka kwamba hauko peke yako!

SourceText: This week, we are focusing on the topic of **CONNECTION**.
text: Wiki hii tutajikita zaidi kwenye maada **MUUNGANIKO**.

SourceText: Connecting with your child and spending quality time together makes a big difference to their development.
text: Kuungana na mtoto wako na kutumia muda vizuri pamoja inaleta mabadiliko katika ukuaji wao.

SourceText:
Connection is the feeling you have with those special people in your life where you feel safe to be yourself and that they support you no matter what. It’s when you feel seen, understood and valued.

Children who have a strong connection with their caregivers are healthier, have better relationships, and find it easier to overcome challenges. The simple act of spending some one-on-one time with your child on a regular basis can make a big difference to their lives.
text:
Muunganiko ni hisia ambayo unayo kwa watu maalumu ulionao katika maisha yako, pale ambapo unajiskia salama wewe mwenyewe na kwamba wanakuunga mkono bila kujali chochote. Ni pale unapohisi wanatambua uwepo wako, wanakuelewa na wanakuthamini

Watoto wenye uhusiano mzuri na walezi wao wana afya, na wana uhusiano mzuri, na wanapata urahisi kuzikabili changamoto. Kitendo rahisi cha kutoa muda na kuutumia kwa mtoto wako ana kwa ana, katika ratiba ya kawaida inaweza kuleta tofauti kubwa kwenye maisha yao.

SourceText:
In @global.app_name, we use the image of a garden to think about what children need in their lives to grow and thrive. 

Let’s see how **connecting with your child** forms a part of the garden image.
text:
Kwenye @global.app_name, tunatumia taswira ya bustani kufikiri kile ambacho watoto wanahitaji katika maisha yao ili wakue na kustawi. 

Ngoja tuone jinsi mchezo unavyokuwa katika sehemu ya picha ya bustani.
note: The string @global.app_name, should not be translated.

SourceText: A plant that is firmly connected to the soil can grow strong roots and withstand storms. Children need strong connections with their caregivers to grow and thrive.
text: Mmea ambao umeunganishwa na udongo unaweza kukua na kuwa na mizizi yenye nguvu na kustahimili dhoruba. Watoto wanahitaji uhusiano imara na walezi wao ili kukua na kustawi.

SourceText:
When a plant is firmly connected to the soil, it grows strong and healthy roots. In the same way, a child who feels supported and close to their parents will have a safe foundation from which to grow and learn.

When roots are strong, plants can survive storms and bad weather. When children have strong connections with their caregivers, they can overcome challenges and cope with difficulties.
text:
Mmea unapokuwa umeunganika vizuri kwenye udongo, unakua kwa uimara na mizizi yenye afya. Na ni kwa jinsi hiyo, mtoto anayejisikia kusaidiwa, kulindwa, na kuwa karibu na wazazi wao watakuwa na msingi wa kukua na kujifunza.

Mizizi inapokuwa imara, mimea inaweza kustahimili dhoruba na hali mbaya ya hewa. Watoto wanapokuwa na muunganiko imara na walezi wao, wanaweza kupambana na changamoto na kukabiliana na magumu.

SourceText: Connecting with your child is when you focus on them and show interest in what they are doing or saying.
text: Kuungana na mtoto wako ni pale unapomzingatia na kuonyesha kupendezwa na kile anachofanya au kusema.

SourceText: Here’s how to get started:
text: Hii ndio jinsi ya kuanza:

SourceText:
**Make time to connect on a regular basis.**

Even 10-15 minutes can make a big difference. See it as an opportunity to take a break and relax together.
text:
**Tenga muda wa kuungana na mtoto wako mara kwa mara.**

Hata dakika 10 mpaka 15 zinaweza kuleta tofauti kubwa. Ona hii kama fursa ya kupata mapumziko mafupi na kutulia kwa furaha pamoja.

SourceText:
During one-on-one time, **give your child your full attention.** 

To help you focus on your child during one-on-one time, try to minimise distractions.
text:
Kwenye muda wa ana kwa ana, **mpe mtoto wako umakini wako kamili.**

Ili kukusaidia kumzingatia mtoto wako kwenye muda wa ana kwa ana, jaribu kupunguza usumbufu.

SourceText: What might distract you during one-on-one time?
text: Nini kinaweza kukusumbua kwenye muda wa ana kwa ana?

SourceText: My to-do list
text: Orodha yangu ya vitu vya kufanya

SourceText:
This is something that happens to all parents! It is normal to get distracted. 

If you find yourself thinking about other things, that’s okay. Notice when this happens and bring your focus to your child.
text:
Hiki ni kitu kinachotokea kwa wazazi wote! Ni kawaida kusumbuliwa.

Ikiwa unajikuta unafikiria juu ya mambo mengine, hiyo ni sawa, angalia hili linaweza kutokea na elekeza umakini wako kwa mtoto wako.

SourceText: Other children needing my attention
text: Watoto wengine wanahitaji umakini wangu

SourceText:
It can be really hard to focus on one child when you are also caring for other children.

Try to set up tasks or activities for your other children before-hand. There might still be interruptions, and that’s also okay.
text:
Inaweza kuwa ngumu sana kuzingatia mtoto mmoja wakati pia unawatunza watoto wengine.
Jaribu kuanzisha kazi au shughuli za watoto wako wengine kabla ya hapo. bado kunaweza kuwa na usumbufu, na hiyo pia ni sawa.

SourceText: Incoming calls or messages
text: Simu na jumbe zinazoingia

SourceText: We are all easily distracted by our phones. Putting your phone away or putting it on silent could help.
text: Ni rahisi sana kuvurugwa na simu zetu, Kuweka simu yako mbali au kuiweka katika ukimya inaweza kusaidia.

SourceText:
During one-on-one time, **be responsive and enthusiastic.**

Respond to what your child is doing and saying with enthusiasm and encouragement.
text:
Kwenye muda wa Ana kwa Anaa, **kuwa msikivu na mwenye shauku.**

Mwitikie mtoto wako kwa anachokifanya na ongea kwa shauku na kutia moyo.

SourceText:
As you spend time together, pay attention to what your child is doing or saying. 
Respond to what your child is doing with enthusiasm and praise. Try not to be critical or negative during one-on-one time.
Giving your child your full attention and responding with enthusiasm helps them to feel close and connected to you.
text:
Kadiri mnavyokuwa pamoja, kuwa makini na anachofanya mtoto wako au anachokisema.
Itikia anachofanya mtoto wako kwa shauku na umsifie. Jaribu kutokuwa mkosoaji au kuwa tofauti na yeye kwenye muda wa ana kwa ana. Kuwa makini na mtoto wako na kumwitikia kwa shauku inawasaidia kujisikia kuwa karibu na wewe na kujiskia wameungana na wewe.

SourceText:
When I first heard I had to spend one-on-one time with my child, it was hard for me. I’m always doing things for my child, why do I need to get involved if they are playing happily by themselves? I did not want to spoil my child so that he thinks we have to do everything together. 

But after thinking about how good I feel when someone makes an effort to spend time with me and to listen to me, I thought that this might be really good for my child as well. So I decided to try it. 

I sat down next to my child and suggested that we draw a picture together. I asked her what she would like to draw. She suggested we draw our house and garden. I asked her what she would like me to draw, and she said I can draw the tree outside our house, while she draws the house. It was actually really relaxing to sit and do something together. We had a nice discussion about some of our favourite things about our home and what we enjoy doing together as a family.
text:
Niliposikia kwa mara ya kwanza natakiwa kutumia muda ana kwa ana na mtoto wangu, ilikuwa ngumu kwangu. Daima nafanya vitu kwa ajili ya mtoto wangu, kwanini nijihusishe nao ikiwa wanacheza wenyewe kwa furaha? Sikutaka kumharibu mtoto wangu akifikiri tunatakiwa kufanya kila kitu pamoja.
Lakini baada ya kufikiri jinsi ninavyojiskia vizuri pale mtu anapofanya juhudu kutumia muda kuwa na mimi na kunisikiliza, Niliwaza kwamba hii itakuwa kweli nzuri kwa ajili ya mtoto wangu pia. Hivyo niliamua kujaribu.

Nilikaa chini karibu na mtoto wangu na kupendekeza kwamba tuchore picha pamoja. Nilimuuliza angependa kuchora nini. Alipendekeza tuchore nyumba yetu na bustani. Nilimuuliza angependa nichore nini na akasema unaweza kuchora mti nje ya nyumba yetu, wakati yeye anachora nyumba. Ilikuwa kiburudisho kweli kukaa na kufanya kitu pamoja. Tulikuwa na mjadala mzuri kuhusu baadhi ya vitu tunavyovipenda kuhusu nyumba yetu na nini tunafurahia kufanya pamoja kama familia.

SourceText: Did you know: connecting with your child can help reduce negative behaviours.
text: Je unajua kwamba kuungana ana mtoto wako kunaweza kusaidia kupunguza tabia mbaya.

SourceText:
When our children are being difficult, it can be even harder to find the time and energy to connect with them. But this is often when children benefit from connection the most. 

Children are more likely to act out when they feel unseen or unsupported. If you notice your child is being difficult or acting out, try to make some time to connect with them and spend one-on-one time together.
text:
Watoto wetu wanapokuwa wabishi, inakuwa ni vigumu kutafuta muda na kupata moyo kuungana nao. Lakini hii inatokea mara kwa mara pale ambapo watoto wanafaidika zaidi na muunganiko.
Kuna uwezekano mkubwa watoto wakaigiza pale wanapohisi kutoonekana au kutosaidiwa. Ukimuona mtoto wako ni mbishi au anaigiza, jaribu kutenga muda kuungana nao na kutumia muda wa ana kwa ana pamoja.

SourceText: Won’t connecting with my child when they are being difficult seem like I am rewarding them for bad behaviour?
text: Siwezi kuungana na mtoto wangu kama wanakuwa wabishi itaonekana ninafurahia tabia yake mbaya?

SourceText: Good question! Connecting with your child does not mean that you give your child everything they want to keep them happy.
text: Swali zuri! Kuungana na mtoto wako haimaanishi kwamba unampa mtoto wako kila kitu wanachotaka kuwafanya wawe na furaha.

SourceText:
Remember that what you experience, you can express. What you pour into your child’s cup is what will pour out. When your child experiences kindness and understanding, they learn how to do the same for other people. 

This does not mean that you allow your child to do whatever they want without consequences. You can support your child to improve their behaviour while still showing them that your love for them does not change.
text:
Kumbuka kwamba, ulichokutana nacho, unaweza kukielezea. nachokimiminia kwenye kikombe cha mtoto wako ndicho kitakachomiminika nje. Mtoto wako anapopata upendo na kueleweka, wanajifunza kufanya hivyo hivyo kwa watu wengine.

Hii haimaanishi kwamba, unaruhusu mtoto wako afanye lolote analotaka bila matokeo. Unaweza kumsaidia mtoto wako kuboresha tabia zao wakati ukiwaonyesha kuwa upendo wako kwao haujabadilika.

SourceText: Sharing a book with your child is a great way to connect and spend quality time together.
text: Kushirikishana kitabu na mtoto wako ni njia nzuri ya kuungana na mtoto wako na kutumia muda vizuri pamoja.

SourceText: Here are some ideas for how you can use book activities to connect.
text: Haya ni baadhi ya mawazo ya jinsi ambavyo unaweza kutumia shughuli za kitabu kuungana na mtoto wako.

SourceText: Make book and story activities part of your daily routine.
text: Fanya kitabu na shughuli za hadithi kuwa rutaratibu wako wa kila siku.

SourceText:
By reading together every day, your child will learn to love books and enjoy reading. The more time children spend looking at books, the more they learn. So, make reading part of your daily routine.

Even in a busy day, find some time to look at books and read with your child. Even 10 minutes a day can make the world of difference.

Find a time that works best for your family. This might be first thing in the morning or towards the end of the day when you want your child to come inside. Reading before bedtime can also help children fall asleep easier.
text:
Kwa kusoma pamoja kila siku, mtoto wako atajifunza kupenda vitabu na kufurahia kusoma. Kadri watoto wanavyotumia muda mwingi kutazama vitabu, ndivyo wanavyojifunza zaidi Hivyo fanya kusoma iwe sehemu ya utaratibu wako wa kila siku.

Hata kwenye siku yenye shughuli nyingi, pata muda wa kutizama vitabu na kusoma na mtoto wako, hata kwa dakika 10 kwa siku vinaweza kuleta mabadiliko katika ulimwengu.

Tafuta muda zaidi unaofaa kwa familia yako. Hii inaweza kuwa ni kitu cha kwanza asubuhi au inapoelekea mwisho wa siku unapotaka watoto wako waingie ndani, kusoma kabla ya kulalaa kunaweza kunamsaidia mtoto wako kulala kwa urahisi.

SourceText: What time do you think will work for your family?
text: Unafikiri ni muda gani utaafaa kwa familia yako?

SourceText: Morning
text: Asubuhi

SourceText: A book activity in the morning can be a great way to connect with your child and help start their day on the right note.
text: Shughuli ya kitabu asubuhi inaweza kuwa njia nzuri ya kuungana na mtoto wako na inasaidia kuanza siku yao na dokezo sahihi.

SourceText: Afternoon
text: Mchana

SourceText: Sharing a book together in the afternoon can be a great way to connect and take a break during a busy day.
text: Kushirikishana kitabu pamoja wakati wa mchana inaweza ikawa njia nzuri ya kuungana na kupumzika siku yenye shughuli nyingi.

SourceText: Evening
text: Usiku

SourceText: Book activities before bedtime is a great way to help children settle down and fall asleep easier.
text: Shughuli za vitabu kabla ya kulala ni njia nzuri ya kumsaidia mtoto atulie na kulala kirahisi.

SourceText: Weekends
text: Mwishoni mwa wiki

SourceText: It can be really hard to find time during the busy week for book activities. Weekends are a great time to catch up with children and connect.
text: Inaweza kuwa ngumu sana katika wiki yenye shughuli nyingi, kwa shughuli za vitabu. Mwishoni mwa wiki ni muda mzuri wa kuungana na watoto.

SourceText: As you go through the book, give your child your full attention. Notice and respond to what your child is interested in.
text: Unapopitia kitabu, mpe mtoto wako umakini mkubwa. Tambua na ujibu kile kinachomvutia mtoto wako.

SourceText: Listen for an example:
text: Sikiliza mfano:

SourceText:
As you go through the book, notice what your child is looking at, pointing at, or talking about and respond to it. 
For example, if your child is looking at the picture of the sandwich, you could say: “Look, he is eating some bread. What do you think is on the bread? What do you like to eat on your bread?”
Give your child time to respond, and let them set the pace. They might want to spend a long time talking about one page or move on quickly to the next page. Follow their lead as much as possible.
text:
Unapopitia kitabu, Tambua ni nini mtoto wako anachotazama. anachoonyesha au anachozungumzia na ujibu. Kwa mfano kama mtoto wako anatazama kwenye picha ya mkate. Unaweza kusema: “Angalia, anakula mkate. unafikiri ndani ya mkate kuna nini? Unapenda kula nini kwenye mkate wako?” 
Mpe mtoto wako nafasi ya kujibu, Na muache atengeneze kasi yake. Wanaweza kutaka kutumia muda mrefu kuongelea ukurasa mmoja au kuendelea haraka kwenye ukurasa unaofata. Fuata muongozo wao kadiri inavyowezekana.

SourceText: Don’t force your child if they are not interested. Rather try again another time.
text: Usimlazimishe mtoto wako kama hawavutiwi. Badaka yake jaribu tena wakati mwingine.

SourceText:
While it might feel tempting to force your child to do a book activity with you, this can do more harm in the long term. 
If your child enjoys the activity and has a positive experience, they will want to do it again. And the more time children spend looking at books and talking about the pictures, the more they learn and the better they do at school. 
Invite your child to join you in a book activity. If they don’t want to, rather try again another time. Keep asking them without putting pressure on them. You can also tell them about a particular book or story that you would like to share with them, to spark their interest.
text:
Wakati unaweza kujisikia kumlazimisha mtoto wako kufanya shughuli ya kitabu na wewe, hii inaweza kuumiza zaidi huko mbele
Kama mtoto wako anafurahia shughuli na ana uzoefu chanya, atataka kufanya tena. Na kadiri mtoto anavyotumia muda zaidi kuangalia vitabu na kuzungumza kuhusu picha, ndivyo wanavyojifunza zaidi na ndivyo watakavyofanya vizuri shuleni. Mualike mtoto wako kujiunga na wewe katika shughuli ya kitabu. Kama hawataki, badala yake ujaribu tena wakati mwingine. Endelea kuwaomba bila kuwalazimisha. Unaweza pia kuwaambia kuhusu kitabu fulani maalum au hadithi ambayo ungependa kushirikishana nao, kuchochea kinachowavutia.

SourceText:
Three easy ways to use book activities to connect:
1. Give your child your full attention as you go through the book together.

2. Notice what your child is interested in and talk about that.

3. Don’t force your child if they are not interested. Rather try again another time.
text:
Njia tatu za kutumia shughuli za kitabu kuungana.
1. Mpe mtoto wako umakini wako wote kadili mnavyokuwa mnapitia kitabu pamoja

2. Tambua ni nini mtoto wako anavutiwa nacho na uzungumzie kuhusu hicho

3. Usimlazimishe mtoto wako kama havutiwi. Ila jaribu tena wakati mwingine.

SourceText: Small actions, big results! Parents who practice at home get better results.
text: Matendo madogo, matokeo makubwa! Wazazi wanaofanya kwa vitendo nyumbani wanapata matokeo makubwa.

SourceText:
For your home practice:

🤝 Make some time to spend with your child one-on-one.

📖 Make book activities part of your routine, and use it as a time to connect. 

😌 Spending quality time with our children is important, but make sure you take some time for yourself too.
text:
Kwaajili ya kufanya nyumbani:
🤝Tengeneza muda flani wa kuwa na mtoto ana kwa ana

📖 Fanya shughuli za kitabu kuwa sehemu ya ratiba yako ya kila siku na ukitumie kama muda wa kuungana.

😌 Kutumia muda vizuri na watoto wetu ni muhimu, lakini hakiikisha unapata muda kwaajili yako mwenyewe pia.

SourceText: Why CONNECT
text: Kwanini KUUNGANA

SourceText: How to CONNECT
text: Namna ya KUUNGANA

SourceText: The power of CONNECTION
text: Nguvu ya KUUNGANA

SourceText: Using books to CONNECT
text: Kutumia vitabu KUUNGANA

SourceText: Praise Yourself
text: Jisifie wewe Mwenyewe

SourceText:
Self-praise can be really helpful, especially when we have difficult days. 

Think of your week and finish the following phrase: “This week, I am proud of myself for …” It can be anything, not just things about being a parent!

Think of one thing you did well today. Now wrap your arms around yourself and give yourself a big HUG!
text:
Kujisifia kunaweza kusaidia sana, hasa kwenye siku zinazotuendea vibaya.

Fikiria jinsi wiki ilivyokuendea halafu umalizie tungo ifuatayo: "Wiki hii, ninajivunia kwa…" Kinaweza kuwa kitu chochote, siyo mambo ya malezi tu!

Fikiria jambo moja ulilofanya vizuri leo. Sasa jifumbate kwa mikono yako mwenyewe halafu UJIKUMBATIE kwa nguvu!

SourceText: Self-care is a key parenting tool. It starts with recognising how we feel.
text: Kujithamini ni muhimu kwa malezi. Inaanza na kutambua jinsi tunavyohisi.

SourceText: Great. And amazing that you are using this app – it shows your commitment as a parent. Make sure you give yourself credit and praise for what you are doing.
text: Safi sana. Na inapendeza sana kuona unatumia programu hii – inaonyesha jinsi unavyojitoa kwa dhati kama mzazi. Hakikisha unajitambua na kujisifia kwa kile unachokifanya.

SourceText: Every day has its highs and lows. Praise yourself for being here and trying – you are moving forward.
text: Kila siku kuna kupanda na kushuka. Jisifie kwa kuwa hapa na kujaribu – unasonga mbele.

SourceText: Sorry that things are difficult right now. Take a deep breath and know that you are valued.
text: Tunasikitika kuona kuwa mambo ni magumu sasa hivi. Vuta pumzi ndefu na ujue kuwa unathaminiwa.

SourceText: This week, we want to talk about the environment you **CREATE** for your child.
text: Wiki hii, tunataka kuzungumza kuhusu mazingira **UNAYOTENGENEZA** kwaajili ya mtoto wako.

SourceText: A positive environment helps children feel safe and helps them learn.
text: Mazingira mazuri huwasaidia watoto kujiskia salama na huwasaidia kujifunza.

SourceText:
In ParentApp for Kids, we use the image of a garden to think about what children need in their lives to grow and thrive. 

Let’s see how **creating a positive environment** forms part of the garden image.
text:
Kwenye program ya wazazi kwa watoto, tunatumia taswira ya bustani kufikiri kile ambacho watoto wanahitaji katika maisha yao ili wakue na kustawi.

Ngoja tuone jinsi mchezo unavyokuwa katika sehemu ya picha ya bustani.

SourceText: In the same way that all plants need sunlight to grow, all children need praise and positive encouragement from their caregivers.
text: Kwa jinsi hiyo kwamba mimea yote inahitaji jua kukua, watoto wote wanahitaji kusifiwa na kutiwa moyo na walezi wao.

SourceText:
Children thrive when caregivers respond to them with warmth, acceptance and praise. Just as the sun rises and sets every day, try to give your child some positive attention every day. 

Remember that what gets light will grow. When parents give positive attention to good behaviour with praise, children will be encouraged to behave that way more often in the future.
text:
Watoto hustawi pale walezi wanapowaitikia kwa uchangamfu, kuwapokea na kuwasifia. Kama vile linavyochomoza na kutua kila siku, jaribu kumpa mtoto wako umakini kila siku.

Kumbuka kwamba, kinachopata mwanga kitakua. Pale wazazi wanapokuwa makini kwa tabia nzuri na kusifia, watoto watatiwa moyo kuendelea zaidi kuwa na tabia hiyo kila wakati katika maisha yao baadae.

SourceText: Here’s how you can create a positive environment for your child:
text: Hivi ndivyo unaweza kutengeneza mazingira mazuri kwa mtoto mtoto wako:

SourceText:
**Give positive instructions**

Positive instructions are more effective than negative instructions. Telling children what we DO want them to do works better than telling them to STOP doing something.
text:
**Toa maelekezo mazuri**

Maelekezo mazuri na chanya ni mazuri zaidi kuliko maelekezo mabaya. Kuwaambia watoto nini TUNATAKA wao wafanye vizuri badala ya kuwaambia waache kufanya kitu fulani.

SourceText:
Let’s say you are visiting a friend, and your children are playing together. As they play, you notice that your child sometimes shares the toys and other times grabs the toy from her friend. Instead of saying: “stop grabbing that toy!” you could say: “give your friend a chance to play with the toy” 

It is easier for children to follow instructions that tell them what they should do, rather than what they shouldn’t do.
text:
Hembu tuseme unamtembelea rafiki, na watoto wako wanacheza pamoja. Wanapocheza utagundua kuwa mtoto wako wakati mwingine anachezea mdoli wake pamoja na mtoto mwingine na wakati mwingine anamnyang”anya mdoli rafiki yake. Badala ya kusema “acha kunyang”anya huyo mdoli”! Ungeweza kusema; “ mpe rafiki yako sasa achezee mdoli wako”
Ni rahisi kwa watoto kufuata maelekezo ya kuwaambia nini wanatakiwa kufanya, kuliko kuwaambia waache au kuwakataza kufanya jambo fulani.

SourceText: Need some convincing? Let’s do an exercise:
text: Unahitaji kuelezewa zaidi? Hembu tufanye zoezi:

SourceText:
DO NOT THINK ABOUT AN ELEPHANT.

What are you thinking about?
text:
USIFIKIRI KUHUSU TEMBO.

Unafikiri kuhusu nini?

SourceText:
You probably DID think about an elephant...

‘Don’t do’ instructions make children think about that thing.

Sometimes they do not understand what we DID want from them.

Also they often don’t like being told not to do things (just like most of us).
text:
Labda ulifikiria kuhusu Tembo…

Usifanye kwa vitendo maelekezo uliyoyatoa, hufanye watoto wafikirie kuhusu kile kitu.

Wakati mwingine hawaelewi tulitaka nini kutoka kwao.

Pia mara nyingi hawapendi kuambiwa wasifanye vitu (ni kama ilivyo kwa wengi wetu).

SourceText:
NOW, THINK ABOUT A CHEETAH! 

What are you thinking about?
text:
SASA, FIKIRI KUHUSU DUMA!

Je, unafikiri kuhusu nini?

SourceText: That’s right - a cheetah! Positive, clear instructions help children focus on what they should be doing.
text: Hiyo ni sawa duma! Maelekezo ya wazi na yenye tija yanasaidia watoto kufatilia kile wanachotakiwa kufanya.

SourceText:
Before, I used to raise my children the way I was raised: I would tell them “don’t do this, don’t do that.” We used to fight a lot, but things have really changed when I learnt about giving positive instructions.

Now I focus on the behaviour I want to see, and give clear and simple instructions to my children. It took time to learn to say “please do this” instead of “don’t do this.” 

My children and even my husband tell me that they love this way of doing things, because now they know what needs to be done.
text:
Kabla, nilizoea kulea watoto wangu kwa namna ambayo nililelewa: Niliwaambia “usifanye hivi, usifanye vile.” Tulizoea kugombana mno, lakini mambo yamebadilika kweli nilipojifunza kuhusu kutoa maelekezo yenye tija.

Sasa nazingatia tabia ninayotaka kuiona, na kutoa maelekezo rahisi na ya wazi kwa watoto wangu. Ilichukua muda kujifunza kusema “tafadhali fanya hili” badala ya “usifanye hili”
Watoto wangu na hata mume wangu wananiambia kwamba wanapenda namna hii ya kufanya vitu, kwa sababu sasa wanajua nini kinatakiwa kufanyika.

SourceText:
**Use praise to encourage positive behaviour**
If we praise our children when they do something well, we will see them do more and more positive things!
text:
**Tumia sifa kuhimiza tabia nzuri**
Kama tunasifia watoto wetu wanapofanya vizuri, tutawaona wakifanya vitu vyenye tija zaidi na zaidi!

SourceText: Sometimes it is hard to think of what to praise your child for! Here are some ideas from other parents:
text: Wakati mwingine ni ngumu kufikiria kitu cha kumsifia mtoto wako! Haya ni baadhi ya mawazo kutoka kwa wazazi wengine:

SourceText: Ideas for praise:
text: Mawazo ya namna ya kumsifia mtoto wako:

SourceText:
Being kind to someone 
Sharing their toys
Packing away their things 
Saying 'please' or 'thank you' 
Helping out around the house
Listening
text:
Kuwa mwema kwa mtu flani
Kutumia midoli yao pamoja na wengine
Kupanga vitu vyao
Kusema “ tafadhal” au “asante”
Kusadia kazi za nyumbani
Kusikiliza

SourceText: **Question time:**
text: **Muda wa maswali:**

SourceText: Think about the last time someone thanked you, or said you did something great.
text: Kumbuka mara ya mwisho mtu alipokushukuru, au kusema umefanya jambo zuri sana.

SourceText: How did it make you feel?
text: Ulijisikiaje?

SourceText: Loved
text: Unapendwa

SourceText: Valued
text: Kuthaminiwa

SourceText: Parents usually do not get thanked or praised enough.
text: Mara nyingi wazazi hawashukuriwi au kusifiwa vya kutosha.

SourceText: How does it make you feel when nobody says "thank you"?
text: Je, unajisikiaje usipoambiwa "asante" na mtu yeyote?

SourceText: Your child can feel this way too. That's what makes this week's parenting tool simple but important: Praise them for what they do right.
text: Mtoto wako anaweza kujiskia hivi pia, Hili ndilo linafanya zana ya malezi ya wiki hii kuwa ya kawaida lakini muhimu. Wasifie kwa kile wanachofanya vizuri.

SourceText: Let’s look at a story to see how you can use praise and positive attention to encourage your child to follow instructions:
text: Hembu tuangalie hadithi kuona jinsi unavyoweza kutumia sifa na umakini wenye tija kuhimiza mtoto wako kufuata maelekezo:

SourceText: It’s so lovely to see you playing so nicely together, Neema and Robert. In five minutes it will be time to come inside and wash up.
text: Inapendeza sana kuona mnacheza vizuri pamoja, Neema na Robert. Ndani ya dakika tano itakuwa muda wa kuingia ndani na kuoga.

SourceText: What does the caregiver do before she informs her children that they will have to stop playing in five minutes’ time? She first brings attention to their positive behaviour of playing nicely together. This is a clever way to make it easier for the children to accept the next instruction.
text: Je, mlezi anafanya nini kabla ya kuwajulisha watoto wake kwamba wataacha kucheza ndani ya dakika tano? Kwanza ataweka umakini kwenye tabia yao nzuri ya kucheza vizuri pamoja. Hii ni njia ya kijanja kufanya watoto wakubali maelekezo yanayofuata.

SourceText: Catch!
text: Kamata!

SourceText: Let’s reflect on the children’s perspective:
text: Hebu tutafakari juu ya mtazamo wa mtoto:

SourceText: The children are having fun playing in the garden. They might not want to stop playing in five minutes’ time. If their mother came out and told them to come inside immediately (instead of giving them some warning), they may have found it difficult to listen and do what she asked.
text: Watoto wanafurahia kucheza kwenye bustani. Huenda hawataki kuacha kucheza ndani ya dakika tano j. Ikiwa mama yao angetoka na kuwaambia waingie ndani mara moja ( badala ya kuwapa onyo) Huenda wangepata ugumu wa kusikiliza na kufanya kile alichowambia.

SourceText: Neema, Robert - it’s time to put the ball away and come inside now.
text: Neema, Robert - Ni muda wa kuweka mpira mbali na kuja ndani sasa.

SourceText: The caregiver uses her children’s names so that she makes sure they will pay attention to what she is saying. She tells them exactly what she wants them to do. This makes it easier for her children to follow her instructions.
text: Mlezi hutumia majina ya watoto wake ili kuhakikisha wanakuwa makini na anachokisema. Huwaambia kwa usahihi kile ambacho anataka wafanye. Hii inafanya iwe rahisi kwa watoto wake kufuata maelekezo yake.

SourceText: Thank you for coming inside when I asked you to. Please go wash your hands and then I will tell you a story.
text: Asante kwa kuja ndani pale nilipowaambia mje. Tafadhali nendeni mkanawe mikono yenu na halafu nitawasimulia hadithi.

SourceText: Let’s reflect on the caregiver’s actions:
text: Hembu tutafakari juu ya vitendo vya mlezi:

SourceText: The caregiver praises her children for their positive behaviour before giving them another instruction. As parents I’m sure some of you are thinking: why should I praise my child for just doing the basic things that they should be doing?! That’s a normal thought to have. But praise actually helps you as a parent and can make your life easier. By praising her children before giving them a new instruction, the children are more likely to listen and do what the caregiver is asking.
text: Mlezi anawasifia watoto wake kwa tabia nzuri kabla ya kuwapa maelelekezo mengine. Kama wazazi, nina hakika baadhi yenu wanafikiria kwanini nimsififie mtoto wangu kwaajili tu ya kufanya mambo ya msingi ambavyo wanatakiwa wayafanye? Hayo ni mawazo ya kawaida kuwa nayo. Lakini kusifia kimsingi inakusaidia wewe kama mzazi na inaweza kufanya maisha yako yawe rahisi. Kwa kuwasifia watoto wake kabla ya kuwapa maelelkezo mapya, Watoto wanaelekea kusikiliza na kufanya kile ambacho mlezi anawaambia.

SourceText: Thank you for washing up so nicely. Let’s sit down and read a story together.
text: Asante kwa kunawa vizuri. Hebu tukae chini na tusome hadithi pamoja.

SourceText: Let’s reflect:
text: Hembu tutafakari:

SourceText: By using clear, positive instructions and praise to encourage her children, this caregiver successfully managed to get her children to stop their game, come inside and wash their hands. This happened without threats, screaming, tears or tantrums. By reinforcing the praise with a simple reward - like reading a story together - she helps her children to follow instructions more easily in the future.
text: Kwa kutumia maelekeza ya wazi na chanya na kusifia watoto wake, huyu mlezi anafanikiwa kuwafanya watoto wake waache mchezo wao na waende ndani na kuosha mikono yao. Hii ilitokea bila vitisho, kukaripia, machozi au hasira. Kwa kuimarisha kusifia na kwa zawadi ndogo - kama kusoma hadithi pamoja - huwasiaida watoto wake kufuata maelekezo kirahisi zaidi hapo baadae.

SourceText: Remember that what gets light will grow!
text: Kumbuka kwamba kinachopata mwanga kitakua!

SourceText: Positive instead of negative attention works much better to encourage children to behave the way we want them to.
text: Badala ya umakini hasi, umakini chanya hufanya kazi vizuri zaidi kuwatia moyo watoto wawe na tabia ile ambayo tunataka wawe nayo.

SourceText: Book activities are a great opportunity to give your child positive attention.
text: Shughuli za kitabu ni njia nzuri inayompa mtoto wako fursa chanya na ya umakini.

SourceText: Here are some ideas for how you can create positive interactions during book activities:
text: Haya ni baadhi ya mawazo kwaajili ya jinsi unavyoweza kutumia shughuli za vitabu kuungana:

SourceText: As you go through the book together, respond to what your child is saying in a positive and enthusiastic way.
text: Mnapopitia kitabu pamoja, mjibu mtoto wako kwa kile anachosema kwa njia chanya na kwa shauku.

SourceText:
Using positive responses such as “great”, “well done”, “that’s right”, “yes, tell me more”, “let’s try”, “how about” or “let’s see” during book activities will encourage your child to feel confident to interact with the book and with you. 
When you speak in a positive and enthusiastic way, your child will feel excited and will be eager to learn from the book and the story.
text:
Kutumia majibu chanya kama vile ‘nzuri”, “ umefanya vizuri”, “ hiyo ni sawa”, “ndio, niambie zaidi”, “hembu tujaribu”, “ vipi kuhusu” au “ hembu tuone” wakati wa shughuli za kitabu itamtia moyo mtoto na kumfanya ajisikie jasiri kuchangamana na kitabu na wewe.
Unapozungumza vizuri na kwa shauku, mtoto wako atajisikia furaha na atakuwa na hamu kujifunza kutoka kwenye kitabu na hadithi.

SourceText: Avoid being critical or negative.
text: Epuka kuwa mkosoaji na kutokukubaliana.

SourceText: Being critical will discourage your child from speaking or engaging in the activity.
text: Kuwa mkosoaji kutamkatisha tamaa mtoto wako katika kuongea au kushiriki kwenye shughuli.

SourceText:
Book activities do not have to be serious. It is about sharing the book in a way that you and your child will enjoy, not about being strict or being right. 
So, if your child makes a mistake, avoid being critical or negative. You don’t have to be hard on your child, or make fun of them when they don’t know something.
When your child points to a picture and calls it the wrong name – for example pointing to a tomato and calling it an apple, all you need to do is respond with the correct word. Instead of saying “no, that is wrong! How can you say that’s an apple?!” just respond by saying “that’s a tomato” This will help them learn the correct word, without making them feel discouraged to try again.
text:
Shughuli za kitabu hazihitaji kuwa makini. Inahusu tu kushirikishana kitabu kwa jinsi ambayo wewe na mtoto wako mtafurahia, haihusiani na kuwa mkali au kuwa sahihi. Hivyo, kama mtoto wako anafanya makosa, epuka kuwa mkosoaji au kuwa tofauti naye. Hutakiwa kuwa mgumu kwa mtoto wako. Au kuwafanyia mzaha pale wanapokuwa hawajui kitu fulani.
Mtoto wako anapoonesha picha na kuiita jina ambalo si sahihi - kwa mfano kuonesha nyanya na kuiita ni tofaa/epo, unachohitaji kufanya ni kuitikia kwa neno sahihi. Badala ya kusema "hapana, hiyo si sawa! Unawezaje kusema hilo ni tofaa/epo?!" itikia kwa kusema "hiyo ni nyanya" Hii itawasaidia kujifunza neno sahihi, bila kuwafanya wajisikie kuvunjika moyo kujaribu tena.

SourceText:
Three easy ways to use book activities to create positive interactions:
1. Respond in a positive way to what your child is saying
2. Avoid being critical or negative
3. Praise your child’s efforts.
text:
Njia tatu za kutumia shughuli za kitabu kutengeneza mahusiano chanya

1. Itikiwa kwa njia chanya kile mtoto wako anachosema
2. Epuka kuwa mkosoaji au kutofautiana i naye
3. Sifia juhudi za mtoto wako.

SourceText: Kindness and praise help children feel safe and confident, which helps them learn.
text: Ukarimu na kusifia kunasaidia watoto kujiskia salama na jasiri, kitu ambacho kinawasaidia kujifunza.

SourceText:
Small actions, big results! Parents who practice at home get better results.

For your home practice:
🤝 Find opportunities to give your child positive attention every day.
📖 Share books with your child in a fun and positive way.
😌 Remember to praise yourself too for your hard work as a parent.
text:
Vitendo vidogo, matokeo makubwa, wazazi wanaofanya mazoezi nyumbani hupata maatokeo makubwa.
🤝 Tafuta fursa za kumpa mtoto wako kwa mawazo chanya kila siku.
📖 Shirikishana vitabu na mtoto wako katika njia ya kufurahisha na nzuri.
😌 Kumbuka kujisifia wewe mwenyewe pia kwa kazi nzuri unayoifanya kama mlezi.

SourceText: Why CREATE
text: Kwa nini KUTENGENEZA

SourceText: How to CREATE
text: Jinsi ya KUTENGENEZA

SourceText: The power of CREATE
text: Nguvu ya KUTENGENEZA

SourceText: Using books to CREATE
text: Kutumia vitabu KUTENGENEZA

SourceText: Being a parent is stressful!
text: Kuwa mzazi inaleta msongo wa mawazo!

SourceText: When we feel stressed or overwhelmed, it can be difficult to look after ourselves, and our children.
text: Tunapopata msongo wa mawazo au kuelemewa, inaweza kuwa ngumu kujitunza sisi wenyewe na watoto wetu.

SourceText: That’s why every ParentApp module starts with a “Relax” activity to help you slow down and take a moment for yourself.
text: Ni kwasababu hiyo kila mada ya programu ya wazazi inaanza na shughuli ya "kupumzika" kukusaidia kupunguza kasi na kupata muda kwaajili yako mwenyewe.

SourceText: Breathe to Three
text: Vuta pumzi mara Tatu

SourceText:
Close your eyes. 

Use the magic power of three to stay connected and relax.

Breathe in to the count of three. 1, 2, 3. 
Breathe out to the count of three. 1, 2, 3. 
Breathe in to the count of three. 1, 2, 3. 
Breathe out to the count of three. 1, 2, 3.

Do you feel any different? Deep breathing helps our whole body and mind to calm down. 

Well done on taking a pause.
text:
Funga macho yako.
Tumia nguvu ya maajabu ya tatu kubaki kwenye muunganiko na pumzika.
Vuta pumzi ndani na uhesabu mpaka tatu 1,2,3
Vuta pumzi nje na uhesabu mpaka tatu 1,2,3
Vuta pumzi nje na uhesabu mpaka tatu 1,2,3
Vuta pumzi nje na uhesabu mpaka tatu 1,2,3

Unaskia tofauti yoyote? Kuvuta pumzi kwa kina inasaidia mwili mzima na akili kutulia.

Umefanya vema kwa kutulia.

SourceText: Being a great parent also means taking time to care for yourself every day. It starts with recognising how you feel.
text: Kuwa mzazi mahiri pia humaanisha kupata wakati wa kujitunza kila siku. Inaanza na kutambua jinsi unavyohisi.

SourceText: So good to hear you are feeling well today. You are incredible!
text: Tunafurahi sana kusikia kuwa unajisikia vizuri leo. Unastaajabisha!

SourceText: We all have days where we just don’t know. That is okay! You are here and that is what matters.
text: Sisi sote tuna siku ambazo hatuzielewi. Hiyo ni sawa! Uko hapa na hicho ndicho cha muhimu.

SourceText: Being a parent can be hard. But you are here and that shows you want to keep improving things. That is a big accomplishment already!
text: Kuwa mzazi inaweza kuwa ngumu. Lakini uko hapa na hiyo inaonyesha kuwa unataka kuendelea kuboresha mambo. Hayo ni mafanikio makubwa tayari!

SourceText: Well done for starting your ParentApp journey, it’s good to have you here.
text: Umefanya vizuri kuanza safari yako ya Programu ya wazazi kwa watoto, Ni jambo jema kuwa na wewe hapa.

SourceText: Listen to your welcome message:
text: Sikiliza ujumbe wako wa ukaribisho:

SourceText:
A very warm welcome to you - dear parent! We are thrilled that you have decided to join our community of caregivers. The fact that you are using ParentApp right now means that your children, their wellbeing and development is important to you. The aim of this app is to guide and support you in your important role as a parent. 

As parents ourselves, we know how hard parenting can be - how tired, frustrated and overwhelmed we all sometimes feel. 

We know that an app can’t solve all your problems, but we hope that ParentApp can make you feel slightly less alone, and make things feel just a little bit easier and more manageable.
text:
Karibu sana - mpendwa mzazi! Tumefurahi sana kwa kuwa umeamua kujiunga kwenye jumuiya yetu ya wazazi. Ni kweli kwamba unatumia Pgrogramu ya wazazi sasa, hii inamaanisha kuwa ustawi na maendeleo ya watoto wako ni muhimu kwako. Lengo la programu hii ni kukuongoza na kukusaidia katika jukumu hili muhimu kama mzazi.

Sisi wenyewe kama wazazi, tunajua jinsi ambavyo suala zima la malezi linavyoweza kuwa gumu - la kuchosha, la kuchanganya na wakati mwingine la kuelemea.

Tunajua kwamba programu haiwezi kutatua matatizo yako yote, ila tunatarajia programu inaweza kufanya mambo yawe rahisi kidogo na kuyadhibiti zaidi.

SourceText: Yes, let’s go!
text: Ndio, twende!

SourceText: Great! Let’s take a look at what you can expect from ParentApp.
text: Vizuri! hebu tuangalie nini unategemea kutoka programu ya wazazi kwa watoto.

SourceText: Not yet – I have questions…
text: Bado - Nina maswali…

SourceText: We understand! Let’s first take a look at what you can expect from ParentApp.
text: Tunaelewa! Hebu tuangalie kwanza nini unakitegemea kutoka programu ya wazazi kwa watoto.

SourceText: ParentApp for Kids includes 7 core modules. Each module focuses on a specific parenting strategy to support you in your important role as a parent.
text: Programu ya wazazi kwa watoto inajumuisha mada 7 za msingi. Kila mada huzingatia mbinu maalum kukusaidia wewe kwenye kazi yako muhimu kama mzazi.

SourceText:
Every ParentApp module will support you to:
1. build a strong relationship with your child
2. use books and stories to boost your child’s learning
3. take care of yourself
text:
Kila mada ya programu ya wazazi kwa watoto itakusaidia:
1. Kujenga uhusiano imara na mtoto wako
2. Kutumia vitabu na hadithi kupandisha kujifunza kwa mtoto wako
3. Kujijali wewe mwenyewe

SourceText:
One of the main goals of ParentApp for Kids is to help you build a strong and loving relationship with your child. Strong relationships with parents set children up for success in life. That’s why ParentApp offers tried and tested parenting tools to support you in your role as a parent.  

We know how important your child is to you, and that you want the very best for them. That’s why ParentApp has a digital library with books and guidance for how to use them to help your child learn. 

Lastly: because we know how important YOU are to your children, ParentApp supports you to take care of yourself too.
text:
Moja ya malengo makuu ya Programu ya wazazi kwa watoto ni kukusaidia kujenga uhusiano wa upendo na imara na mtoto wako. Mahusiano imara na wazazi huleta mafanikio kwenye maishan ya watoto. Na kwasababu hiyo Proframu ya wazazi inatoa zana za malezi zilizojaribiwa na kupimwa kukusaidia wewe katika kazi  yako kama mzazi.

Tunajua  jinsi ambavyo mtoto wako alivyo muhimu sana kwako, ma kwamba unamtakia mema zaidi. Ndio maana Programu ya wazazi na ina maktaba ya kidijitali yenye vitabu na muongozo wa jinsi ya kuvitumia kumsaidia mtoto wako kujifunza.

Mwisho: kwasababu tunajua ni jinsi gani WEWE ni muhimu kwa watoto wako Programu wa wazazi hukusaidia kujijali wewe mwenyewe.

SourceText: **ParentApp supports you to take care of yourself.**
text: **Programu ya wazazi inakusaidia wewe kujijali.**

SourceText:
We often don’t look after ourselves enough. But this is so important, especially as a parent! 

Reducing our stress and treating ourselves well helps us AND our children.
text:
Mara nyingi hatujiangalii sisi wenyewe vya kutosha. Lakini hii ni muhimu sana, hasa kama mzazi!

Kupunguza msongo wa mawazo ni kujitibu sisi wenyewe vizuri inatusaidia sisi NA watoto wetu.

SourceText: Why is my wellbeing important to my child?
text: Kwanini ustawi wangu ni muhimu kwa mtotowangu?

SourceText: Great question. Caring for others starts with caring for yourself.
text: Swali zuri. Kuwajali wengine kunaanza na kujijali wewe mwenyewe.

SourceText: Remember that you cannot pour from an empty cup.
text: Kumbuka kwamba huwezi kumimina kutoka kwenye kikombe kitupu.

SourceText: Learn more:
text: Jifunze zaidi:

SourceText: If your own cup is empty, you won’t have anything to pour into your child’s cup. Take care of yourself, so you can take care of your child.
text: Kama kikombe chako mwenyewe ni kitupu, hutakuwa na kitu cha kumiminia kwenye kikombe cha mtoto. Jijali wewe mwenyewe, ili uweze kumjali mtoto wako.

SourceText: Every week, ParentApp will support you to take a pause, relax, and look after yourself.
text: Kila wiki, Programu ya wazazi itakusaidia kupumzika, kutulia na kujiangalia wewe mwenyewe.

SourceText: **ParentApp supports you to build a strong relationship with your child.**
text: **Programu ya wazazi inakusaidia kujenga uhusiano imara na mtoto wako.**

SourceText: A strong and loving relationship with your child is one of the biggest investments you can make in their future.
text: Uhusiano wenye upendo na imara na mtoto wako ni moja ya uwekezaji mkubwa unaoweza kufanya kwa maisha yao ya baadae.

SourceText:
I have three children, and I love them very much. I try my best to give them what they need, even when life is hard. I make sure that they are fed, washed, safe, and that they go to school. It’s also really important to me that my children respect others, that they behave properly, and keep our family name in good standing. 
The way I was raised – we would get into real trouble if we didn’t behave the way our parents wanted us to. My parents would hit me and my siblings to get us to behave. It’s what I know, so I thought that this should be the way I raise my kids as well. 
I really want my children to respect me, but I also want them to feel that they can trust me with their concerns and feelings. Even though my parents hit me and I turned out fine, I think I would have benefited from a relationship with my parents that was more accepting, loving and understanding – where I felt less fear about being hit or beaten, or to tell them about my problems.
text:
Nina watoto watatu, na ninawapenda sana. Ninajaribu kwa kiwango cha juu ninavyoweza kuwapa wanachohitaji, hata pale ambapo maisha ni magumu. Nina hakikisha wanakula, wanakuwa wasafi, salama, na pia wanaenda shule. Pia ni muhimu sana kwangu watoto wangu wawaheshimu wengine, kwamba wawe na tabia njema, na kutunza jina la familia yetu liendelee kubaki na heshima. 
Jinsi nilivyokuzwa – tungejikuta kwenye matatizo sana kama tusingekuwa na tabia ambayo wazazi wetu walitaka tuwe nayo. Wazazi wangu wangetupiga mimi na ndugu zangu ili tuwe na tabia njema. Hiki ndicho ninachokijua, hivyo nilidhani kwamba jinsi hii inatakiwa iwe ndivyo ninavyowalea watoto wangu pia. 
Ninahitaji sana watoto wangu waniheshimu, lakini pia nataka waniamini wanapokuwa na mahitaji yao na hisia. Ingawa wazazi wangu walinipiga na nikawa vizuri, nafikiri ningefaidika na uhusiano na wazazi wangu ule ambao unanipokea zaidi, wenye upendo na unaonielewa – pale nilipokuwa sihofii kuumizwa, au kupigwa, au kuwaambia kuhusu matatizo yangu.

SourceText: What creates a strong and loving relationship between a caregiver and child?
text: Nini kinafanya mahusiano kuwa imara na ya upendo kati ya mlezi na mtoto?

SourceText: Great question. In ParentApp for Kids, we use the image of a garden to think about what children need from their parents to grow and thrive.
text: Swali zuri, Katika Programu ya wazazi kwa watoto, tunatumia taswira ya bustani kufikiria ni nini watoto wanahitaji kutoka kwa wazazi wao kukua na kustawi.

SourceText: **The ParentApp Garden**
text: **Bustani ya Programu ya wazazi**

SourceText: Each element in the ParentApp Garden represents a powerful parenting tool.
text: Kila kipengele katika Bustani ya Programu ya wazazi inawakilisha zana yenye nguvu ya malezi.

SourceText: Every week we will focus on one of these parenting tools, and demonstrate how you can use it to support your child in positive ways.
text: Kila wiki tutajikita kwenye zana moja ya malezi nakuonyesha jinsi unavyoweza kuitumia kumsaidia mtoto wako kwa njia nzuri.

SourceText: ParentApp also includes ideas for activities that you and your child can do together at home.
text: Programu ya wazazi pia inajumuisha mawazo kwaajili ya shughuli ambazo wewe na mtoto wako mnaweza kufanya pamoja nyumbani.

SourceText: These activities were specifically designed to help children learn in positive ways while spending time with you.
text: Shughuli hizi ni zimeundwa maalum kusaidia watoto kujifunza katika njia chanya wakati huo wakitumia muda na wewe.

SourceText: **ParentApp supports you to use stories and books to help your child learn.**
text: **Programu ya wazazi inakusaidia kutumia hadithi na vitabu kumsaidia mtoto wako kujifunza.**

SourceText: Sharing stories and looking at books together benefits children in many ways.
text: Kushirikishana hadithi na kuangalia vitabu pamoja kunawanufaisha watoto kwa namna nyingi.

SourceText: Watch this video to learn more:
text: Tazama video kujifunza zaidi:

SourceText:
As caregivers, we want what’s best for our children. We want them to grow into successful, happy, healthy adults who contribute to society. One of the best ways to set your child up for success is to look at books together and talk about them with your child. This is a great way to help build your child’s brain, develop their reading skills, and help them become successful learners.

From babies to adolescents, reading or talking about the pictures and story helps children in many ways:

Children learn new sounds and words, and how to use them.

They learn how to listen and concentrate, which helps them at school.

Books and stories help children use their imagination, think and learn about the world. This helps them in every aspect of life.
text:
Kama walezi, tunataka kile kilicho bora kwaajili ya watoto wetu. Tunataka wawe na mafanikio, furaha, watu wazima wenye afya wanaochangia kwenye jamii. Moja ya njia bora ya kumuandaa mtoto wako kwa mafanikio ni kuangalia vitabu pamoja na kuvizungumzia na mtoto wako. Hii ni njia nzuri ya kusaidia kujenga ubongo wa mtoto wako, kukuza juzi zao za kusoma and kuwasaidia kuwa wasomaji wenye mafanikio.

Kutoka uchanga kwenda balehe, kusoma au kuzungumza kuhusu picha na hadithi husaidia watoto kwa njia nyingi.

Watoto hujifunza sauti mpya na maneno, na jinsi ya kuyatumia.

Vitabu na hadithi husaidia watoto kutumia mawazo yao, kufikiri na kujifunza kuhusu dunia. Hii huwasaidia katika kila eneo la maisha.

SourceText: Do you spend time looking at books or reading with your child?
text: Unatumia muda kutazama vitabu au kusoma na mtoto wako?

SourceText: Yes
text: Ndiyo

SourceText: Great! We are excited to share some ideas with you that you and your child might enjoy.
text: Vizuri! Tumefurahi kushirikishana baadhi ya mawazo na ninyi amabayo ninyi na watoto wenu mnaweza kuyafurahia.

SourceText: Not really
text: Sio sana

SourceText: That’s okay! We are excited to get you started on your book-sharing journey.
text: Hiyo ni sawa! Tumefurahi kuwa mmeanza safari yenu ya kushirikishana kitabu.

SourceText: At what age can I start sharing books with my child?
text: Ni katika umri gani naweza kuanza kushirikishana vitabu na mtoto wangu?

SourceText: It is never too early to start! Children of all ages – even young babies – benefit from book activities.
text: Hakuna muda maalum kwamba ni mapema sana! Watoto wa umri wote – hata watoto wachanga – hunufaika na shughuli za kitabu.

SourceText:
Before I joined ParentApp, I thought that children only needed books when they start primary school. I was very surprised to learn that the earlier you start with book activities, the easier it will be for children to learn to read when they get older. 

I was even more surprised to hear that you can start book activities when they are still babies – even before they can talk. So I am now doing different types of book activities with my 9-month old, my 4 year old and my 7 year old. 

With my baby, I sit with her on my lap, and I talk about the pictures in the same voice that I talk to her when I feed or bathe her. She gets really excited – she  makes all sorts of sounds and flaps her arms. 

With my 4 year old, I describe the pictures and ask him questions about the story. I do this with my 7 year old too, and she is already starting to recognise some letters and words in the book. My children really enjoy these activities. I wish I knew about this when I had my first child.
text:
Kabla sijajiunga na programu ya wazazi, nilifikiri kwamba watoto walihitaji vitabu  pale tu wanapoanza shule ya msingi. Nilishangazwa sana kujifunza kwamba ukianza shughuli za kitabu mapema, ndivyo itakavyokuwa rahisi  kwa watoto kujifunza kusoma pale wanapokuwa wamekua.

Hata nilishangazwa zaidi kusikia kwamba aunaweza kuanza shughuli za kitabu pale wanapokuwa watoto wachanga – hata kabla ya kuanza kuongea. Hivyo, sasa ninafanya shughuli tofauti za vitabu  na mtoto wangu mwenye umri wa miaka 4 na mtoto wangu mwenye umri wa miaka 7.

Nakaa na mtoto wangu, kwenye miguu yangu na ninazungumza kuhusu picha katika sauti ile ile ambayo ninaongea naye ninapomlisha au ninapomuogesha. Anafurahia sana – anatengeneza sauti mbalimbali na akipiga mikono yake.

Na mtoto wangu  wa miaka 4, naelezea picha na ninamuuliza maswali kuhusu hadithi. Ninafanya hii na mtoto wangu mwenye umri wa  miaka 7 pia, na tayari ameanza kutambua baadhi ya herufi na maneno ya kitabuni. Watoto wangu wanafurahia sana hizi shughuli. Natamani ningejua kuhusu hii nilipokuwa na mtoto wangu wa kwanza.

SourceText: How can I do book activities with my child if I struggle with reading myself?
text: Nitafanyaje shughuli za kitabu na mtoto wangu ikiwa mimi mwenyewe siwezi kusoma?

SourceText: This is a concern for many parents and caregivers. The good news is that you don’t need to read the book’s text when doing book activities.
text: Hii inawagusa wazazi wengi na walezi. Habari nzuri ni kwamba, hauhitaji kusoma maandishi ya kitabu wakati unafanya shughuli za kitabu.

SourceText:
As a caregiver, your involvement in reading activities is important at every age – whether children are very young, or whether children already know how to read.

Every caregiver can help their child with reading – even those who are busy or who cannot read themselves.

You can use the pictures to introduce new words and ideas to your child.

You and your child can create your own story around the pictures.

You can ask your child questions about the story, characters, and events. 

This creates important opportunities for conversation, thinking, and learning.

When families read together, children learn to enjoy reading.

Strong reading foundations help set children up for success in school, and later in life.

So, find a few minutes a day, every day, to read with your child. It’s one of the greatest gifts you can give them.
text:
Kama mlezi, ushiriki wako katika ashughuli za kusoma ni muhimu katika kila umri – iwe watoto ni wachanga sana au ikiwa tayari wanajua kusoma.

Kila mlezi anaweza kumsaidia mtoto wake kwa kusoma – hata wale walio na shughuli nyingi au wasiojua kusoma.

Unaweza kutumia picha kutambulisha maneno na mawazo mapya kwa mtoto wako.

Wewe na mtoto wako mnaweza kutengeneza hadithi yenu wenyewe kupitia picha.

Unaweza kumuuliza mtoto wako maswali kuhusu hadithi, wahusika, na matukio.

Hii inatengeneza fursa muhimu za mazungumzo, kufikiria na kujifunza.

Familia zinaaposoma pamoja, watoto hujifunza kufurahia kusoma.

Msingi thabiti wa kusoma husaidia watoto kuwa na mafanikio shuleni na kwenye maisha yao hapo baadae.

Kwahiyo tenga dakika chache kwa siku, kila siku kusoma na mtoto wako. Ni moja ya zawadi kubwa unayoweza kuwapa.

SourceText: ParentApp provides many practical and fun activities that you can do without needing to read the book’s text.
text: Programu ya wazazi inatoa shughuli nyingi na za vitendo ambazo unaweza kufanya bila kuhitaji kusoma maandishi ya kitabu.

SourceText: Watch to learn more:
text: Tazama kujifunza zaidi:

SourceText:
Book activities are a great way to have fun together with your child. Let’s take a look at how you can share this book with your child in a playful and engaging way. 

This book is all about the joy of playing. Join Lesedi as his imagination takes him all the way to the beach for an adventure! 

Describe the pictures to your child and ask them questions about the story. Point to the sandbox and ask your chid: “What is this for?” Point to boy in the picture and ask: “How do you think he is feeling? What do you think he is going to do next?”

Mimic actions from the pictures or story. Together with your child, pretend to put your feet in the sand and wiggle your toes. Talk about what the sand would feel like? 

Mimic the sound of the wind swooping in and blowing the umbrella away. Demonstrate surprise and ask your child how they would feel if that happened to them. 

Remember, book activities do not have to be serious. The goal is to make it a playful experience. We hope you enjoy the book and have fun together!
text:
Shughuli za kitabu ni njia nzuri ya kufurahia pamoja na mtoto wako. Hebu tuangalie ni namna gani unaweza kushirikishana hiki kitabu na mtoto wako katika njia ya kucheza na kushiriki.

Kitabu hiki kinahusu furaha ya kucheza. Ungana na Lesed kama mawazo yake yanavyompeleka mbali ufukweni kuona mazingira.!

Muelezee mtoto wako picha na waulize maswali kuhusu hadithi. Onesha boksi la mchanga na muuliza mtoto wako: "Hii ni kwaajili ya nini?" Onesha mvulana katika picha na uliza:"Unafikiri anajiskiaje?" Unafikiri anaenda kufanya nini baada ya hapa?"

Igiza vitendo kutoka katika picha au hadithi. Pamoja na mtoto wako, igizeni kuweka miguu yenu kwenye mchanga na tikiseni vidole vyenu. Zunguma kuhusu mchanga ungejiskiaje?

Igiza sauti ya upepo ukiingia ndani na kuupiga mwamvuli mbali. Onyesha mshangao na muulize mtoto wako wangejiskiaje kama hii ingetokea kwao.

Kumbuka, shughuli za kitabu hazihitaji kuwa makini. Lengo ni kufanya iwe ya uzoefu kimchezo. Tunatumaini umefurahia kitabu na mmefurahia pamoja!

SourceText: Sharing books with young children isn’t something that we normally do in our homes or community. How does this fit in with our traditional practices?
text: Kushirikishana vitabu na watoto wadogo sio jambo ambalo kwa kawaida huwa tunafanya katika nyumba zetu au katika jamii. Je hii inalinganaje na desturi zetu za jadi?

SourceText: Great question. We know that in many cultures, including Africa, parents pass down values and life lessons to children through storytelling.
text: Swali zuri. Tunatambua kwamba tamaduni nyingi ikiwemo ya Africa. wazazi huwarithisha maadaili na mafunzo mbalimbali ya maisha kwa watoto wao kwa kutumia hadithi.

SourceText: Let’s look at some of the ways that book activities build on this tradition:
text: Hembu tuangalie baadhi ya njia ambazo shughuli za vitabu zimeundwa kutokana na tamaduni hizi:

SourceText:
Take a moment to think about some of the traditional stories that you were told as a child, and that you tell your child:

When do you tell stories? How do you tell the story? During the story, what do you do to keep children engaged? After the story, what do you discuss? 

Oral storytelling and book activities have many things in common: 
You use your voice to make the story interesting, with different voices for different characters.
You describe the characters and events in detail so that children understand what is happening and why. 
You connect and interact with your listeners. 
After the story, you ask or answer questions and discuss what can be learned from this story. 

The skills you use during oral storytelling works just as well for book activities. Oral storytelling is a great way to connect with children and help them learn, and book activities do the same!
text:
Chukua muda kufikiria kuhusu baadhi ya hadithi za kitamaduni ambazo ulisimuliwa ukiwa mtoto, unazoweza kumsimulia mtoto wako.
Unasimulia hadithi lini? unaisimuliaje hadithi? wakati wa hadithi, unafanya nini ili kuwafanya watoto wako washiriki? baada ya hadithi, unajadili nini?
Usimuliaji wa hadithi na shughuli za kitabu zina mambo mengi yanayofanana. unatumia sauti yako kuifanya haadithi ivutie, yenye sauti tofauti kwa wahusika tofauti. Unaelezea wahusika na matukio kwa undani ili watoto waelewe kinachotokea na kwanini.
Unaungana na kuchangamana na wasikilizaji wako.
Baada ya hadithi, unauliza au kujibu maswali na kujadili nini cha kujifunza kutoka kwenye hadithi hii.
Ujuzi unaotumia wakati wa kusimulia hadithi hutumika vilevile kwa shughuli za kitabu. Kusimulia hadithi kwa njia ya mdomo ni njia nzuri ya kuungana na watoto na kuwasaidia kujifunza na shughuli za vitabu hufanya hivyo hivyo!

SourceText: How can I do book activities if we don’t have any picture books at home?
text: Nitawezaje kufanya shughuli za kitabu kama hatuna kitabu chochote cha picha nyumbani?

SourceText: We know that many families across the world struggle to access picture books for their children, or have only one or two books at home.
text: Tunajua kwamba familia nyingi duniani zinapambana kupata vitabu vya picha kwaajili ya watoto wao, au wana kimoja au viwili nyumbani.

SourceText: The good news is that ParentApp has a library full of digital books that you can share with your child using your phone. We also provide guidance for how to use these books in different ways to support your child’s learning.
text: Habari njema ni kwamba, Programu ya wazazi ina maktaba iliyojaa vitabu vya kidijitali ambavyo unaweza kushirikishana na mtoto wako kwa kutumia simu yako. Pia tunatoa mwongozo kwaajili ya jinsi ya kutumia vitabu hivi kwa njia mbalimbali kusaidia kujifunza kwa mtoto wako.

SourceText: To get you started on your ParentApp journey, we’ve prepared some home activities for you:
text: Ili kukuwezesha kuanza safari ya Programu ya wazazi, tumekuandalia baadhi ya shughuli za nyumbani:

SourceText:
🤝 **Play activities for you and your child.** 
These activities provide opportunities to bond while also supporting your child’s learning.

📖 **Digital books to share with your child.** 
Find a comfortable place to sit and share one of the many books available in the app. 

😌 **Short but powerful relaxing activities.** 
Being a parent can be so stressful. Take a moment for yourself to relax, breathe or reflect.
text:
🤝 **Shughuli za mchezo kwaajili yako na mtoto wako.**
Shughuli hizi zinatoa fursa kuungana wakati huo pia inasaidia kujifunza kwa mtoto wako.

📖 **Vitabu vya kidijitali vya kushirikishana na mtoto wako.**
Tafuta mahali pazuri kukaa na kushirikishana kitabu kimoja kati ya vingi vinavyopatikana kwenye programu.

SourceText: Welcome!
text: Karibu!

SourceText: Caring for yourself
text: Kujijali wewe mwenyewe

SourceText: Caring for your child
text: Kutunza mtoto wako

SourceText: Learning through books
text: Kujifunza kupitia vitabu

SourceText: Ready to get started?
text: Upo tayari kuanza?

SourceText: JOIN
text: KUJIUNGA

SourceText: Welcome to the ParentApp for Kids community!
text: Karibu katika Jumuiya ya Programu ya wazazi kwa watoto!

SourceText: Well done for finishing the JOIN module!
text: Umefanya vyema kumalizia mada ya KUJIUNGA!

SourceText: CONNECT
text: KUUNGANA

SourceText: Making time to connect with your child helps build a strong and positive relationship.
text: Kutengeneza muda wa Kuungana na mtoto wako inasaidia kujenga uhusiano imara na chanya.

SourceText: Well done for finishing the CONNECT module!
text: Umefanya vizuri kumaliza mada ya KUUNGANA!

SourceText: CREATE
text: KUTENGENEZA

SourceText: Create a positive and supportive environment for your child to learn in.
text: Tengeneza mazingira chanya na saidizi kwaajili ya mtoto wako kujifunza.

SourceText: Well done for finishing the CREATE module!
text: Umefanya vizuri kumaliza mada ya KUTENGENEZA!

SourceText: PLAY
text: CHEZA

SourceText: Play is the best way for children to learn. Let’s look at ways to support your child through play.
text: Kucheza ni njia bora kwa watoto kujifunza. Hebu tuangalie njia za kumsaidia mtoto wako kupitia kucheza.

SourceText: Well done for finishing the PLAY module!
text: Umefanya vizuri kumaliza mada ya KUCHEZA!

SourceText: List of Things
text: Orodha ya vitu

SourceText:
Make a list of healthy activities that you like to do. Here are some suggestions:
* Listening to your favourite music
* Going for a walk (if possible)
* Doing some exercise
* Drinking a cup of tea by yourself
* Calling up a friend
* Singing, dancing, praying, or reading
* Sitting in the sun with your eyes closed
* Watching your favourite TV show

Pick one and do it today!
text:
Tengeneza orodha ya shughuli zinazoleta afya unazopenda kufanya. Hizi ni baadhi ya mapendekezo:
* Kusikiliza muziki unaoupenda
* Kwenda matembezini (kama inawezekana)
* Kufanya mazoezi
* Kunywa kikombe cha chai peke yako
* Kumpigia rafiki simu
* Kuimba, kucheza, kusali, au kusoma
* Kuketi juani huku umefumba macho
* Kutazama kipindi cha runinga unachokipenda

Chagua shughuli moja na uifanye leo!

SourceText: Take a moment for yourself first.
text: Chukua muda kwa ajili yako mwenyewe kwanza.

SourceText: It is great to hear you are feeling positive today. You make a real difference for your family!
text: Inafurahisha kusikia unajisikia vizuri leo. Unafanya mabadiliko ya kweli kwa familia yako!

SourceText: Life has its great and hard moments – that is okay. You are on the right track.
text: Maisha yana nyakati ngumu na nzuri - hiyo ni sawa. Uko kwenye njia sahihi.

SourceText: It is normal to have hard days as a parent. Take a deep breath and know you are not alone!
text: Ni kawaida kuwa na siku ngumu kama mzazi. Vuta pumzi ndefu na ujue hauko peke yako!

SourceText: How are you feeling today?
text: Unajisikiaje leo?

SourceText: Happy
text: Furaha

SourceText: Okay
text: Sawa

SourceText: Creating time and space for children to play is as important as eating and sleeping!
text: Kutengeneza muda na nafasi kwaajili ya watoto kucheza ni muhimu kama ilivyo kula na kulala!

SourceText: When you join your child in playful activities, you take their learning to the next level. You might even have some fun yourself.
text: Unapojiunga na mtoto wako katika shughuli za kucheza, unapeleka kujifunza kwao kwenye kiwango cha juu. Unaweza hata kujifurahisha mwenyewe.

SourceText: Sometimes children play with friends, and other times, on their own. Sometimes play is busy and loud, and other times it is quiet and relaxed. No matter what it looks like, when children play, they learn. Today we will look at ways you can support your child through play. You don’t need special toys or a lot of time. What’s important is that you have some fun together.
text: Wakati mwingine watoto hucheza na marafiki, na wakati mwingine peke yao. Wakati mwingine wanacheza sana na kwa sauti na nyakati zingine kunakuwa na ukimya na utulivu. Haijalishi inavyoonekana, watoto wanapocheza wanajifunza. Leo tutaangalia njia ambazo unaweza kuzitumia kumsaidia mtoto wako kupitia mchezo. Hauna haja ya kuwa na midoli maalumu au muda mwingi. Jambo muhimu ni kuwa na furaha pamoja.

SourceText: In @global.app_name, we use the image of a garden to think about what children need in their lives to grow and thrive. Let’s see how play forms a part of the garden image.
text: Katika @global.app_name, tunatumia picha ya bustani kufikiri kuhusu nini wanahitaji watoto katika maisha yao kukua na kustawi. Hembu tuone ni kwa namna gani mchezo unafanya sehemu ya picha ya bustani.
note: The string @global.app_name, should not be translated.

SourceText: The ParentApp Garden
text: Bustani ya Programu ya wazazi

SourceText: In the same way that fertiliser boosts plant growth, playing with your child is the magic ingredient that supercharges their learning and development.
text: Kama jinsi ilivyo mbolea, huongeza ukuaji wa mmea, kucheza na mtoto wako ni kiungo cha muhimu sana ambacho husaidia kujifunza kwao na ukuaji.

SourceText: Fertiliser or “plant food” boosts the quality of the soil around the plant and the plant’s growth. When you sprinkle playfulness throughout your interactions with your child, it will make a big difference to their development. It doesn’t have to be a lot at once, but doing it regularly can improve your relationship while also helping your child learn important skills.
text:
Mbolea au’’Chakula cha mmea’’ huongeza ubora wa udongo karibu na mmea na ukuaji wa mmea. Vivyo hivyo, mwingiliano wa kucheza na mtoto wako utaongeza uwezo wao wa kujifunza.
Ukijigawa na kuwa sehemu ya mchezo na mtoto wako muda wote, italeta mabadiliko makubwa katika ukuaji wao, si lazima iwe kwa kiasi kikubwa kwa mara moja, ila kwa kufanya mara kwa mara inaboresha uhusiano wako, huku pia ikimsaidia mtoto wako kujifunza juzi muhimu.

SourceText: There is no right or wrong way to play. The important thing is to have fun together.
text: Hakuna njia sahihi au mbaya ya kucheza. Kitu cha muhimu ni kufurahia pamoja.

SourceText: Here are some ideas for supporting your child through play:
text: Haya ni baadhi ya mawazo mbalimbali ya njia tofauti za kumsaidia mtoto wako kupitia mchezo:

SourceText:
**Create space and time for children to play.**

Children enjoy playing in the presence of their parents. Create space for them to play around you. Give your child praise and encouragement as they play.
text:
**Tengeneza nafasi na muda wa watoto kucheza.**

Watoto hufurahia kucheza mbele ya wazazi wao. Watengenezee nafasi ya kucheza karibu yako. Msifie mtoto wako na mtie moyo wanapocheza.

SourceText:
**Join your child in their play from time to time.** 
Look for opportunities to sit down and engage in a positive way with what your child is doing. Even 10 minutes will boost your child’s development.
text:
**Jiunge na mtoto wako katika mchezo wao mara kwa mara.**
Tafuta fursa ili kukaa chini na kushiriki kwa njia chanya na kile anachofanya mtoto wako. Hata dakika kumi itaongeza maendeleo ya mtoto wako.

SourceText: Connecting with your child in a playful way every day helps your child to feel close to you, and it helps them to grow and learn. Joining your child in play does not mean taking over what they are doing or telling them what to do differently. It means being part of the activity in a way that your child will enjoy.
text: Kuungana na mtoto wako kwa njia ya kimichezo kila siku husaidia mtoto wako kujiskia yuko karibu na wewe, na huwasaidia kukua na kujifunza. Kujiunga na mtoto wako kwa njia ya kimchezo haimaanishi ni kuwanyang'anya wanachofanya au kuwaambia wafanye nini tofauti. Inamaanisha kuwa sehemu ya shughuli kwa mtindo ambao mtoto wako atafurahia.

SourceText:
**Keep it joyful and fun!**
Being playful does not mean that your child won’t respect you or take you seriously: play actually helps to strengthen your relationship with your child. And when relationships are strong, dealing with stress and challenges become easier.
text:
**Endelea kufanya iwe ya furaha na kuburudisha!**
Kuwa kimchezo haimaanishi kuwa mtoto wako hatakuheshimu au kutokukuchukulia kwa uzito unaotakiwa: mchezo kimsingin husaidia kuimarisha uhusiano wenu na mtoto wako. Na pale ambapo mahusiano ni imara, kushughulika na msongo wa mawazo na changamoto inakuwa rahisi.

SourceText: Let’s hear from a caregiver:
text: Ngoja tusikie kutoka kwa mlezi:

SourceText:
When I first heard that playing with my child was important, I was not interested in trying it. My father never used to play with me when I was a child. I didn’t think it was something that parents do. But one day, I saw my child playing outside and I decided to take a closer look. I was actually amazed at what my child had built with just rocks, sticks and some cardboard boxes. I told my child I thought that it looked really great. Together we created animals using cardboard pieces and some sticks. It was quite fun to build something together, and to see how much my child enjoyed it.

I really like that ParentApp has suggestions for different activities that I can do with my child. It makes it easier for me to decide what to do when my child and I are together.
text:
Mara ya kwanza niliposikia kwamba kucheza na mtoto wangu ni muhimu, sikuvutiwa kujaribu. Baba yangu hakuwahi kucheza na mimi nilipokuwa mtoto, sikufikiria kuwa ni jambo ambalo wazazi wanafanya. Lakini siku moja nilimuona mtoto wangu anacheza nje, niliamua kuangalia kwa ukaribu. Kwa kweli nilishangazwa na kile mtoto wangu alichokuwa amejenga kwa mawe na kwa vijiti tu na baadhi ya maboksi. Nilimwambia mtoto wangu nadhani inaonekana nzuri kweli. Pamoja tukatengeneza wanyama kwa kutumia mawe, vipande vya maboksi na baadhi ya vijiti. Ilikuwa ni furaha sana kujenga kitu pamoja na kuona jinsi mtoto wangu alivyofurahi.

Nimeipenda sana Programu ya wazazi ina mapendekezo ya shughuli mbalimbali ambazo naweza kufanya na mtoto wangu. inafanya iwe rahisi kwangu kuamua nini cha kufanya tukiwa pamoja na mtoto wangu.

SourceText: Did you know that you can use play to your advantage?
text: Ulijua kwamba unaweza kutumia kucheza kwa faida yako?

SourceText: Playful interactions can help your child cooperate and follow instructions.
text: Ukishiriki kucheza unaweza kumsaidia mtoto wako kushirikiana na kufuata maelekezo.

SourceText: Listen to learn more:
text: Sikiliza ujifunze zaidi:

SourceText:
Sometimes children don’t want to cooperate or listen, which is very frustrating for parents. Our first reaction might be to yell, scream or threaten our child so that they will listen or do as we say. This may seem like a good idea in the moment, but it doesn’t help us or our children long term.  
Because children love to play games, be silly and have fun, you can use this to help your child cooperate and complete tasks. They won’t even realise they are doing as they are told!
text: Wakati mwingine watoto hawataki kushirikiana au kusikiliza, jambo ambalo linachanganya wazazi.  Kitu tunachofanya cha kwanza inaweza kuwa ni kuwakaripia, kuwagombeza au kuwatisha watoto wetu ili wasikie au wafanye kama tunavyowaambia. Hili linaweza kuonekana kama ni wazo zuri kwa wakati huo, lakini haitusaidii sisi au watoto wetu  kwa kipindi kirefu. Kwa Sababu watoto wanapenda kucheza michezo, kufanya mizaha, na kufanya vichekesho vya kujifurahisha, unaweza kutumia hii kusaidia mtoto wako kushirikiana na kukamilisha kazi. Hawawezi kufikiria hata kuwa wanafanya kama walivyoambiwa!

SourceText: It is normal to feel frustrated when our children don’t cooperate. But sometimes it can be more effective to work *with* your child than *against* them.
text: Ni kawaida kujiskia kuchanganyikiwa pale watoto wetu wanapokuwa hawatoi ushirikiano. Lakini wakati mwingine inaweza kuwa na mtokeo zaidi kufanya kazi *na* mtoto wako kuliko kufanya kazi *dhidi* yao.

SourceText: Playful interactions are a great way to do this. **Let’s take a look at an example:**
text: Muingiliano/kucheza pamoja ni njia nzuri kufanya hili. **Hebu tuangalie mfano:**

SourceText: I don't want to go to sleep!
text: Sitaki kwenda kulala!

SourceText:
"Goodnight, Nandi."

"I don’t want to go to sleep!"
text:
"' Usiku mwema, Nandi"
'' Sitaki kwenda kulala"

SourceText:
"That’s enough now. Goodnight, Nandi."

"I ... don’t ... want ... to ... go ... to ... sleep."
text:
''Hii inatosha sasa. Usiku mwema Nandi.''
''Sitaki... kwe... nda... kulala.''

SourceText:
"I want more supper. Another book! Just one more song?" 

"Goodnight, Nandi."

"I don’t want to go to sleep!"
text:
''Nataka zaidi chakula cha usiku. Kitabu kingine! wimbo mmoja tu zaidi?

''Usiku mwema Nandi.''

''Sitaki kwenda kulala!''

SourceText:
"MAMA! ...I need a glass of water. Please? Please." 

"It’s time to go to sleep now. Goodnight, Nandi."

"I DON’T WANT TO GO TO SLEEP!"
text:
"MAMA!... Tafadhali nahitaji bilauri ya maji? Tafadhali." 

"Ni muda wa kwenda kulala sasa. Usiku mwema, Nandi"

''SITAKI KWENDA KULALA!''

SourceText:
Mama sighs: "What about an adventure? Do you want an adventure?"

"...yes..."
text:
Mama anavuta pumzi: "Vipi kuhusu matembezi? Unataka kutembea kuona mazingira?"

''...ndio...''

SourceText:
"Do you want to creep through the jungle on the trail of the fearsome hippocrocoturtleduck?"

"Yes! Yes! Yes!"
text:
''Je unataka kutambaa kupitia msituni kwenye njia ya kiboko ya kutisha?

''Ndio! Ndio! Ndio!''

SourceText: "I want to fly across the sky! Leap from star to star! Fill my pockets with stardust!"
text: ''Nataka kupaa kuzunguka anga! Kuruka kutoka nyota hadi nyota! Kujaza mifuko yangu na vumbi la nyota!''

SourceText: "I want a Nandi-sized glass submarine to see the creatures at the bottom of the ocean! And a pet giant squid to do water ballet there with me!"
text: "Nataka miwani kubwa kama ya Nandi ya kutumia kwenye manowari kutazama viumbe chini ya bahari na pweza mzuri na mkubwa wacheze na mimi kwenye maji!"

SourceText: "I want to build myself a pair of butterfly wings and zoom to the roof of the sky where I’ll see all the world and everything in it!"
text: ''Nataka kujitengenezea mabawa ya kipepeo na kuvuta hadi mawinguni ambapo nitauona ulimwengu wote na kila kitu ndani yake!''

SourceText: "Look here, Nandi. Here is your very own adventure boat. It’s waiting to take you wherever you want to go. See, put your head here...that’s right...and I’ll just tuck you in...there we go...now, off you go! Adventure awaits ..."
text: "Tazama hapa Nandi. Hii ni boti yako kabisa ya kujivinjari. Inakusubiri ikupeleke popote unapotaka.Ona, weka kichwa chako hapa..., hiyo ni sawa... na nitakuvutia ndani... sasa tunaenda... ondoka! kujivinjari kunakusubiri"

SourceText: "Goodnight, Nandi."
text: ''Usiku mwema Nandi'',

SourceText: Question time
text: Muda wa maswali

SourceText: Let’s think about what happened in this story:
text: Hembu tufikiri kuhusu nini kilitokea katika hadithi hii:

SourceText: How did the mother feel when Nandi didn’t want to go to sleep?
text: Mama alijiskiaje pale ambapo Nandi hakutaka kwenda kulala?

SourceText: Frustrated
text: Kuchanganyikiwa

SourceText: Angry
text: Hasira

SourceText: Tired
text: Uchovu

SourceText: Yes, the mother may have been feeling all of these things. It can be really difficult when our children do not want to go to sleep.
text: Ndio, huenda mama amekuwa akijiskia vyote hivi, inaweza kuwa vigumu kweli pale watoto wetu wanapokuwa hawataki kwenda kulala.

SourceText: Question time:
text: Muda wa maswali:

SourceText: What did her mother do to help her fall asleep?
text: Mama alifanya nini kumsaidia alale?

SourceText: She shouted at Nandi: “Just go to sleep!”
text: Alimkaripia Nandi: ''Hembu nenda kalale!''

SourceText: While we can understand why Nandi’s mother would feel like shouting, Nandi’s mom did something clever. She and Nandi created a fun story together that helped Nandi to fall asleep.
text: Ingawa tunaweza kuelewa ni kwa nini mama yake Nandi angehisi kutaka kupiga kelele, Mama yake Nandi alifanya jambo la busara. Yeye na Nandi walitunga hadithi ya kufurahisha pamoja ambayo ilimsaidia Nandi kulala.

SourceText: She ignored Nandi and left her alone.
text: Alimpuuza Nandi na alimwacha peke yake.

SourceText: While we can understand why Nandi’s mother would feel like ignoring her, Nandi’s mom went to go sit with her. She and Nandi created a fun story together that helped Nandi fall asleep.
